Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Kat S
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. Unfortunately, we got confused and booked through an agency, which failed to send us any kind of confirmation - but when I emailed the hotel directly, I literally got a reply in less than five minutes. When we arrived, we discovered the agency had sold us a 'superior' room which was not available - be sure you actually contact the hotel directly for the best reservation possible. Despite that and our post-midnight arrival, the hotel staff was extremely gracious, explained that they only had a regular room available, and despite the hour, gave us suggestions for where to go in Paris. The rooms are typical, small Paris rooms, but I was pleased that both the regular room we had for three nights and the 'comfort' room we had for one night both had bathtubs. The deluxe room had a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony, and as an apology for the hassle of switching, the hotel included a bottle of champagne for our last night. The location is great, though I recommend taking the bus/Metro from the airport, not the RER, which makes for a longer walk from the nearest RER-C stop. You want the Ecole Militaire stop on the metro. The location in the Rue Cler district was great, with short walks to food, grocery stores, Les Invalides, the Army Museum, and more. The staff was absolutely wonderful. Julia, in particular, was so friendly, gracious and helpful. She provided some excellent site-seeing ideas, booked our shuttle back to the airport and dinner reservations, and was very apologetic about the mistake regarding the room (she was the one who suggested always contacting the hotel directly). There is a mini-bar in the room, a small bar in the lobby, and breakfast in the cellar. I would skip breakfast unless you are in a major hurry - with great Parisian restaurants nearby, why eat at the hotel? Particularly when the available choices downstairs were fairly slim - eggs, some fried ham, one type of cold cuts, a few types of coffee, croissants. It wasn't horrible; but I've seen better hotel spreads elsewhere in Europe and at other hotels in Paris. Plus, good food abounds in the Rue Cler district. LIkewise, the bed was rather firm, which may work for you, or not. Overall, the location and staff 'made' this stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: CarieM0312
Reviews.Content: I'll first start with The Good: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Particularly the evening gentleman (didnt get his name). Very professional and knowledgable. The hotel is updated with clean furnishings and nice wall paper in the rooms. It has a working elevator and air conditioning. Close to the Eiffel Tower if you dont mind the walk. Even from the 2nd floor, we had a view of the Tower. Very clean. The Bad: The rooms are so small that there is only room to store 1 suitcase. My husband and I tripped over the remaining suitcases and eachother the whole time- it got frustrating. The shower has a full tub, but the glass enclosure only covers half of the tub. Every time we showered, the water would get all over the floor, the toilet, and 2 towels were not enough to soak up the mess. The Ugly: MOLD!! We noticed that behind the wall paper, there was black mold growing next to the window in both the bathroom and the bedroom. Every time we entered the room, it had a musty smell. We would open the windows to air it out and lit a travel candle to kill the smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jpginger30
Reviews.Content: Would stay at this hotel again as great location, especially for Eiffel tower. The staff especially Justine were so helpful during our stay. If you get the right room you hava a great view of the tower. We did have 2 rooms during our short stay due to an error in our booking ( not the hotels fault ) so in seeing 2 different types of room I would say the rooms were on the small side but it would not put me off staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service by staff”
Reviews.Author: BigDtravlr
Reviews.Content: Although our comfort roomwith a queen bed was smallish for two people staying in Paris five days (approx. 120-140 sq.ft?), we eventually found niches and shelves for all our stuff. I would definitely recomment the superior rooms, but they were all gone by the time I made our reservations. The bathroom was very modern with tub and shower, and the bed was firm and comfortable with nice linen. The hotel is two blocks from the metro and grocery store. We took out the mini fridge contents and put in our own snacks. Julia at the front desk was the best part of our experience. She and her staff couldn't have been more helpful in many different ways -- directions, loan of a knife, advice on how to call a different country, etc. The neighborhood is very nice, but not as exciting as Ile St. Louis where we have stayed previously. However, since it was Easter weekend, we were very glad to be away from the crazy crowds. The a/c works well, and the windows open wide, if you don't mind street noise. We found the hotel to be very quiet inside. We did not try the breakfast. The Wi-fi worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but charming!”
Reviews.Author: Vera L
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the lift was non-functioning but was being repaired when we arrived. The staff asked the repair people to allow us to use the elevator to take our luggage up to the Third floor, but we had to walk down. The next day we discovered that the lift had been out-of-service for several weeks. One could go up but, the elevator call button would not bring the elevator to the 3rd floor so one could ride down. The stairs were small and curved, but we managed. Overall, a fairly major inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “The numbers speak for themselves”
Reviews.Author: 2-2-go-4-fun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from several days in Paris, staying at the Hotel Duquesne. Having lived and worked in western Europe for several years and spent a number of opportunities visiting Paris during that time, we can say, without reservation, that the Hotel Duquesne is the best hotel we've ever stayed at in Paris. The staff goes out of their way to assist in anyway possible. The breakfast each morning was fantastic! The ladies providing the morning breakfast were an absolute delight! The location is superb and our room had a fantastic direct view of the Eiffel Tower. We were in room #15, which is a corner room with a completely unobstructed view. I noticed one review that complained of not having a good view of the tower, even though they we in room #35, which has an even better view than we had. Some people will never be happy, no matter what is done for them or available to them. One thing Americans should remember when in Europe is that hotel rooms are generally smaller than they are use to in the states. With that in mind, our room might have been small by US standards but was very nice, very comfortable and impecably clean at the Hotel Duquesne. You should keep in mind that you're in PARIS! Your NOT there to spend all your time in your hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, marbled bathroom, wonderful staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey M
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my one-night stay at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. The location of the hotel couldn't be better-a nice neighborhood with plenty of cafes, trees, and a taxi stand within walking distance. The hotel staff were wonderful-very helpful-you can store your luggage with no problems until your room is ready. Nice small lobby with availability for coffee, espresso, juice and wine, etc. One computer, free-of-charge. Typical small lift with enough room for 2 persons with 2 suitcases. Nice breakfast in the morning which included eggs, sausage, croissants, fruit, cereal, hot chocolate for the kids, a pot of black American coffee. Wonderful duvets, very comfortable beds and extremely clean. We had a balcony and you could open the large windows and look at the Eiffel at night or the people below. The rooms were very quiet because the windows were made for noise reduction. Everything about this hotel stated, "Smaller hotel, mid-sized room (for Europe), clean, nice staff with a smaller price tag." What could be better?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cardak1990
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the hotel in mid March, we read wonderful reviews about the hotel and that's why we decided to stay. About five months before we went I contacted the hotel and asked for a room with a view of the tower and opening doors. When we arrived the receptionist was really nice and helpful. However, the dissapointment set in when we arrived to the room and seen nothing but a large building under renovations. I went back down stairs and told the receptionist that I think we were in the wrong room because the room we requested, and paid extra for had a view. She then tells me that I can see the tower I just have to look out the window. I went back upstairs and opened the windows, I had to lean ALL the way out the window to see just the top of it. It was our anniversary and I had planned everything to a T and this was so disappointing, I left mislead and lied to. The hotel room it's self was brand new, it was very clean and modern. All the employees were helpful and nice. Breakfast every morning was really simple and small just three types of pastries, ham and eggs (after four mornings you begin to get bored of it). There was no fresh fruit, just canned fruit cocktail. My advice is if you are looking for somewhere close to a metro station with excellent customer service, this is your place. But if you want a romantic get away stay far way from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JenandChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June 2011. The hotel is conveniently located just opposite the military school. literally round the corner from Les Invalides and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Its relative small size is its best selling point. All the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was small which is, we understand, par for the course in Paris and you just need to accept that. It might be worth considering an upgrade to one of the bigger rooms so that you get that Eiffel Tower view. The bathroom was also very compact but functional. Really nice area with Metro stops and good local shopping include the Rue Cler which has examples of every type of stereotypical French shop you can imagine - great for remembering your Higher Grade French!Lots of nice places to eat - special mention the for 7eme Vin bistro. Whenever you have message they write it on a tiny blackboard next to the lift! They acted on our behalf when we experienced big problems with the bus tour company - see our review of that - and got our money back for us. Free internet in the lobby via their Apple Mac. We would certainly stay there again but maybe in a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: fashionperspective
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Staff is exceptional, charming breakfast room and a fabulous location. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little boutique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AbbyPalmer
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend break in Paris, we stayed at the duquesne Eiffel for 3 nights and had a lovely stay. The hotel is about a 10 minute stroll from the Eiffel tower, and 15 minutes from Montparnasse. The nearest metro station was only 3-4 mins away (ecole militaire) which is on line eight and seems to be very central, we only used the metro and found it very quick and easy. We had a superior room on the fifth floor (room 54) which was lovely, the level of cleanliness was excellent, the staff were all very friendly and extremely knowledgable about the area, and we certainly picked their brains enough! They gave us advise on the metro, opening times of places, restaurant recommendations (very good restaurants) and even put a half bottle of champagne and a card saying 'happy anniversary' in the room as we told them it was our anniversary, which was a lovely surprise when we got to our room. You can also book a shuttle from Charles de gaulle airport to the hotel via the hotel by emailing them your flight details, which was 36€ for two, but got cheaper the more people there are. We found this very convienient as it is only about 25 mins from the hotel and much better then getting the trains. The view from our balcony was fantastic, we had the eiffel tower one way, and montparnasse in the other, it is on a main road which seems to be quite on the weekend but busy during the week, however this was not a problem as the double glazing was very good. The mini bar is very reasonably priced, and although there are no tea or coffee making facilities you can request it from reception (there is no room service as it is a little boutique so you do have to go and ask) however we didn't feel that this was a problem. The shower was really nice and powerful which is unusual but very welcome, although larger people may find there is not much space in the shower. Breakfast was really good, a very French selection of bacon and eggs, crossiants, pain au chocalat and bread with a selection of preserves and yogurts. Breakfast is self service but tea and coffee are sever by the pleasant breakfast staff, in a lovely cellar which is bright but cosy. We had no complaints with the hotel and are already planning to go back to Paris (which we loved) and when we do we will definately stay at the Duquesene Eiffel, and would urge everyone to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy G
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was incredibly helpful - from booking a room with a view via email months prior to our trip, reserving a shuttle from the airport, calling a cab for us and even providing stamps to mail last minute postcards. The hotel is incredibly quiet and extremely clean (and the bed was sooo comfortable!). We did not have any problems at all with the hotel or our room. The location was great - only 2 blocks from the metro and surrounded by great restaurants. We stayed in Room 56 which has a balcony and an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Abdulrahman4
Reviews.Content: i arrived at 09:00 am after a long flight and welcomed with friendly helpful front desk employees who managed to make me early check-in which made my day. staying for 4 night at this nice cozy hotel was relaxing experience. The room is Parisian standard small but clean and bed is comfy . Rue de cler is 2 blocks way where you can enjoy a nice breakfast or buy some fresh fruites. Eiffel towers is less 10 minutes walk and 25 minutes to champs Elysee . Metro and carrefour supermarket is one block way .

Reviews.Title: “Good central location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shenjan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel for business in March 2012. It's in a great location with views of the Eiffel Tower (hence the name). The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel rooms although small, were clean and had all the amenities. If you're looking for an averaged priced, central hotel, go for the Duquesne and its within walking distance from Invalides and Eiffel and many other hot spots in Paris. Also visit the 'Louis Vuitton of Cheese shops' as stated by the receptions on Rue de Mar and also eat at the No. 7 Restaurant just down the street for a memorable dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view of Eiffel Tower from Balcony WOW!”
Reviews.Author: love2shoplots
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to this hotel for a romantic special birthday trip last November 2011. Having never been to Paris before and spending many many weeks trawling the internet for a hotel with a view - this did not disappoint. We decided to get a room on the 5th floor with a balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower and paid extra for this. Also we booked direct with the hotel to assure we would get the room we desired. We had paid more than if we booked elsewhere but we had the confirmation of the room number and a cancellation up to the day before so we felt this was worth it. We were greeted by a very very helpful and polite receptionist who spoke very good English and always smiled which made us feel very welcome. We stepped out onto our balcony and WOW is all I can say the Eiffel tower was in view and was fantastic at night also when it has a light show on the hour. We both felt we could not have picked a better hotel for the view was amazing and we knew we were definitely in Paris. The room was very clean and neat and comfortable ok not the biggest but we knew that this is typical of most hotel rooms in Paris and as I keep saying the view was really all we could rave about. We chose not to eat breakfast there as we were out all day every day. The metro is just a few minutes down the road. Also we used the Batobus to get on and off the tourist attractions which we found excellent value for money, just past the Eiffel Tower about 15 minutes walk away from the hotel. I can honestly say if we were ever to return to Paris again we would definitely choose this hotel again - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely enjoyable stay with fantastic views!”
Reviews.Author: djconroy86
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say how helpful the hotel staff were before arrival. I booked the hotel direct via email and asks them for a room with a view as this would be our first visit to Paris and a surprise birthday present for the missus, so as romantic as possible. A week before arrival I received an email saying scaffolding would be up and could potentially spoil the view. I am glad they sent this as if I had arrived without forewarning I would be very disappointed. We found the hotel easily enough from metro station about 5 minutes walk away and were happy to see the scaffolding not up against the building but dismantled infront of the building ready for removal. We had arrived 4 hours before check in so were not expecting our room to be ready. I had emailed them to say we would be early and asked if we could store our luggage while we explored the city. To our delight the room was ready so, after our friendly hotelier assured us that if we needed any advise, or information we needn't hesitate to ask, we took THE ELEVATOR up the our room, (number 45). I can't tell you how happy the number 45 made me after reading TripAdvisor reviews I knew this was a good room. And we weren't let down. Clean, more than enough room, the most comfortable bed (haven't slept so well in a long time) and the view! It was perfect. It might be worth adding that during our stay I needed some advise on where to eat and was very happy with where we found ourselves having taken the advise given. All in all a very enjoyable stay, friendly staff, beautiful room and would definitely recommend to anyone who cares to hear it. Also breakfast was nice and not too expensive like some hotels. We will be back, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great honest hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: blimpernator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 13th - 15th February 2012 in a superior room on the fifth floor. Upon arrival we we're greeted with scaffolding across the outside of the building which was a little surprising however to quote another reviewer ... at least the building is been maintained. We were provided with a complimentary bottle of champagne on the final night which was a nice gesture. Additionally, one final negative was that the lift was out of action due to the work been undertaken however we were provided with a free breakfast for the duration of our visit which was great. The food was tasty with a good selection to choose from. We found all the staff a great help. The girls on the front were friendly and helpful. The maids did a good job and were friendly. The workmen in the building were respectful & considerate of guests. The room was great - rooms in Paris are small but this was spacious enough for 2 messy people with bags without it feeling cramped. The only minor issue for me was that the beds were 2 singles pushed together and not a standalone double. The view from our room on the 5th floor was great despite the scaffolding. The beds were comfortable. There was a good selection of reasonably priced drinks in the mini-bar. The free wireless was fast and worked well - no issues at all. Overall the hotel was clean and everything aside from the lift was in working order. There was plenty of hot water available. The shower was powerful. If I was to visit Paris again I certainly would stay here and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends & family. Considering the scaffolding and lift issue this goes to show how much I rate the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: beardiebloke
Reviews.Content: I find it really hard to fault this place. There was scafolding up outside of the window but that's not much of a problem and good to see they're maintaining it. You could see the Eiffel Tower from the window but only if you lean out a bit! Everything looked really clean and the bed was comfortable. I think the main thing I liked was that all the staff were very friendly and patient. The only problem we had was noisy neighbors on a Saturday night - one call to reception and it stopped so quite pleased with that.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachael G
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel between 23rd Feb - 26th Feb and choose to pay for a supierior room as we were celebrating my husband's 30th. We asked the hotel in advance for a room with a view and were lucky enough to be allocated room 45, which was completely out of this world!!! The view of the Eiffel Tower was magical. I would recommend anyone to upgrade and give enough time to request a great view. Although there was scaffolding erected on the property at the time of our stay this did not inpose on our view one bit, so I can't understand the negative posts. The superior rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable. We definitely benefited from the triple glazed windows as the room was very quiet. The hotel is situated in a great area and very close to some great bars, cafes & patiserries - great for an early morning croissant. We were recommended an evening meal at 7 Vin (ask the hotel staff where to find this) which served the most amazing food. Get there before 8pm though as the restaurant is very small and fills up very quickly. We also visited Central Cafe on Rue Cler which we loved as the bar has a happy hour and again serves great food. I would HIGHLY recommend the shuttle bus the hotel offers to & from the airport, however after a certain time this isn't available. I believe the last trip is around 7pm. The taxi from the airport to the hotel cost us €60 so the hotel shuttle at €36 for two people for one way is a bargin!!! We will most certainly be visiting this hotel again, but will try to request Room 55! I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: raincityk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011. We had a wonderful time. The room was great (we had a comfort room, so larger than standard). The staff was VERY pleasant and helpful. It was a quick 2 block walk to a Metro station. Would stay here again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Nice Staff, Great Metro connections”
Reviews.Author: Natali P
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a nice spot close to the Eiffel Tower. You'll enjoy the view of the Tower while it gleams in the day time and shimmers at night from the room. The hotel is conveniently located near the Metro stop. The accomodations were comfortable and clean. Hotel staff was pleasant and very helpful. You can ask them everything You want to know, because they are very knowledgeable about the attractions of the City; also very good english. A wonderful traveling experience. When We come back to this beautiful City, We definitely return again in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: scenesteruk
Reviews.Content: Picked this for a business trip - right around the corner from the Eiffel Tower, UNESCO building etc. Not cheap or very close to the main tourist attractions (apart from Eiffel Tower) so probably wouldn't stay there for a short break although it would do just fine - if you can afford the price tag and don't mind travelling to other areas to eat. It's also close to the metro. Food and drink options nearby are a bit limited and reflect the upmarket location. Wi-Fi in rooms worked fine. Had a lovely big room, separate bathroom and WC. Staff very friendly at reception and in the breakfast room. Scaffolding was up when I stayed so no view of the Eiffel Tower but apart from that no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Svenners123
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 days and it is one of the best city hotel that I have stayed in. We stayed in room 45 large room with an amazing view of the Eiffel tower. Everybody was going on about the size of the rooms being too small...rubbish our room was large, smart and the bed is one of the biggest, comfiest beds we have stayed in. The lift was not working when we arrived so the hotel arranged for a very nice chap to take our bags up the four floors to out room and they also gave us a free glass of champagne. This was a very nice touch. The location is fab, close to the tower, metro and les invalides also there are so many restaurants close by to choose from. i strongly recommend l'entrecote and La Terrasse (about 2mins walk from the hotel door). The staff in the hotel made us feel warm and welcome as soon as we arrived and if we needed anything they would be on hand. We hope to come back and visit very soon and will be staying here again as the time we had will be unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Norm367
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel close to attractions and the Metro. Service was good, and the breakfast very nicely done. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris many times but this was the first time staying at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the location is fantastic. Good restaurants just around the corner and the metro close as well. We had 2 families staying for a few days, so we had 4 rooms between us, and they were all lovely. They were quite small but we had one superior room and it was spacious, and that was all we needed. The Eiffel Tower views were excellent. We will go back there, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Comfort”
Reviews.Author: bigb77
Reviews.Content: First, and most importantly, we stayed in room 54 with a small balcony and a gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower. The location is great - nice walk to Champs etc but also conveniently situated close enough to a metro for further trips. The neighborhood is amazing, so many small typically parisian streets, esp Rue Cler. The staff were a delight and were very helpful and courteous. Yes the rooms are small but it is Paris after all. We only stayed 2 nights so perhaps the size of the room would be more important if staying longer. The bed is so comfortable and the bathroom is adequately sized so we had no real problems with the room. In any case, yur in Paris, why spend all your time in the room!! We did not have breakfast so can't comment on that. Overall I highly recommend this sweet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Central Location, English Speaking and Lovely couples retreat”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris with my girlfriend in December 2011. This was a suprise birthday present for her and when I was researching I wanted to find a good quality hotel close to the Eiffel Tower / Central Paris that was a decent price. BINGO. I did some searching round trip advisor and this directed me to the Hotel Duquense. A previous user had recommended Rooms 45 or 55 and if anyone wants a romantic view to add to their Hotel expereince, make contact with the hotel and ask for one of these rooms. The view of the tower is amazing. We sat in our room looking out the big windows at the sparkling Eiffel Tower literally outside the window. I asked for either room and we ended up with room 45, I think 55 might be even better! We arrived at Gare du Nord and after a short wait for a taxi outside we got a cab to the Hotel. Only a 10-15 min trip and about 18 euros should sort it. Be aware taxi's charge extra for bags so that 18 euros is a total of everything. The hotel staff were fluent in english and were really helpful for suggesting places to eat and where to head. We were only in Paris for a long weekend and may I recommend the bus tours round the city. An awesome way to see all the city and get some info about everything you see. We picked the bus up from the bottom of the Eiffel Tower (should prob say this is only a 5-10 min walk from the Hotel). You can see the tower from the hotel and its a very easy walk to navigate. The busses go round all the expected landmarks and you can get off and back on at your leisure. Also the boat trips down the Seine are great, not overly expensive but a lovely afternoon trip. We decided to go back to the boats for an evening dinner cruise, which was lovely for a romantic trip for 2. There were lots of larger tables but the food and service was great for everyone. This trip was a little expensive but well worth it if anyone wants to take their other half on a romantic dinner trip. Overall the hotel was perfect. Great staff, ideal location, clean, and friendly. There are lots of mega expensive hotels in paris but I'd say this one is very reasonably priced but also has the quality. Recommend it to all couples looking for a romantic retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location, Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: shangri-lada
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here as went to stay with friends for the subsequent two during our time in Paris, but I would certainly stay here again. I chose the hotel as it was reasonably priced and definitely the nicest looking and best location out of my short list. After a short trip on the metro the hotel was a few minutes’ walk from the station and easy to find. The receptionist was very friendly and check in no problem. Our friend was given a standard room with a double bed plus single and separate bathroom and toilet. We thought our room was going to be directly above his and so we were expecting the same but we had booked a deluxe room and so had a lovely surprise when we entered the room to see it was completely different layout, a little more spacious and with a balcony. Stepping out on the balcony and seeing the Eiffel Tower was unforgettable- it was unexpected and we were pretty amazed, despite having visited Paris and seen the tower a few times before. Our room was numbered but was also called Arc de Triomphe and was on the 5th floor. We weren’t in the hotel for long enough to really appreciate everything but the rooms were a good size, lovely furnishings and a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was nice with a lovely rose body lotion amongst the toiletries. The reception area was contemporary and the girls on reception were really very friendly, happy and helpful. I realised two days after checking out that I had left some boots in the wardrobe so gave the hotel a call and they had them (unfortunately there had been many items left that day and so they were unable to know exactly what was left in each room, so were very pleased and apologetic when we called up!). We drove to the hotel and the boots were there for me so I was pleased! The hotel is in a great location just 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and if like us you decide not to have breakfast in the hotel there is an amazing bakery just around the corner; we spent a small fortune in there then sat in the grounds of the tower to eat. Can’t remember the name of it but was opposite a nice restaurant that I’d recommend called Le Bosquet. We also went to Cafe des Officiers at the end of the road. All in all a great location and hotel to stay in Paris and i would highly recommend. For the price we paid and the location it is situated and the time of year (a day or so before New Years Eve) it was fantastic value .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: pgfla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to the Eiffel tower, and is close to many good cafe's. There is a little grocery about a block away as well. Hotel was clean, in a safe area and the staff was very helpful. The room was small, but we had a fabulous view out our window of the Eiffel Tower. Very nice hotel, and would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Campbellhenderson
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean room and a great location this is the hotel for you. We found the staff to be very friendly and even gave us a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower which I requested at the time of booking. The location is also fantastic, only 15 mins from the Eiffel Tower, very close to Metro & hop on hop off bus stop. Overall we had a fantastic stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and comfy beds - always a must have!!”
Reviews.Author: turtle10690
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the New Year's period - the Hotel had good first impressions with ALL staff A* and always eager to help! Even the breakfast staff were very friendly. We had a standard room at the back of the hotel, and although small it was fine for what we needed! I would say that a larger couple would struggle or anyone with more than 2 cases! The bed was gorgeously comfortable and every day the sheets were changed and the room was cleaned to an excellent standard... maybe a little too well, as one day we came back to find our last bottle of water had been thrown out! One small criticism would be the breakfast - the buffet did have a good choice of foods however when we went down at 10am or even earlier every day (breakfast is served until 10.30), there was never any hot breakfast left! And no toast or water provided either which was a shock! Apart from that, a lovely hotel in a good location near a metro station. We found that the area is a little expensive but found a GREAT (but more touristic) area to eat most nights right next to the Notre Dame, which I'd recommend for couples of families!

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Hoped it Would be”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Watters
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all we hoped it would be. All the front desk attendants spoke English. The hotel is small but having been recently renovated, it was extremely well decorated, clean, and inviting. It is equipped with an elevator although it is the smallest elevator I have ever seen. We had a third floor room with a view of the Tour Eiffel and it was magnificent. The room was a good size, had a flat screen tv, and a desk. The beds were a little firm for our tastes but comfortable and the room was quiet at night. The location of the hotel is great. It is just short of a one mile's walk to the Tour Eiffel. There is a metro stop a couple of blocks away which get you everywhere else you want to go. My wife and I would happily stay there again and recommend it wholeheartedly to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: rota21
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying with Duquesne Eiffel and it was just as wonderful as the first! The staff is very friendly and helpful with directions for eating(Chez Janou is a must... if you order the chocolate mousse - they bring you the mixing bowl so you can serve yourself as little or as much as you want!) and how to best use the Metro. We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for monuments”
Reviews.Author: Jeffreybarker2
Reviews.Content: Granted we got the standard room, but it was honestly too small to fit our luggage and us. Now maybe this is something I should've investigated before-hand, but it was crazy small. It was nice being within walking distance to the tower and Les Invalides, but other than that, the neighborhood doesn't have a lot to do. We would've much rather stayed in Monmartre or the Latin Quarter. The older guy who worked at night was rude as well. We don't like to whine about hotels, but this one really let us down. We got yelled at for laughing and having drinks out front of the hotel at the sidewalk tables at 9pm on a Friday night. We were not being the "Americans" that the clerk made us feel like when he came out and shooshed us 3 times. It was our honeymoon and the hotel definitely lacked service, romance and space. Stay somewhere not as central that has better attractions around and more room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - easy access”
Reviews.Author: alicehmartin
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms on top floor of this little jewel over Thanksgiving. While rooms were small, having the balcony and the twinkling Eiffel Tower, enlarged the space. Good restaurants surround you, and with only a 7 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine River boats (where we got the 'on/off' ticket for cheap transportation), the location couldn't be beaten in this price category. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: gonzalo421
Reviews.Content: Located in a large street close by l'Ecole Militaire and the Eiffel Tower. It has many dining options that are frequented by locals and don't have a touristy feel. (Rue St Dominique and rue Cler) I would recommend calling first to guarantee a room on the street side if you want the view to the tower. Ours was in the back and it was fine for us anyway. Room 58 is certainly very small by American standards but it's updated, clean and nice looking. Based on the floor plan, other rooms are larger with 2 windows on the street. Corner rooms seem to be the best. They are probably upgrades. Linens are thick and soft, beds are comfortable. The staff is very friendly, they speak English and Spanish. Lobby is very well done with original stone walls and wooden beams ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 4 days over christmas”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is AMAZING! Beautiful location. Just 8mins walk from the eiffel tower. We had room 25. A stunning view of the eiffel tower from huge double french windows. The hotel was so clean. Fresh towels etc every day. The recptionist was very kind and spoke perfect english greeting us every time we entered and left the hotel. Very close to the metro which was easy to navigate. We found the hotel was central to most tourist attractions and easy to get to places on metro. I definitely recommend this hotel to anybody staying in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Five days of enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: Bubim
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days reading the reviews on tripadvisor trying to find a perfect place for me and my girlfriend. Wide range of very nice hotels is in the offer so finding the best one is sometimes very exhausting. In one moment you get fed up with all those photos, reviews and just book the thing hoping you wont have negative experience. Luckily It wasn't the case with "Duquesne Eiffel". I have visited many hotels all over Europe and I must say that in rare places I have met such politeness. It is like you are visiting a small family hotel. The people who work here are always prepared to help you(giving you the advice for restaurant, calling you a cab, making reservations etc.) Our room had the view on Eiffel Tower. It was very clean, same was with the bathroom. Beds are very comfortable(My height is 1.90m), I slept like a baby. I don't know how is the situation with the other rooms in hotel(the ones that do not have view on the Eiffel Tower), but I must say that personally even if I didn't have the view, I would choose this hotel. After all, comfort and kindness are the things that matter and Paris isn't only the room with a view. Au contraire, It is much much more. All the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: SLieb
Reviews.Content: Small, contemporary hotel near the Rue Cler with wonderful Eiffel Tower views. The front desk people were pleasant and helpful, our room, though small, was adequate for two and the sound-proofing was excellent. The neighborhood is a bit undistinguished, but not far from the Metro, and an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Rodin Museum and Bon Marche.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie C
Reviews.Content: It was out 1st time to Paris and I am so glad we picked the Hotel Duquesne for our visit. We, too, had a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower, in room 56. What a treat to wake up in the middle of the night (jet-lag) to see the tower from the bed! The rooms were small, typical, but were spotlessly clean and very nicely decorated. The wireless worked perfectly. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was just perfect. Justine even helped me get my ipad back after I had left it on the Eurostar! The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. All in all it was a perfect stay in Paris made even better by the staff of the Hotel Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: FLcmm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night of our honeymoon in mid October 2011. We were in room 55 and it is the absolute best room in the hotel! It is on the top floor and on the corner of the building. The balcony doors open to a view of the Eiffel Tower, The view was not obstructed at all. The balcony is only large enough to stand out there. But even on a cloudy day you still have an amazing view. You also have another set of windows to the left of the balcony. The walk to the Eiffel Tower from the hotel was about 10 minutes. There isn't much to do around the area of the hotel itself. There are small cafes a short walk away. There was wi-fi in the rooms and it worked very well for us. I contacted them through email to book the room and they were very helpful and answered emails promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dane0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel in a Superior Room for our honeymoon in October 2010. We requested a room with a view of the Eiffel and the view was wonderful. This was our first stop on our honeymoon which made for a great start to our holiday. The room was clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful (especially Jennifer) and is nicely located for some of the key sites in Paris (even if they aren't the metro stop is not a long walk). The staff had organised a transfer from Charles De Gaulle Airport (which was reasonably priced) and also helped recommend a restaurant that we loved. Would definately come back to Hotel Duquesne Eiffel if i am lucky enough to come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBC_24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room with the expectation of having a view if the eiffel tower as we had booked it through our travel agent and paid extra for a 'Eiffel tower view'. The view was from the balcony, so not worth it as it's not a balcony that you could sit on and admire the view. Otherwise, hotel staff were lovely, close to metro, but breakfast wasn't anything flash-far from it.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jewelskrok
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hotel Eiffel Duquesne last week and had a fantastic time. Julia at the front desk was beyond helpful and friendly. She went out of her way to arrange a shuttle for us to the airport and handle issues that arised with expedia when we checked out a day early. The Location was perfect. We walked to all the sites including the Eiffel Tower, Arc du Triomphe, Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay, Invalides, Champs Elysees and the Louvre. Keep in mind the hotel in located in the 7 arrondissement which is far pricier than the 8 arrondissement, however you get what you pay for in the quality of food and service as well as location. The rooms are TINY however all the rooms in European hotels are tiny and the cleanliness and comfort more than make up for it. The rooms are quiet from any outside noise. Fantastic Time!

Reviews.Title: “the View Worth Thousand words”
Reviews.Author: Whtbox
Reviews.Content: The hotel Service is good, I book this hotel for our Honeymoon and wanted the Eiffel Tower view. So far this hotel give the best view. Room is pretty good for us and comfortable, but may not suit for larger couple and Bathroom are on the small side. majority Hotel in Paris are pretty small anyway, therefore I Can't really complain. There is one negative side is the Toilet is difficult to flush, but it's not an issue that can make it lose a star, because the View of this Hotel already put extra mark for it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff, room appointments - all excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jenxinz
Reviews.Content: My daughter 'shouted' me the weekend for my 60th birthday for my first visit to Paris, so I was thrilled with finding nothing to complain about. All staff were friendly and willing, especially those at reception -Julia& Alain. A small downside -if I had to spend more time in the hotel , the room may have been a bit small, there was no room for both suitcases to be put on the 1'bench' provided. But we were out for most of the day. Oh, and I did miss being able to make a cup of tea or coffee in the room. But the room was quiet, and we appreciated that the hall lighting is on motion sensor, so there is not light showing under the doors all night which annoys me at other hotels. The hotel is close to the Metro station, a Carrefour, Boulangerie/patisserie and at least 2 Velib (bike hire) stations within 5 mins walk, as well as rue Cler for a wide choice of bistros and restaurants. One morning when we went down a little late for breakfast, there was no bacon left, and the request for more was met with a smile and quickly provided. However we did notice a more surly customer did not seem to have his query answered . Perhaps he didnt make his request clear enough, but I always have the theory that politeness and a smile goes a long way on both sides of the bargain. We had room 22 where the view was of the Eiffel tower over the buildings of the boulevard - the windows being excellent for traffic soundproofing. Bathroom shower was excellent, and the bathroom itself was always spotless, but I missed soft, fluffly towels. The used indiviual soaps were replaced in the 'complimentaries' container with fresh ones, but left for ongoing use, not wasted by removing them. I cant comment on the value thanks to my daughter. But I would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel for a Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: gotogate20
Reviews.Content: We picked out the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel as the pick of hotels in and around the 7eme, an area of Paris that we didn't really know and wanted to try. Most of the reviews mention the views of the Eiffel Tower. Ok. We had room 25: and the view was very nice. But the reason for the hotel's continuing success (and the same for all hotel's big and small) rests with staff who were friendly, warm and welcoming and with the meticulous attention to detail. Our room was large (for Paris), decorated in a modern style, with soft carpets and art deco-style table and cupboard. everything was spotless, with a small but perfectly good bathroom. From the fire exit sign it looks like all rooms are of a similar size or larger. Top points: the road outside is busy - but you would never know; the windows are that good. The in-room heating and air conditioning are super-responsive. The bedding was amongst the softest and most luxuriant that we have ever encountered. And the staff - they couldn't have been more welcoming. The perfect Parisienne 3 Star hotel. So would suggest that Zara M (previous review) was a bit off beam with her rather grasping overall review; maybe the view of the Eiffel Tower got the better of her!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ROBP23
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel following the good reviews on Tripadvisor. We initially booked a standard via a broker but we had to upgrade to a Superior as it was far too small. The room on the 5th floor (51) was far bigger,clean with a very comfortable bed. The winning point yet was the excellent view on the Eiffel Tower and the very courteous staff. The location was quite and 5 minutes walk from Les Invalides. All in all we had a good time and I would definitely recommend it for a romantic weekend in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa2011
Reviews.Content: After reading the many positive trip advisor reviews on the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel, we booked 4 nights accommodation...and we were not disappointed! When we opened the blinds in our hotel room we saw the most amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. It is simply breathtaking! The hotel staff are also lovely - very helpful in offering maps, suggested day trips/restaurants, as well as making/confirming bookings on our behalf. The hotel is beautifully decorated and our room was extremely spacious - Surprising in a city notorious for small rooms. The Eiffel Tower is an easy 10-15 minute stroll, but it is a little bit further to the other 'tourist sites'. I would highly reccommend this hotel to anyone wanting an unforgetable view of the Eiffel Tower. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 day stop over in Paris on our way back to Australia and although we had been to Paris before and stayed in the Latin Quarter - this time we decided to bring our son as he had been dying to see Paris and we decided that this time we would stay near the Eiffel tower and we were not dissapointed at all. The girl on reception who always seemed to be working - was so helpful and polite - nothing ever was a problem if we asked her questions - sorry I did not get her name but she was brilliant. The rooms are rather large for European hotels and the bathrooms extra large as well. The lifts on the other hand were rather small and so we could only go up with a couple of suitcases each. The beds were comfortable and the only thing that I would complain about this hotel is that there is no tea and coffee making facilities in the room and as we love our coffee first thing in the morning, tended to find that this would be the only thing that I would suggest maybe that this hotel could provide. The added bonus was that we had views of the Eiffel tower which was great to see it lit up at night - our son really enjoyed this and even had his Ipod out the window, showing his mates back in Australia on "talk time". The early morning that we left the guy on reception was really lovely and when they delivered the pastries for the day - offered us all one to get us on our journey which was a really special touch as had a 12 1/2 hour flight ahead of us and with the early start to the day - made it a rather long day. Thanks for an enjoyable stay at your hotel - would we return - Definately!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Quaint Hotel - Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days at the beginning and end of a 10 day Rick Steve’s Tour of France. This is a small, what I would call a boutique hotel in the U.S. The location is excellent, close to shops, cafes, tourist/souvenir shops, grocery stores, laundry and the touristy areas. The Eiffel Tower was about 10 minutes away. There was easy access to the Metro lines. The staff was friendly and helpful in answering questions. Many other tourist attractions were within walking and Metro distance. In the lower basement level, a modified continental breakfast is served around 7:00 am (not always on time) each morning with delicious pastries and wonderful service. Our tour included this breakfast, so I am not sure how much it would normally cost. During our stay, renovations were under way so there were some areas that were covered in plastic and made elevator access a little longer than usual, but it was quite easy to take the stairs. This renovation never disturbed our sleep. By now, I am sure that has been completed. The rooms are small, but quite beautiful and tastefully decorated. The bathroom had a combo shower/tub, marble countertops with plenty of space for toiletries. The bath toiletries supplied (shower gel, shampoo, etc.) were wonderful! In fact, they were so fantastically scented, I ordered them when I returned to the U.S. The lobby was quite beautiful and we occassionally sat there to read. I would definitely recommend this wonderful hotel for anyone wanting to stay in a quiet, yet prime location to many of the beautiful Paris attractions, with an attentive and friendly staff. Our stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: barrsalona
Reviews.Content: We had our first introduction to Paris with an overnight stay here. Our plane was extremely late in arriving (after midnight) but our pre-arranged pick up was not fazed. He was even very tolerant of our appalling attempt at French and put paid to the "ignorant French" tag forever for us. Our room, with a view of the Eiffel Tower (Room 55), was magnificent and the Manager was a delight...waiting up for us and greeting us at the door with conversation. The following morning we required a taxi but did not realise we should have booked the night. No problem....the receptionist rang every few minutes for over an hour until she had secured a vehicle and all the time with a wonderful smile. My husband and I could not recommend this establishment any more highly and fully intend to stay here again on our return trip in May 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ronjen817
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Duquesne Eiffel for our 15 year wedding anv. in late September. Hotel was great, close to the metro and taxi stand. We walked to all the sites and was close to the rue cler. Staff was great and Hotel is in a great safe area. Resturants and Grocery store 5 min walk. We will be going back when we get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: amaroo_9
Reviews.Content: Thankyou all for a wonderful stay in Paris, my first trip to Paris and your hotel made that experience all the more enjoyable!! From the front office staff to the room staff were more than accommodating. Can't wait to come back, if looking for a hotel in Paris don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place To Stay In Paris”
Reviews.Author: BandCHalik
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for my birthday trip and couldn't have asked for a more lovely hotel! The room was large by European standards, it had a good view of the Eiffel tower from the window, even though we didn't book far enough in advance to get Room 55. The room also had a bathtub which was great after walking all day! The staff was wonderful helping us get around town to the things we wanted to do and see, restaraunt recommendations, as well as navigate the Metro. We couldn't have asked for nicer people! The hotel is located in a great part of town, about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, a few blocks from Metro, and a lot of cafe's and shops nearby. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay at this hotel during their stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anubi
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Duquesne on Trip Advisor and it was so amazing that we wanted to do a review so that anyone else thinking of staying here will make the decision to stay here! We booked way in advance to get Room 55 and we were not disappointed. We have seen all the pictures and the hotel video but...the reality of opening that door and then stepping out onto the balcony...incomparable. My husband, who leaves the planning of our trips to me, was so overwhelmed with the hotel and the view; he was just so pleased with the whole experience. One evening of our stay, we visited Rue Cler, picked up some French wine, some cheese & crackers and fruit and had an unforgetable evening on our balcony watching the Eiffel Tower sparkle, an unforgetable night and an amazing memory. The hotel was spotless, very well located and couldn't do enough for us. A special thank you to Patrick with whom we spent a wonderful evening at the bar. He was so entertaining and informatative and helped make our stay even more wonderful...thank you Patrick!! When we go back to Paris, and there is NO doubt that we will, we will stay once again at the Hotel Duquesne. A huge thanks to all the staff for all of their assistance, I just wish I could remember all the names.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing Paris experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mileymo
Reviews.Content: After searching for a long time for the perfect place to stay for our special trip to Paris for our 25th wedding anniversary. We found Hotel Duquesne Eiffel and the reviews from trip advisor were a great help. From the moment we arrived the staff we lovely and so helpful, they spoke English perfectly which was a marvellous help considering our very limited French. They happily held on to our bags until our room was ready at 2pm so we could look around the local area and get some lunch. Two blocks away a lovely place to eat was la terrasse. Our room was small, but clean and comfortable. Breakfast was extra, €12 each which we thought was expensive but if you choose not to have it, there are many places locally you can go. The location of the hotel was perfect, close to the Eiffle tower about a 10-15 min leisurely walk a must see both day and night. Very local to shops, restaurants and the metro. Over all thanks to following the reviews of trip advisor we had a perfect anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stormwatcher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best we have stayed in, such a good size room, lovely view of the Eiffel Tower from the window, and the quietness, even in a corner room (triple glaze windows?). Location was excellent, staff were very helpful and went out of their way to help us get the most out of our days of sightseeing. Will definitely return to this hotel, and have highly recommended it to friends planning trips to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Anja4670
Reviews.Content: I had been to Paris several times before and had finally convinced my elderly mum, travel-weary brother and sister-in-law to join me. As it was their first visit - and we were on a tight schedule - I needed to find accommodation that would be close to all major tourist sites, metro lines and the hop-on hop-off busses ... In addition, I wanted the accommodation to reflect the style and class of the city itself and the rates to reflect value for money. A very tall order! For this reason, I spent many, many hours researching accommodation online and am so, so thankful that I decided on Hotel Duquesne. Fantastic location, absolutely gorgeous decor, extremely comfortable beds, great showers, quiet rooms ... and everything impeccably clean. I shared a Comfort Room with my mum (Clooney cancelled) which had a to-die-for view of the Eiffel Tower. That was the cherry on the top, especially for my mum. Tip: stroll over to Rue Cler for breakfasts that offer great value for money and will keep you full for most of the day. I will, without a doubt, book at the Hotel Duquesne when I visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and great location”
Reviews.Author: steveocean
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near Eiffel tower and Champs de Mars where you cn hop on the red tourist buses, nice cafés and restaurants around. Small room but very pretty, tiny TV but who cares you are not in Paris to stay in your hotel room. Very friendly staff (dealt with 3 different equally accomodating). The lobby is also small but very cozy. Only complaint is due to my size: I am a very big guy and shower was too small. But still excellent water pressure and can go very hot if you like it that way. I am rating room average because of size and only because of that. If you are a normal sized person you'll do great. All very clean. I understand there is breakfast served underground but didn't see it as we preferred to sit at some nearby café.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the ridiculous hour of 7am after a 25 hour flight, and were glad to be able to drop our bags and head out for the day to try and reset body clocks. The girl at reception was lovely and very helpful, showing us our closest Metro stop and willing to give info on various places to go and to eat. We came back later in the afternoon absolutely exhausted and took our bags up to our room. It would have been a nicer touch if these had been taken up for us, but oh well. The room itself was amazing, much bigger than I had expected with all the tales of Paris shoeboxes. The bed was large, had plenty of room around it and also a writing desk, separate toilet and bathroom. The room was silent with the windows shut and very nicely decorated. The best bit, was that even though I had been told that we had booked a room without a view (we had booked 3 months in advance) that room 35 still could see the top half of the Eiffel tower which excited me a lot! The location and convenience of this hotel was amazing for us. We walked an average of 20km a day, occasionally catching the Metro home when we were tired, and it was a wonderful starting point. There were plenty of restaurants and patisseries nearby, but it was also a nice quiet neighbourhood. I highly recommend this hotel, it was quiet, pretty, nicely staffed in a fantastic location and for a very good price. The views on top of this were just the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Picouline
Reviews.Content: I have stayed to Duquesne Eiffel Hotel for 3 nights. My previous visit was 6 years ago and once again, I really enjoyed my stay. Location : excellent, 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower, very near a metro station, near École militaires, Invalides, etc. Many restaurants, cafés, boutiques, etc. Room : perfectly clean, very comfortable bed, beautifully decorated, big bathroom, nice view, flat screen tv, mini bar with alcohol, water, juice, chocolat, etc. Breakfast : maybe a little expensive when not included in your hotel fare (12 euros per person per day), but really worth it. Staff is really nice, always smiling, they would bring tea, coffee, chocolate, etc. Food is on a self-service basis, you would have scrambled eggs, ham, croissants, cereales, fruits, etc. Not SO many choices but everything was excellent. Staff : very nice, very helpful, very professionnal, nothing bad could be said about any of them. They can recommend places to visit, good restaurants, can give you tips about transportation, show you the way on a map, cancall a taxi... anything you could possibly need, they help and always with a smile !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, room and service”
Reviews.Author: Shoubedoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend over the valentines weekedFebruary 2010. Can't remember what room we had but it was on the 4th floor and the decor was in purple. It was beautifully decorated. Incredibly confortably and the bed was really cosy. If you looked out of the window there was a great view of the Eiffle tower. In the evening you could see it all lit ad flashing with its lights. the room view really was spectacular. The hotel has a great location within walking distance of most things, the Eiffle Tower, the louvre, the Seine, Notre Dame, D'orsay museum. Even all those lovely shops. The best bit had to be going up to the moulin rouge and seeing a show and having dinner. It really is something to be seen. As it was valentines they were giving away a gift of champagne a mouline rouge champagne flutes with the windmill on. a wonderful momento and a fabulous weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice”
Reviews.Author: mauisun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a Superior Room for our week at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. Our room was on the 4th floor and although, it was not an "Eiffel Tower" view room, imagine to our surprise when we put our heads out the window that night we were able to see the Eiffel tower all lt. What a beautiful sight. We were very pleased with our room. Although not large, it was very comfortable and well laid out with plenty of room for our luggage. The bathroom was well supplied with soaps, lotions etc. Even though construction was going on across the street with the windows being soundproof we could not hear any noise Melanie and Julia were delightful at the front desk. They always had a smile and were willing to help with us with all our questions. The location is excellent and is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Rodin Museum etc. Lots of restaurants in the area. It had a very neighborhood feeling. Breakfast was our only disappointment. We ended up going to the cafe next door in the morning for delicious coffee, baguette and jam. Rue Clerc is also within walking distance with lots of selections for breakfast. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Paris and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow....”
Reviews.Author: jesseandteresa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a special room for our anniversary and 1st trip to Paris. We got Room 45 and couldn't have picked a better one...The Eiffel tower is right out your window (amazing at night) You are within walking distance to everything..we walked to the Eiffel tower, the Louvre, the Seine, and Notre Dame. The staff was the friendliest I have EVER met. I wish I remembered their names (it was two girls but thats all I know..) They were full of tips, help, maps, and everything else and always seemed happy to see us (even on the street outside the hotel). Our TV was being worked on and they even offered us keys to an empty room to watch TV there if we wanted. Super nice rooms and free internet. One tip-book EARLY. I booked about 5-6 months in advance and was unable to get rm 55 (rm 45 was still unbelievable). If you want something special, romantic, or it is your first time in Paris-you can't go wrong here

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: FoodAndWineLovers
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th stay in Paris and this was by far the nicest hotel room we've had. It was also the most expensive, but worth it. The room actually lived up to the photographs on the website and, technically, we did have a view of the Eiffel Tower. We booked a "Superior" room and, upon seeing into another room that was presumably a standard, we felt we made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: packliteFl0rida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this summer, and our experience with the hotel was terrific. Our room was extremely clean, modern, and we had a lovely view of the tower. The location is great, and we were able to walk to many of the Paris sights. It is near many nice dining establishments that are reasonable in price, in particular the Rue Cler area. It is also within walking distance to the metro, which we did use to return to the airport for an early morning departure. The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable. We would recommend to others and certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location fantastic helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Penny S
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights at this hotel and were very impressed with the location and helpfulness of the staff. We speak very little French but the staff were always patient and helpful with all our requests. The room although small meet all our needs and we had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our french doors. It took us about 10 mins to walk to the Eiffel Tower and the surrounding suburbs had lots of restaurants and was very safe. The Metro is about 5min walk from the hotel. If coming from Australia it is a great base and you will feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Chambers
Reviews.Content: Duquesne Eiffel is a very comfortable and clean hotel in a wonderful location in Paris. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our Room, and it was wonderful to look out and see it lit up at night. 2min walk to the shops and metro from the hotel. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Rooms and hotel were always clean, and the room was a very nice size. Very comfortable, and a great stay. We stayed here for 5 nights, and enjoyed the whole time. Would definitley recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting experience”
Reviews.Author: sunshinedaph1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently took a short trip to England & Paris. While staying in Paris, we stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. It was beautiful. The staff was fantastic & very helpful. We were very close to the La Tour Eiffel, in fact, we were only a 7-10 minute walk. Breakfast was scrumptious every morning. Our room was small but very nice & always clean. They offered free wi-fiWe really enjoyed our stay! There is a great restaurant just a short walk down the street called La Terrasse, recommended by the staff at Hotel Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: mzmelanie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just as I expected. =) I found it in a Rick Steves' book and read all the TA reviews. I have had a great experience with them since my first encounter via email with Helene. The reception staff is welcoming, friendly accommodating and speak fluent English. The room is clean, beautifully decorated and cozy (there was enough room for our suitcases). The bed is sooo comfortable! Oooh, and did I mention the great view of Tour Eiffel? I highly recommend booking a superior room! =) We booked the shuttle transfer from the airport to the hotel through them. We found our driver really easy unlike of the reviews I read. Tip: At CDG, the driver will ask you to meet him at the departure gates.

Reviews.Title: “Love the view!”
Reviews.Author: ohmiso
Reviews.Content: We're usually budget travellers but we booked months in advance to stay in the Gustave Eiffel room at the Duquesne on our first trip to Paris. We loved the view - how could you not? The room was quite small but it had everything we needed and the bed and pillows were the best we had on our 5.5 week trip. We arrived before check-in time and the previous guests had only just checked out so the room wasn't ready but they had the room prepared for us straight away which we appreciated (especially my partner who was unwell). Loved the neighbourhood and it was very easy to get around. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are created equal”
Reviews.Author: mdw50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour group. First of all, the hotel must not be well known as our cab driver from the airport did not know of it. We were fortunate that our room was ready for us at 9 am when we arrived from the airport but not as fortunate as some of our traveling buddies who got rooms that looked out on the Eiffel Tower. Ours looked over the alley but at least the hotel had an elevator and air conditioning. It also had a computer available for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Steven76137
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with my wife on our honeymoon. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room (booked well in advance) had a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood felt safe for first time travelers to Europe, and was a short 5-10 min walk to the Metro station. Well within walking distance to the Eiffel tower and boats for a Seine cruise. The room was cozy, but we had adequate space for our luggage, and the bathroom was very clean and the shower was good. The bed was comfortable, and we had no issue with the room being too hot or cold for our taste. Bottom line, it was a perfect spot for me and my wife on our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Just the hotel you are looking for!”
Reviews.Author: kristineotr
Reviews.Content: Where can I start? My experience was excellent here! Front desk very helpful with info regarding Paris. Breakfast in the morning perfect! The girls that worked here are so friendly! Rooms very clean and cozy. The pillows and mattress-very comfortable! Larger than expected. One review I read prior to booking stated he had no room to put luggage. Hmmmm? It's smaller- but all you need& typical for Paris. Close to the Eiffel Tower and Ecoile Militaire. The neighborhood is perfect. It is quiet. Just down the street is the metro....very convenient and the best is that Rue Cler is around the corner. Google it....you'll want to go!! I couldn't have chosen a better place!

Reviews.Title: “A quaint hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: edeljanin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here in March, and we were pleasantly surprised! Though we didn't get the Eiffel Tower view room (we didn't reserve 6 months in advance) we were fine with it. We had a good enough view of the tower from our window. Beyond that, the hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. They were okay with our efforts to speak French, while they spoke English well. It was good to wake up to breakfast in the morning, which was pretty good. The hotel is in a great area as well. It is quiet at night, the metro is two blocks away, and there are some great bars and restaurants (7eme vin!) in the neighborhood, and the Eiffel Tower is a nice walk through the park away. I am so glad we picked a great hotel! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trvl78_11
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and seeing the beautiful pictures. Unfortunately, our stay started off with a bad experience. Prior to our trip we booked an airport pick-up through the hotel (I believe they contract out to an independent company). When we landed I contacted the driver (number given to me by the hotel). The driver advised that he was waiting for us outside of arrivals. When we got outside with our luggage he was no where to be found. I called him again and he said that he had waited for hours (totally untrue) and would not be able to pick us up for another hour. The airport information person, whose phone I was using wouldn't let me use his phone to contact the hotel as he had a line-up. We opted to take the train to Gare de Nord and then a taxi to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, the driver was there and told the woman at the front desk that he was waiting for us but we never showed up. Needless to say, after travelling for 8 hours +, we were pissed. The woman at the front desk was nice but did not do anything about it. She brushed it off and did not offer us any compensation (we didn't pre-pay so we didn't lose any money however, we booked through the hotel, so I believe they should have made up for it somehow). It was not a nice way to start off our trip which we had planned for months. Another con was that the gentlemen who work at the desk at night are completely useless and rude. To the hotel's credit...it really is a beautiful hotel. Our room was very nicely decorated and clean. The view was spectacular and the location superb. They have free internet in the lobby which was very helpful. They also had one of the best coffees I tasted in Paris. All in all, I really liked the hotel however, customer service did not seem to be a priority. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: garryaussie
Reviews.Content: The Duquesne pronounced ( Du Ken ) if you need to take a taxi is 10 minute walk from the eiffel Tower. We booked a standard room and received an email 2 days before we got there telling us we had been upgraded due to overbooking for the first 2 nights of our 5 night stay.Upon arrival we were taken to our room to discover when we open the window that it looked straight at the tower,fantastic as we could lay in bed and see the tower at night room was ok but not that big.Then moved to standard room,very tiny not as well appointed but we didnt mind as you only sleep there and we wanted someone else to experience the lovely view we had from the superior room.Very close to metro only 2 blocks,and plenty of restaurants and convenience stores.also ATM 1 block away. Breakfast was only ok as nothing was kept hot and nothing to rave about would rather have eaten out side of hotel.Free WiFi and lovely girls on reception with good english,very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up to a Wonderful View of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: lanaQueensland
Reviews.Content: This hotel , have everything that you need for an enjoyable stay in Paris, A smooth check-in with helpful staff . The rooms are clean and tasteful in design , with a decent sized bathroom, compared to some Paris hotels , the bedding and pillows were particularly comfortable and of good quality , while the bedroom was a touch smaller then I prefer, the view more then made up for that. The Metro ,cafes , supermarket and restaurants are a short stroll , and area surrounding the hotel is quiet and safe . I would definitely have no hesitations in recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Beat the View!”
Reviews.Author: MWorth79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for 3 nights in August and could not have been happier. We were in the best room in the entire hotel, room 55, the Gustave Eiffel room. It was a corner room on the 5th floor with a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. What a view!! We had a great experince from check-in to check-out. The girl who checked us in was very pleasant and sweet and let us know that it was only her 3rd day on the job, but she was already a pro and took good care of us. They even booked a shuttle for us to the airport. The bed was comfortable and although the bathroom was a little on the small size it was nicely appointed. We did have the breakfast and although it was not super fancy it was decent and convienient. We also made use of the computer in the lobby to check-in for our flights. The location is nice and only two blocks from the Metro station. We would definitely recommend this hotel and if we make it back to Paris will defintiely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “MAGICAL”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamily49
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend at this lovely hotel and would come back in a heartbeat. We were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who had only just started working there but she was most efficient and helpful and the check in was fast and smooth. When we arrived at our room (which was very pleasant), I was disappointed we did not have a view of the Eiffel Tower (our fault really as we had not specifically requested one) but my husband went to enquire as to the possibility of changing our room. The lady he spoke to could not have been more accommodating, advising us that as they were fully booked she would not be able to give us a room with a view that day but would be happy to upgrade us free of charge the following day.
