This was all dealt with whilst we were out sightseeing and we arrived back to a most splendid view and lovely room. Granted the rooms are small but fully equipped with everything one would need, toiletries, hairdryer, air-con, desk and chair, bedside cabinets and lighting, mini bar, safe and a most comfortable bed and pillows. Shower pressure was good and the water nice and hot. Despite being on a fairly busy road with the windows closed you could not hear a thing so a deep sleep was had every night. The hotel's positioning was very good, a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro station and a 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel. Bars and restaurants just a stroll away. Overall I would definately recommend this Hotel for its positioning, cleanliness and friendliness of all its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Seeing the Eiffel tour from our room = amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SCKJTravel
Reviews.Content: We could see the Eiffel tour from our room! Was so excited! Room was nice and clean, great location... Happy to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: nyctravel17
Reviews.Content: Hi- We stayed in this resort in April 2010, so my review is a bit dated...I thought the hotel was decent for the price. We could somewhat see the Eiffel tower from our balcony if we looked just right. The rooms are tiny and the hallways are even tinier. Overall very clean and good bed. The only thing that really rubbed us the wrong way is that there was a pocketbook mugging right outside of our hotel. A husband, wife and baby in stroller were walking and the husband was holding the baby and the mugger stole the back right off the wife's arm. The police were there and it was scary. We were sure to be extra cautious after that. Overall, the distance to restaurants and shops was great, but I think next time we will pay a bit more money and stay somewhere a bit larger.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: hatty07
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights from Aug. 9-12 at Hotel Duquesne Eifell located in the 7th district. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful, giving us maps and suggestions.The location was great! About 10 min walk to the Metro stop l'Ecole Militaire and about 20 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. We had two rooms, one double and one triple facing the main road. The rooms were average size with very comfortable linens, etc. and a flat screen TV that mainly had French speaking channels. The shower was very good and separated from the toilet. If we leaned out the window we could see the Eiffel Tower, which was especially beautiful at night! The hotel offered a breakfast of croissants, cereal, coffee, and fruit for 12 euros per person. We had the breakfast each morning we were there since it was convenient, but I am sure you can find something cheaper down the street. There was construction going on across the street, but with the windows closed the noise didn't bother us at all since the panes were so thick! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would come again!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: VanessaNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel earlier this week. On the plus side, the room was very clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. On the negative side, the room was extremely small, the bathroom was just okay; the towels were thin and felt like sandpaper, the small shower area had only a glass door that covered the front half of stall, and the hair dryer was low-functioning. It consisted of a device connected to the wall with a tube that blew a little air from the head, however, despite using it for some time, I was unable to get my hair dry. I think if the hotel added a few extra items, such as a room safe, a nicer hair dryer, nicer towels, a universal electrical outlet adapter, the hotel would be upgraded quite a bit. Yes, the rooms are small, but I could easily tolerate that if I had a few "homely comforts." Additionally, I think it is very important for hotel staff to be accommodating and pleasant in their interactions with patrons. On our first day, we did not experience that. We called to ask for an additional wash cloth on the afternoon of our arrival, as there was only one in the room. The front desk girl seemed surprised by the request. Shortly thereafter, a washcloth was delivered to our room. The woman who delivered it seemed annoyed at being bothered in the afternoon, despite our repeated "Merci/Thank you." When we left the hotel via the lobby a few minutes later, the same woman gave us a very unpleasant look (which I found disconcerting as I thought she would be cleaning our room during our stay). Fortunately, she was not. I must say that the young lady who DID clean our room was pleasant. She always greeted us with a friendly "Bonjour" and smile as we passed her in the hallway. She also did an outstanding job. I only wish that all staff had been as pleasant! The location was pretty good. About five blocks to the Eiffel Tower and about two blocks to Les Invalides (where Napolean's Tomb is found). Two blocks to the underground subway as well. Several cafes nearby, too. Though I requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower via our reservation several months prior, our room had a disappointing view of the alley way so to speak. The room is rated as a three-star, yet there are very few amenities provided and no porter to help with luggage. Additionally, the elevator barely holds one person with luggage at a time and the hallways leading to room are very narrow. Based on my experience, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, efficient boutique hotel with views of & close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: DJEargasm
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked a deluxe room with views of the Eiffel Tower and was surprised at the low cost (in comparison to other accommodation in Paris), especially as it's short walk (15-25 minutes) to the Eiffel Tower. I was hoping that I wouldn't be disappointed by the comparatively low tariff - I CERTAINLY WASN'T!! Being a small, boutique style hotel it doesn't have a large front and huge signs, so it can be a little hard to spot initially. (We took a slow cruise down the avenue and spotted it reasonably easy.) I arrived into Paris on the early Eurostar train and was at the hotel by 9:45am - way too early for check in. However, the lovely and very friendly receptionist (Melanie, from memory) was very helpful in storing my luggage and looking after my laptop/DJ hardware gear whilst I joined family and visited the sites of Paris. She also offered directions downstairs to the bathroom so I could freshen up, which was a nice touch. Apart from the quality of the hotel, Melanie was a joy to be served by - so very friendly, helpful, multilingual and "ooh-la-la" very pretty - definitely an asset to the hotel. (Haven't felt so welcome in an accommodation premises in over a week - on the road for 40+ days.) Later on I returned to the hotel and officially checked in. This was a rather simple affair and was completed within a few minutes then off to my room via their small elevator. My room was situated on the top floor, overlooking Avenue Duquesne with a private balcony and views of the Eiffel Tower. Admittedly, the room was small and didn't allow for much free floor space, however it was sufficient and functional enough for me. It was all very clean and modern looking with reverse air-conditioning. It also consisted of a comfortable Queen bed with headboard with reading lights, two bedside tables, two wall mounted lamps, telephone, small wall mounted flatscreen TV, small desk with lamp and chair, footstool, bench seat and a wardrobe (with mini-bar, tea & coffee station, hanging spaces and a couple of shelves). The room was also tastefully decorated and thick, plush curtains covered both the glass French doors which lead to the balcony. At night the views of a lit up Eiffel Tower were splendid. The ensuite was also very small, but still practical and functional, and most importantly - very clean. It was all very bright and consisted of a toilet, towel rack, vanity sink and mirror, complimentary toiletries and shower gel, and a small shower-in-bath. The water pressure and temperature in the shower were both very good, with the only downfall being the slight lack of water containment allowing the toilet area to get moderately wet. A simple shower curtain would prevent this from occurring. The breakfast is a buffet style and costs extra. It is held downstairs (below reception) and the venue looked a bit small and cramped. However, I did not eat breakfast and only passed through the area to use the bathrooms - so there could've been more to it than what I witnessed. Unfortunately, I did not stay in Paris long enough to make the best of this hotel but what I experienced won me over, and if I ever return to Paris I would definitely stay here. Admittedly, the whole hotel from the reception and it's lobby (which has a very lovely sitting/waiting area complete with settees, chairs and coffee table) to the hallways, elevators and rooms are all quite small and compact, it all works very well. I really enjoyed my time at this hotel and I look forward to returning one day. Overall, if this falls into your budget (stretch it a little if you have to) then this is a really excellent and highly recommended boutique hotel to stay in whilst visiting Paris. Good value, great service and a handy/convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, clean and small”
Reviews.Author: cowtown10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had nothing amazing to say but nothing bad either. Room is tiny, hard for two people to find space for baggage. Rooms are clean and bathrooms remind me of smaller New York hotels. The location is okay for anyone looking for a quiet Paris. If you want to stay near the action, try the other side of the river or be prepared to take a cab. Staff is friendly, free wifi and even a Mac in the lobby to use.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: danman2327
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Paris and our second stay at the Hotel Duquesne. We won't stay anywhere else. We always request our room far enough in advance to get the third or fourth floor room with the great view of the tower. We love to open the windows, open a bottle of cold wine, prop our feet up on the balcony railing (the balcony is too small to stand on, it's really just a railing). The tower lights at night are fantastic. The staff was terrific in helping us locate all the things we needed and they had the best map of Paris that we found. All of the main sites are in an easy walking distance to the hotel. There is the best boulangerie in the next block that serves mouth watering pastries. You go there for breakfast and fill up! They also have some wonderful sandwiches, too. We are already planning our next trip to Europe and trying to work in a couple of days in Paris and the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel Tower. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views & wonderful reception service”
Reviews.Author: 158dobbers
Reviews.Content: A short stay in Paris was enhanced by getting the room (55) shown in the photo above. Yes not the biggest room but efficient air conditioning, Good quality bathroom, VERY comfortable bed and the most stunning view of the eiffel tower. Reception helpful, friendly and polite. Breakfast not the best but overall we will definitely return again

Reviews.Title: “spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: ryu1974
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for July 14th and were not disappointed. staff were courteous and professional. rooms were a bit on the small side but very comfortable and clean. we were lucky enough to have a room facing the Eiffel tower. If you have a lot of luggage be warned that there is no porter service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: BBreton
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at this hotel in July and this is a nice hotel by Paris standard. This is a "very good" and not "Excellent" as almost no hotel in Paris do reach that standard, this one included. The room here are very small but well decorated and recently renovated. The hotel has a modern style which is very well executed all around in terms of colors, friendliness and comfort. The rooms are quiet and the beds comfortable. At the hotel, the service is excellent all around and there is free internet. The location of the hotel is good and bad. It's good because it's in a quiet neighborhood and surrounded by several very good restaurants (this area of Paris offers good options to eat well at a somewhat reasonable price). The location is unfortunately a little bit far from the "center" of Paris. You can certainly walk for example to St-Germain, Notre-Dame or the Louvre but these are all fairly major walks (one hour or more). Overall, I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Flakenbake
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough postive things about this hotel. It was VERY affordable, it says there are limited view rooms of the eiffel tower, but in reality you can see it simiply by looking out the window!. The rooms were very clean, very nicely decorated! Very comfortable. The people were very nice when you walk in the door always willing to offer directions or help doing anything. It is a bit of a walk to the metro (about 3 or 4 blocks). But it is a great short little walk. There is one or two resturants within walking distance. The hotel offers free internet. The elevator is VERY small (we couldn't fit two people with lugage in there).

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms could be bigger”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkey11
Reviews.Content: In the 7th Walking distane to restaurants and metro station..10 minute walk to Eiffel tower, champ de mars. Also some restaurants bistro and bakery in close walking distance on rue cler. Boutique hotel Rooms on the small side but clean and nice otherwise. staff was friendly and Helpful and spoke English fluently.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: 999gina
Reviews.Content: The staff is what makes this hotel fantastic; they truely couldnt have been more helpful & accommodating. The location was great-safe & central. Good beds. The room was very nice-we opted for a superior room & had an amazing view of the Eiffel tower. My ONLY complaint was the breakfast-it was not good & certainly not worth 12 euro-but that would be easy to fix-if they had offered a little fresh fruit(canned fruit just doesnt cut it), eggs that were properly cooked & fresh cheese. I would definitely stay there again but would not bother to eat breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tlvincen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend June 14-18 in Superior Rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower. Requested room 56 (view from room) but were only able to have it the first night. Transferred to room 54 (view from balcony) and were even happier with this room! Room 54 did not feel small and the bathroom was not beside the bed. Clean, modern rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Perfect location!! Transit nearby. Always felt safe even while walking quite late at night (1am). To clear something up for readers - Eiffel Tower is no more than a 10-minute walk from front door if you use your map. To view other sights and attractions (Notre Dame, Le Louvre) we recommend some sort of hop-on, hop-off tour bus, we used Les Cars Rouges because it was free with our Paris Pass. If you find the time be sure to take a cruise along the Seine - ours was at night and breathtaking! We opted out of the hotel breakfast but easily found many local spots to stop for a quick bite. If ever we return to Paris this will be our hotel of choice. No complaints whatsoever! The front desk even arranged for our shuttle to Charles du Gaulle.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for the money! Love the location!”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler52
Reviews.Content: We booked almost a week long trip at this hotel and contracted for the COMFORT room. What we got for 5 out of the 6 nights that we were there, was a microscopic room - one that could not accomodate two adults and two pieces of luggage. There was only a foot and one half walking area to get around the bed to the bathroom. The location is phenomenal however, insist on a room on a different floor than the first floor (where all of the tiny rooms are at). Additionally, when we mentioned that this was a very small room the staff said that all the rooms in Paris are that size - not a great deal of sympathy. This was not our first trip to Europe and we both are aware not to expect American size hotel rooms but this was a closet. They have larger rooms but it depends on what rate you paid and when you booked as to whether you are even a contender for a larger room. We booked the hotel 5 months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...”
Reviews.Author: BarbReid
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and it is exactly as it is in the photos. I booked well in advance and so was able to get a room with a great view. The rooms and bathrooms are small, but that's to be expected in a lot of European hotels. The bed was the most comfortable I've slept in in my life. The rooms were very clean, though I do wish the cleaning staff would respect the 'do not disturb' signs. Staff were friendly and helpful, and it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Suze230
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at The Hotel Duquesne. The staff are just lovely, Melanie particularly took care of us and Jacqueline mopped up my daughter's spilt hot chocolate at breakfast with a minimum of fuss and much friendly warmth. I emailed them before I left hoping to have a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, as my daughter had particularly requested this. Although there wasn't one available at the time, they told me to email again closer to the time and they would see what they could do. There was a cancellation for the last night and we spent a magical evening in Room 55 with a breakthtaking view of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Always pleased with the Duquesne!”
Reviews.Author: RobertaL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 52 which overlooks Avenue Duquesne and has a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. Although there was construction across the street, I was never disturbed by it (and I am a very light sleeper). Our bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. The location of this hotel is convenient since it is a short walk from the metro and several buses. It was nice having different options to get to our destinations each day. Staff is friendly and helpful, including the gentleman who assisted me with the lobby computer late at night. As I witnessed throughout my stay, they are quick to pull out a map and highlight directions for guests. Thank you to Helene and Melanie who were so helpful in answering questions! After several trips to Paris, the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel continues to be my preferred choice. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the first-time visitor”
Reviews.Author: TripAdvice52
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with this hotel. We booked way ahead and were lucky to have Room 55. The view is amazing. The room was small but comfortable as was the bed. We ate breakfast at cafes and bars within a block or two. There are many other places to eat nearby, except on Sunday when it is very quiet. Learn how to use the metro system and buy a museum pass. You will be able to make great use of your vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendes1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days and decided to go here based on trip advisor reviews. We arrived with no problems from the Gare du Nord in a taxi - it was easy to find and the taxi was able to pull up outside. We went into reception and were welcomed by a friendly girl behind the desk. She gave us the room key and provided us with a map as we asked where a couple of things were that were off the beaten track. Our room was small but perfectly formed. It was a comfort room and not much view to speak of - I didnt pay for a Eifel tower view so didnt expect one. There was a small built in wardrobe, a double bed, a desk and a mini bar. I took my own travel kettle as there wasnt one in the room. There was a bathroom with a great shower and a sort of deep half bath. There was loads of hot water and clean towels - although they were a little rough and the bath towel not very large. The room was serviced daily and we got fresh towels. The room was clean and well maintained. There was free wireless in the room or a computer for use in the small lounge. The staff that we met at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. I didnt have breakfast at the hotel so cant comment. The location was good, not too far out with plenty of restaurants nearby. The Metro was in walking distance as was the Eifel Tower, although this was further away than I expected I would say a good 20 mins away. I woud recommend this hotel although if I was to go back to Paris I would stay in the Latin quarter but thats just a personal thing. . If you want to be near the Eifel Tower this is the place. I have no complaints and everything was good. I have to be honest - after reading the reviews on here I was expecting more but cant put my finger on what the 'more' is. Don't get me wrong everything was good - I just feel it lacked something - it could be because I only stayed in the comfort room without a view. All in all it suited our needs for the short time we were in Paris and I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: gsully1
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for our stay in Paris with the help of Tripadvisor. All of my communications with the hotel were promptly answered and helpful. I emailed ahead to set up a shuttle from airport to hotel and it was promptly taken care of. I had asked for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and was blown away when arriving in my room to see such a great view! The room was small but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean and well decorated. We enjoyed our 3 days at this hotel and would certainly recommend it. There are many restaurants close by and it is an easy walk to the Eiffel and the hop-on bus route. The ladies at the front desk were always pleasant and ready to give whatever advice asked for. If I ever get back to Paris, I'll stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: therogersfamily44
Reviews.Content: Smaller boutique hotel, clean, great location, friendly staff! Make sure to upgrade to corner rooms with views of Tour Eiffel, as it is truly a spectacular view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: mtb331
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and if I return I will stay at this location again. The rooms are very clean and tastefully decorated. I could not find a better value for the location and the view. The staff was very helpful and spoke good english. They were able to recommend good locations for meals and as I found in much of Paris, it is surrounded by cafes. I can not say enough positve things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend”
Reviews.Author: gibraltarr
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel on the strength of good reviews on TA. I was making the booking on behalf of myself and 3 other work colleagues. I wanted to be confident we would all have a good weekend - I was not disappointed. All my dealings with the hotel prior to our arrival were professional and prompt. We tried to get bookings for the Moulin Rouge but had left it too late, the hotel clearly made an effort to help us. The lift was tiny, fitting only 4 people or 2 people and 2 cases at a time. The room was not large, but this is Paris. The view of the Eiffel tower was lovely. We thought it strange that the shower and toilet were in different rooms but this was not really a problem. We did have to criticise the quality of the towels. They felt more like bathmats than towels. It was the only criticism. We did not try the food, we did not have time to stop for breakfast on the first 2 days and then the 3rd day we went to Rue Cler which was just around the corner and we ate very well for only seven euro. The hotel was in easy reach of the metro and obviously near to the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. We walked to Boulevard Sainte-Germain - it was a long way, but we were enjoying the shopping experiences along the way.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: grad98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel in April and just loved it! The room was just as I had reserved, the staff was very friendly and helpful( especially when we printed our boarding passes) and the breakfast was very good. We would recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “made the trip to Paris even more special!”
Reviews.Author: NC07
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st review on trip advisor as i feel that this hotel definitely warrants a review! From the minute we arrived, we were welcomed with such warmth and sincerity. (something that we were not really expecting, being in Paris) We arrived earlier than our check-in time but that was no problem, they just took 5 minutes to inspect whether the room was ok and then we were allowed up. we stayed at Room 25 and it was a lot bigger than we had expected. we could see half of the Eiffel Tower from the window (the other half was covered by the trees). The beds were really comfortable and after a long day of sightseeing around Paris, it was the perfect place to come to. I would definitely be coming back here......what a pleasant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_A009
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern, convenient location near attractions and food. Staff was helpful and friendly. Loved I could get a glass of wine in lobby area! View of the Eiffel tower was beautiful from our room. Especially at night!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mapleleaf18
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely and clean with absolutely sound-proof windows. We could not believe how the busy street noise immediately below our room was completely blocked out! The staff were so very helpful - from booking taxis to tracking down specific shops and booking excursions. The hotel is situated a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower with many excellent restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again when we return to Paris. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: bfulench
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Duquesne. We were fortunate enough to get a room on the top floor with a balcony and a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was great when we initially booked the room. They let us know that the best room in the hotel was available, but for only 1 of the 2 nights. We agreed to take that room the first night and switch for the 2nd night. The hotel is very close to Rue Cler and a 10-minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. It is also a 5 minute walk from the Metro station, which was very useful when trying to get to the other main Paris attractions. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially for a couple that knows zero French!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: katecharland
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. Not only is it in an excellent location (and a quiet location which was nice) - the hotel was attractive, clean and comfortable. Most importantly though - the staff went out of their way to be helpful and give suggestions. We would stay there again the next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingAggie
Reviews.Content: For the price, this place is hard to beat. My wife and I stayed here during our 4 day vacation in Paris. It's less than a 20 euro taxi ride from Gare du Nord (train station) if you are arriving on the Eurostar chunnel train from London. It's about a 5 minute walk to Les Invalides, 8 min walk to the Eiffel tower and a 2 minute walk to the closest Metro station. The hotel is very clean and quiet. It appears to have been recently renovated. We stayed in their smallest room with a king-sized bed. There was just enough room for 2 small night stands, a desk, dresser / closet and small flat screen TV on the wall (only CNN and BBC News English channels available so be sure to put some movies on your laptop or ipad). The bathroom was smallish and some of the larger Americans, like myself, might have trouble using the toilet and shower...but it's doable. The best part was that the Air Conditioner works very well which is a big plus for us Texans! My only gripe was the room safe is too small to hold my laptop and other expensive electronics. The all you can eat breakfast costs about 12 Euros each...which is reasonable if you were to buy the same breakfast at the grocery store 2 blocks away. They had basic cereals, milk, OJ, croissants and some pastries. My wife says that they also had slightly undercooked meat and eggs :) The breakfast staff also made me a double espresso every morning which was greatly appreciated. The staff was very nice and made us feel very welcome. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully placed”
Reviews.Author: CAWItravellers
Reviews.Content: We just left and this place was amazing. If you have the chance book room 56. We stayed in this room and it has the perfect view of the Eiffel tower, you can even see it while lying in bed. You will have to book far on advance during the summer though, we booked 5 months in advance and could only get two nights in the hotel the rest was booked. This place is the best value and has a great location within walking distance of everything. Absolutely fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great View!”
Reviews.Author: iluvtravel_11
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel! We had a room with a balcony that had a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. The room itself was somewhat small, but very nice and clean and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They also have a computer you can use free of charge which was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning- didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Willstars
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in room 55- the view was all we'd been promised and more! We couldn't fault this fabulous boutique hotel perfectly located and with views straight from a postcard!!! We can't wait to go back for our next visit to Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hetel Duquesne Eiffel - A disaster, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: orthophonist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had reserved a room for 6 nights. The room offered was very noisy and we could not sleep. They promised a quiet room for the next day. However, it turned out to be an incredibly small SINGLE ROOM! When we complained, we were told that that was all that was available. We had prepaid or we would have checked out. Not only were we required to spend out entire stay there, there were bedbugs in the bed and what appeared to be fecal matter on the sheets. The promised reimbursement for the single room rate never materialized. As far as I am concerned this was the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed Prepaid Reservation Yet They Were Booked”
Reviews.Author: nunce1
Reviews.Content: We only got to see the lobby of this hotel. We had booked our reservation (and paid in full at the time of booking) 2.5 months in advance of our trip after hours of careful research. The hotel apparently didn't see our reservation until after we arrived. As you can imagine, it had been booked full by the time we arrived. They found us another hotel in a completely different part of the city and paid the bill. Unfortunately the second hotel was a complete dump and we didn't get any money refunded. Based on our experience, we felt completely taken advantage of and would not recommend this hotel. Efforts to resolve the issue after returning home were stonewalled -- each attempt to contact the hotel was met with a request to call back another time because the manager was not available (attempted on 5 different days that they told us to call back on and yet a manager was never available).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, stylish boutique hotel with heart stopping views of the Eiffel tower!”
Reviews.Author: Willstars
Reviews.Content: This lovely, recently renovated hotel was highly recommended and did not disappoint! Decor is tasteful, bed comfortable and location perfect. Highly recommend for first time visitors to Paris or romantics looking for a great hotel with magic views. All the photos are real!

Reviews.Title: “Best View in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GoTravelAL
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about how much we loved this hotel. Stayed in room 55 with the most incredible view of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony. The hotel is lovely, clean, friendly, and has a very helpful English speaking staff. They even served scrambled eggs and Canadian bacon every morning in addition to the traditional Parisian type breakfast foods. Our beds were very comfortable with very nice pillows and linens. The bathroom had a full bathtub/shower. They have a computer available in the lobby for guests and also wi-fi without any additional charge for the internet service. The Eiffel Tower and metro/bus stops are super convenient. And close by there are shops and cafes as well as the Rue Cler area. We are so glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: FeFrareZanetti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near the Eiffel Tower, the best neighborhood in Paris. The room has good size, is clean and comfortable. And with an amazing view! A luxury to wake up and see the tower from the window. The hotel staff was available all the time and very courteous, showed restaurants, got a shuttle to the airport with the best price, and everything else. It was a perfect stay. My husband and I had the greatest time in Paris at Hotel Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, and its all about service.”
Reviews.Author: Montesir
Reviews.Content: - Excellent location close to Invalides and Eiffel Tower. - Room 45 highly recommended with a view of the Eiffel Tower - Friendly and helpful staff. - Close to Metro stations (Invalides and St Francois Xavier) - Clean rooms, comfy beds, pillows. - Everyone speaks English which is very helpful. - Quick check in and check out. - Breakfast is okay. - I would stay here again any day.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent proactive and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: KieranMcC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this wonderful hotel on four occasions since 2009 . This year we brought our seven and eight-year old daughters , their aunt and grandmother . In addition we had eight other travellers from Australia joining us for a tour up to the Somme , many of them first-timers to Paris . All of them were very pleased with the standard of accomodation , breakfast , helpfulness and friendliness of the staff , but our children most of all appreciated the warm and genuine greeting we received from Jenni when we walked through the door . The kids told us they felt like they were "at home " - a big rap from some tired little travellers, who had seen some pretty offhand behaviour elsewhere ( not in Paris , I hasten to say ) . Can I thank the HDE team for their generosity in relation to our welcoming function for the tour . Vous etes tres gentils .

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly, and WOW what a view!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KMHOO
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris with my mother and we stayed for 4 days at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. It was a wonderful little boutique hotel located about 10 minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower (3 minutes walk from the closest Metro station and 5 minutes walk from Les Invalides). The hotel itself is clean, charming, comfortable and had the most wonderful, friendly staff. Jennifer, Melane and Helene went out of their way to help us and make sure we had a wonderful stay and even helped to arrange excursions. We stayed in Room #55 which had a full, direct view of the Eiffel Tower and a wrap-around balcony! They have a few other rooms with either direct or partial views of the tower, so be sure to reserve as far in advance as possible. There are very few negative points for travelers to be aware. The room walls are thin so we could hear other guests at times during our stay. Also, the lift is a bit tight and the rooms are small according to American standards (but apparently quite generous according to Parisian standards!) Finally, though the hotel seemed to be non-smoking, it was common to smell cigarette smoke in the lobby/lounge area (but our hotel room was completely smoke free!) The neighborhood is fairly quiet and relatively clean with tree-lined streets; the cafe nightlife really picks up on weekend nights but it was a block or two away so no noise or crowds bothered us. We felt very safe in the area and it was convenient being walking distance to attractions, cafes, and transportation. I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: nbowsher
Reviews.Content: We loved that the hotel was so close to the Rue Cler and the subway (the Metropolitan), but was still so quiet and we highly recommend the location. For breakfast, we walked to the Rue Cler to have coffee and croissants at an outdoor cafe and then we would go to the subway stop called the Ecole Militaire and head out to see all the sights. The Eiffel Tower was only a few blocks away so we walked over on several nights to see it lit up. After sightseeing, we would go back to our hotel to recharge and then wander around the area which is filled with good restaurants and cafes to people watch. All of the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The bathroom was bright, spacious and clean and the bed linens felt very luxurious. The room was small by north american standards, but had all the essentials (small flat screen TV, mini bar, desk, nightstands and reading lights). The air conditioning made the room very comfortable. My husband had a sinus infection and the hotel has a service on call that they were able to reach a Doctor for us who came to our room in a half hour and wrote up a prescription. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and Helene recognized the occasion for us.

Reviews.Title: “very nice staff, small but clean rooms, view of the tippy tip of Eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: scoocheee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute. We were booked in a different hotel where they promised a view of the Eiffel Tower, but being French and very unaccommodating to Americans, there was no view. We stayed one night and then just walked into the Duquesne and were able to get a room there. The staff was very very nice. Breakfast 12-13 Euros was good. They actually had scrambled eggs along with the typical delicious croissants, coffee. The location is very nice. Close to Rue Cler and excellent restaurants. We had a view of the tip of the Eiffel Tower-no extra charge, although I think our rooms were rated 'superior'. Never saw their standard rooms. Rooms were small, but perfectly adequate. Nice lobby with internet computer which was free for quests.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly employees, nice decor and tidy and clean, but very noisey and tiny.”
Reviews.Author: khoudek
Reviews.Content: While the service was friendly, and the room was clean, the room was unbelievably small, considering we booked there biggest room. It had a king bed with a lounging sofa and a desk in which you literally had a foot space around to walk from spot to spot in the room. The bathroom was nicely appointed with a separate toilet room. This is where we stored our luggage as there was no room elsewhere. We didn't bring a lot of luggage for our 2 week stay, 1 carry on and 1 med size suitcase each, so if you plan on using this hotel pack sparsely. Our main complaint, one that truly put a crimp in the vacation, was that the air conditioning was being revamped during our stay. The weather was in the 80s and the room had direct sunlight, thus resulting in a stuffy hot sleep situation. The hotel gave us a fan and told us to open the windows, which we did and then listened to construction from across the street during the day and paris night life during the wee small hours of the night. In fact the construction across the street was loud even with the windows closed. The new air started back up the day before we left. On a more specific note, the bed was ultra firm. I have arthritis in my right hip and found this bed to aggrevate it until I ended up softening it a bit by laying on the blankets. We did try to find a different hotel after spending one night here, however, we couldn't find anything with a 2 week stay option open. On a more positive note the staff was very friendly, one giving great tips as to resturants that were great dining experiences, the room and hotel were spotless, and the hotel's location was very convenient to the attractions and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, friendly front desk team”
Reviews.Author: travtips4us
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel as part of a Rick Steve's tour along with some extra nights before and after the tour. The reservations for our independent stay were handled efficiently, promptly and seamlessly. We stayed in two different rooms at beginning and end of our two week trip. The layout/size was different in each but all the amenities for comfort were in both.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: carpeoccasio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel at the same time as some other reviewers who complained about the work on the air conditioning system. We were on the top floor (room 56), and even with the work taking place almost directly above us, we never heard a sound while in our room. Most hotels don't announce when work will be done, and to be fair they were probably at the mercy of the contractor. It was also just before the start of the high season so things have to be spruced up and put in order. As a way of apology the hotel gave every room a free bottle of champagne. All that being said, my wife and I had a wonderful stay. Yes the rooms are small, but that's the norm in Europe. The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are modern, and the hotel is located in a quite yet centrally located area, close to the Eiffel Tower and the Latin Quarter. And speaking of the Eiffel Tower, what a view we had from our room! My wife would lie in bed at night and watch the tower sparkle. I was fond of standing on the balcony watching the tower light up as the sun went down. As for the staff, they were the best. We got wonderful restaurant recommendations, helpful tips and suggestions, a quick check in and check out, even a very last minute airport shuttle. Hotel Duquesne Eiffel is a very good boutique hotel at a reasonable cost in the City of Light.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: LillyFred
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris so I cannot compare this hotel to others but what I can say is that the staff is amazing! They were 100% helpful with all of our needs, from helping us navigate the metro and bus system, to recommending restaurants, to recommending out-of-the-way sights, to printing out map directions and helping with parking after we'd rented a car, they were always ready to assist with a smile! The rooms were neat, clean and relatively quiet for a major city and the location was incredible! Would definitely stay again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: RustyMayes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend here after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and weren't disappointed. Situated close the the military school and not far from the Eiffel Tower, this is a reasonably priced hotel with lovely rooms and very friendly staff. As we were spending much of our time looking around Paris we opted for a room without a view. Our room was next to the main road but we could not hear the traffic at all. There was also free wifi which we had no problems connecting to. We did not opt for breakfast so could not comment on this, but we are hoping to return to Paris soon and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, nice staff, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: kdgr
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel if you're looking for a nice, quiet, cozy, and centrally located hotel! It is a 5 min. walk to the Champs Mars which is right next to the Tour Eiffel. Also, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast is the same every day (cereal, croissants, pain au chocolate, bread, eggs, bacon, etc.). The rooms were indeed small, as written in the other reviews, but I wasn't expecting large rooms in Paris. If you are a larger person or have a lot of luggage, perhaps it is not the best hotel for you, but I actually found the smaller rooms extra cozy! I would definitely stay again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: RJL23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are not large but clean and comfortable. Helene and Jennifer were always helpful with making recommendations, giving us directions, getting us cabs and were equally as friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality, service, and attention”
Reviews.Author: shimon53
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while on business in Paris. I arrived close to midnight and check-in was quick, friendly, and efficient. The room was quiet, pleasant, and comfortable. While I would have wanted a kettle in the room, I went down to the breakfast room in the morning and they gave me complimentary coffee to take back to the room. Breakfast is tasty and nicely served. After checking-out, I left my luggage for the day and returned later in the afternoon. The front-desk staff was friendly, hospitable, and welcoming. And the hotel is just two blocks from the Metro and a short 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “We found the right hotel, just at the wrong time”
Reviews.Author: sunseekersarah
Reviews.Content: After looking at hotels in Paris for months and finally deciding on Duquesne (because of THAT view) my boyfriend and I started to get very excited about our weekend break at the beginning of April. Upon arrival on Saturday (02/04) we were warned that there was maintenance work going on on the top floor which is where our room was situated. The room itself was lovely, whilst it was expected that the room may be small we were fine storing luggage in the wardrobe. Presentation was nice and the bathroom was again of a good size. To anyone reading the review I strongly recommend getting a balcony room, the view is as amazing as the photos looked, waking up and going to sleep knowing the eiffel tower is just past the window makes the experience very memorable-it's good for photos to show off too. All was going well until Monday (04/04) which is actually my birthday when at 8am the workmen started hammering away, we had no pre warning of the work starting this early. Whilst we had plans to be up early and go exploring again it didn't really affect us to a great extent but it still wasn't pleasant. I didn't imagine opening presents to french men shouting out to each other! Whilst this I imagine this is short term there was also work going on over the other side of the road where again there was lots of noise-I imagine that work will go on for quite some time. Upon leaving the hotel there was no discount for this. Apart from this glitch I would recommend this hotel, the location is perfect theres the metro close by even though we walked everywhere as it really doesn't take that long, theres plenty of restaurants and bakeries and also a supermarket just round the corner. Its just a shame that after spending months getting excited for this trip it was slightly dampened by the work going on! Would be a full 5 stars if we had come at a time where there was no work going on and no early starts!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ABSPres
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in connecting rooms. Rooms were VERY small. Expected small rooms in Paris, but at least anticipated room to place luggage and still be able to walk around. Not a chance! Happened to be at a time that they were renovating the HVAC system, which they failed to notify us about. As a result, we were with AC for the entire time of the visit, which happened to be unseasonably warm in Paris. Could not open the windows because of the fumes from the trucks in the alley on the courtyard side, and street noise on the street side room. Had to go down daily to get washcloths, because housekeeping refused to leave any. Hotel advertised that they offered free internet. . . well, you get what you pay for. You have to get a code from the front desk, but the connection dropped every hour or so, which required you to go back down to the front desk to get a new code. Attitude of staff was generally poor, and unsympathetic to our concerns. Had to argue with the girl at the desk upon check-out about the room rate, even though I had been promised by the manager that our rate would be discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: michellePI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on reviews i got from this site and i must say i had the time of my life. The view of the eiffel tower from my room was spectacular, the room was very clean and oh my God that bed was the most comfortable bed ever. The pillows were so fluffy and supported my head brilliantly. I loved loved loved the energy and french charm of the staff. Helene and her colleague- the guy who gave me an umbrella for my evening walk, are the best! for a solo female traveller, they made me feel right at home. merci beaucoup!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: thornmist
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Paris, we decided to stay in the 7th district near the Eiffel Tower. After spending many, many hours searching through TripAdvisor, I selected Hotel Duquesne Eiffel based on the wonderful reviews, the lovely pictures, and the fact that they had a room with a (small, standing room only) balcony available. The staff was professional, kind, and helpful in our email correspondence prior to our arrival, and their friendliness did not diminish when we actually arrived. The ladies working reception during the day were happy to greet us with a smile and we did not feel embarrassed by our lack of French. The night clerk was very gracious about being woken up to check us out before 6am for an early flight. The hotel has an elevator which was small, but no smaller than most that we experienced in our European travels. The only mildly alarming thing was a sudden jerk as it slowed and stopped at its destination, but we put it down to a quirk of the elevator system and were happy not to have to climb six flights of stairs. The room itself, as one might expect from reading other reviews, was small - although I greatly amused my travel companion by exclaiming "it's bigger than I thought it would be!" It's not very well suited for people who need a lot of space or who have a lot of luggage, but no doubt the same could be said for most of the hotel rooms in Paris. The bathroom was not overly large, but the space was well-utilized and my only very minor) complaint would be that the high bathtub was a bit difficult to get in and out of. Both rooms were spotless and the maid service impeccable. We did not get the chance to try the hotel's breakfast, so cannot comment as to that. The free wi-fi was easy to use and worked perfectly, and I believe there was also a computer in the lobby available for guests who do not bring their own. Overall, we had a very nice stay at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel and the only reason we would not stay there again is that we found the 7th district too quiet for our taste, which is certainly no fault of the hotel. If you like the area, this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: dreamelegia
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after a long search on different hotel websites and was pleasantly surprised by the number of positive comments. It is the best hotel in Paris. First of all, it's a great location -10 minute walk to Eiffel tower, 5-minute walk to Metro station L'Ecole MIlitare (Metro is clean, safe and simple, and you can be at Louvre or Grand Opera in 5 minutes). Then, a lot of restaurants and brasseries around – you could sit and eat outside and enjoy Paris street life; several grocery shops, boutiques, a pharmacy and a market street with different fresh produce. Our room was on the fifth floor. From our balcony, we enjoyed viewing the sparkling Eiffel tower every night while sitting outside, surrounded by a cloud of blooming tree fragrance. Nice bedding, newly renovated rooms and a very clean bathroom. Breakfast is reasonable and rich enough to keep you full till 2-3 PM. Very-very good coffee! A very nice and cheerful cafeteria lady. Special words about the staff: very kind, professional and helpful. Helene, Jennifer and Melanie were ready to help with anything immediately. Thank you very much for your care, charm and elegance, which were additional great features to the best vacation in our life – spring week in Paris! We definitely will stay again at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay - J'adore Duquesne Eiffel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZele
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay in Paris. The gals at the front desk are so very helpful and being a short walk to the metro is great for seeing every sight in Paris. The neighborhood was primarily upper middle class, not as touristy as other areas. If you are like me and like to see the true culture of an area and especially enjoy the cafe lifestyle, this area is for you. This was my first visit to Paris and I am truly in love. I will definately stay at Duquesne Eiffel when I return. The rooms were very comfortable with good linens. I was quite surpised at how large the bathroom was. Exceeded every expectation!!

Reviews.Title: “"Wish I could've stayed longer"”
Reviews.Author: procmom
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel are friendly, extremely helpful, and they were very approachable. We were greeted literally at the door as we arrived, as one of the managers was arriving for work. Our room was ready at noon, and we were able to stow our luggage immediately and head out for the day! The location to the Eiffel Tower and the L'Ecole MIlitare metro are perfect, because in the evening the neighborhood is quiet and peaceful, yet busy and fun during the day. There are a few brasseries right next door, but we found a great breakfast one block toward the river, very very reasonable with excellent pastries and fresh orange juice and a large cafe au lait. The staff booked our shuttle back to the airport, which was so helpful as we'd been traveling for 10 days prior to arriving in Paris. Stay here and enjoy Paris. The value for the room and service is worth it! I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “i wont stay anywhere else in Paris, great hotel&staff”
Reviews.Author: citygirl28
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via the BA website and having read the reviews on trip advisor went ahead and booked. I found I concurred with all the good reviews as soon as I walked into the hotel. We were given a warm welcome and the reception area was cosy and well decorated. The first member of staff we encountered was a lady called Jennifer and she was great, she couldn’t do enough to help and accommodate us. Our room was not quite ready, as we were there early, and being there for only a few days she offered to keep our bags safe so we could get on with the exploring the city but we said we were happy to wait as we wanted to freshen up, our room was soon ready and we had a lovely room with a balcony and great views of the Eiffel Tower. The room was quite small but this is what you come to expect with city breaks in old cities so close to great attractions, but there was a doubly bed and my partner who is quite a big man didn’t complain so it comfortably fitted a couple. It was lovely and I couldn’t really have asked for more, it was so clean and immaculately turned out. We went back to reception and again were helped completely. We were on a budget and the lady recommended cheap places with good food where the locals eat. We couldn’t have done as much in the little time we had without her assistance (three nights). Also all other staff were equally as friendly, we had breakfast as part of the deal and again I could not fault this the food was lovely and there was also a large selection, the first and second day, it was unfortunate on the third when we seemed to get down a bit later than usual, they had run out but I didn’t complain, I made do with what was left, I think this highlights what a great time I had here, I could not fault it. It has taken me a while to write this review but we had free use of the Apple Mac in the hotel and when this wasn’t working well we were allowed to use the staff computer and print our boarding passes, as I said, they went so much further than most hotels. It was a gem and I have recommended it to all my friends and family and now I do on Trip Adivsor I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location ... Helpful staff ... Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: kevin_coyle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled to Paris and stayed here over her Spring Break. We chose this hotel based on Rick Steves' and TripAdvisor's recommendations. It's in a quiet part of town close to Rue Cler, the Eiffel Tower, the Hotel des Invalides, and the Rodin Museum. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from two Metro stations, making it easy to get anywhere in Paris. It's also only a 20-minute walk to an RER "C" line station, making it easy to get to Versailles. The staff was congenial and very helpful with directions to destinations and recommendations of restaurants within walking distance. We stayed in a Superior room, which was comfortable and large enough for me (6'3") and my daughter (5'10"). We had an unforgettable view of the Eiffel Tower. I plan to stay here again when I return to Paris in November.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Little Hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jkathman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great little hotel located very near the Eiffel Tower. My wife and I corresponded multiple times with the staff via email before our trip and they were always very prompt in their reply. Although rooms are a bit smaller in Europe (we booked the largest the room available knowing this, and it was still a little small compared to American rooms) it was more than large enough to accommodate us. Our Eiffel Tower view with a balcony was not like the one on their front page, but was still a beautiful view where we could take in the Paris skyline and the Eiffel tower every night. The bathroom was very nice and the service (both front desk and breakfast people downstairs) were wonderful and very helpful. In the interest of full disclosure, there was construction going on across the street, but it did not disturb us. Finally, the air-conditioning was not working which was a bit uncomfortable the last night, but I believe it will be fixed soon. For the value, location, service and view, the Duquesne Eiffel is a great bargain. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good view!”
Reviews.Author: zishung
Reviews.Content: From the hotel, I could see Eiffel and easy to walk there. Only get the map and ask the staff, I could reach any attractions of Paris. Our room was nice and good breakfast. I recommend for all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: Shetwood
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was fantastic...no problems with English. The room was cozy and nicely kept. Close to all of the major transactions via walking or Metro. Duquesne Eiffel will be my hotel of choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: HarryBambalos
Reviews.Content: The staff are so friendly and the hotel is very homely yet retains a smart, contemporary look. You will be a 5 minute stroll from the Eiffel tower, bars, cafes, the metro and a supermarket. If you ask for a corner room make sure it is on a higher storey - ours was on3td floor dinghy view of the tower (that you effectively pay extra for) was obscured by trees.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...beware of the bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: maystravels_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disappointing given the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. First of all, the standard room is very small and barely fitted 2 people and their lugguge. Definitely the size is more suited to a solo traveller. Secondly, the air-conditioning was not working, making the room really stuffy and uncomfortable. The service was also poor. I spoke to one of the hotel staff the day before my departure about booking a taxi to take me to the airport early the next morning. She took all my details and said she would book the taxi on my behalf for the time that I wanted. The next morning when I checked out and enquired about the taxi, I was told that not only had the taxi not been ordered but they didn't know anything about the booking!! Thankfully, a taxi did arrive in time to take me to the airport or I might have missed my flight - DEFINITELY NOT IMPRESSED. The worse thing however were the bed bugs. I was feeling itchy during the night and thought they were mosquitoes. The bites go worse as I was travelling home and on my arrival back to Sydney, they had swelled up and became quite red. It took a few days for the bites to subside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! - Stayed here for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JBagwell2005
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duquesne Eiffel was a wonderful home base for my new wife and me as we spent our honeymoon in Paris. The staff was terrific and really went out of their way to make our stay the best it could be. We booked several months in advance and was able to secure Room 55 (the one pictured with the great view of the Eiffel Tower). If you know you're going to be headed to Paris, book now and see what you can do to get that room. It's on the corner of the building and has a great balcony where you can get some great views of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood so it's easy to get a good night's rest but you're only a block or so away from the metro at Ecole Militaire. Also, a few blocks down is one of the best pizza restaurants I've ever found called Pizza Tina. If you're looking for an easy meal, that's definitely a place to check out. All in all, the hotel is great and I would recommend it for anyone looking to spend a nice vacation in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine235
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here with my grown daughter. We arrived early in the day after an overnight flight and they went out of their way to provide a room for us to rest in as ours wasn't ready. This was so VERY much appreciated after our long flight. We were even given a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower for our stay without even asking. Well decorated room with up to date bathroom. Very helpful staff. Close to metro station. Quiet street. Couldn't ask for more !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, cosy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chive1
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. We had room 54 which had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and which was larger than the average room I think in Paris. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was ideal with a good choice of bread and cereals. Good restaurants nearby, pricey for drinks and food but thats Paris for you. All in all a great experience and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sirmo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in January 2011. The room was nicely arranged and clean. The rooms are small but extremely comfortable, especially the bed and pillows, we had a perfect night's sleep every night we were there (6 nights). The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our french is limited but they spoke english and made every effort to say hello every time we walked into the lobby. Our friends recommended this hotel to us and likewise we would highly recommend this hotel to others. Thank you Hotel Duquesne Eiffel, we look forward to coming back soon....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel in great location with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisflanagan30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. We choose this hotel because of the good reviews and we were not disappointed. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Although the room was small it was very clean and comfortable with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The location is excellent being just a short walk to the metro. On recommendation of the staff we ate at the 7 Vin restaurant which is about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. We were so pleased with our experience there we returned to it on our last night. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish room, nice staff, good quality and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Holidaysareace
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel during August 2009. The rooms were extremely stylish with a view of the Eiffel tower. Very clean and comfortable. Really helpful and friendly staff. Not too far to walk to the nearest Metro station. The only disappointment for us was the breakfast which was very basic and in a windowless basement. It would not prevent us from returning but we'd probably breakfast elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Kalpang
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful 7 night stay the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. This has been my 5th stay at the Duquesne over the years and each time I am there it only get's better. Working for a 4 Star 4 Diamond Resort myself, I know how hard it is to meet the demands of hotel guests. However based on my experience and observance of the Staff at the Duquesne they meet these demands with style and elegance always thinking of the guests experience. The rooms are comfortable,clean, well appointed and quiet. All of the windows are double glazed, so if you want to sleep in (but why would you in Paris?) it's certainly not a problem. I feel that I have found a home in Paris that is filled with family and friends as that is how I have been treated. If you're looking for a great and safe location that is accessable by either walking or a short metro ride to some of the major sights in Paris look no further. The Duquesne will certainly be sure that you will want to come back for more. To Olivier, Julie, Jennifer, Elena, Melanie, Patrick & Jackie (breakfast attendant), Merci Beaucoup for your gracious hospitality. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great HOTEL, GREAT service, BEST Location”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th visit to this GEM and wouldn't even consider staying at another hotel. We can afford the Four Seasons and hotels of that stature but they couldn't come close to the charm and service this hotel provides. The staff, Jennifer, Melanie, Helene, Patrick, Julie, Oliver, Alain and the rest of the crew which I can't remember all the names, are outstanding, helpful and so knowledgeable. Despite the quiet location, it is the best and safest location in Paris. Close to the METRO, Restaurants, Eiffel Tower, Invalides, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: humancap
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this lovley hotel. Very friendly and accomodating staff. Room was very comforortable, and yes, the bed is a lttle hard. Romantic view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. Very clean and well kept. No clock in the room. Breakfast is very nice with the usual scrambled eggs, juice, ham, pasteries etc, but only a canned fruit salad for fruit. But overall quite nice. We really liked the location, a little quiter than right in the heart of the city, but only a 2 block walk to the Metro. And easy walking distance to the Tower, Invalides, etc. Would definatley stay again and do recommend.

Reviews.Title: “You definitely should consider this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NaturalizedTexan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located to a number of museums (Les Invalides, Rodin, etc.), sights such as the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, and Rue Cler where there is affordable dining and shopping. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and were willing to listen to my broken French patiently. We definitely will stay here again when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris - would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: SusanH115
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very conveniently to the Eiffel Tower as well as the Metro. Spent 5 days here last March with my 2 older teenage kids. We had a blast - saw it all! The staff is really friendly and helpful - a big plus for me since I don't speak French!

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful when booking from hotel's website”
Reviews.Author: travelgretta
Reviews.Content: I did not have the pleasure of actually staying at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel, unfortunately - just the insult of paying for two nights, due to grievous glitch in the hotel's website booking engine. When I clicked "Rates/Booking" and then entered my dates of March 5, for 2 nights, the availability page popped open to reveal which rooms were available. I was assuming the available rooms were for March 5 & 6, and what I didn't notice was that the small script at the top of the page had entirely different dates. The hotel was unsympathetic to this issue, and did not offer a refund, nor bother to address what was happening with their website. I sincerely hope the hotel fixes this soon. I'm sure, given the many reviews I had read, that it is a lovely property. I just wish I had the opportunity to experience what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tkostas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a long tour around Europe with my girlfriend and another couple, just before Christmas. We booked to stay at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel after looking at so many reviews on TripAdvisor and we certainly made the right choice. This place is nothing short of top class. The hotel ticked all the boxes for what we consider a great hotel, an excellent location (most places accessible by only switching on the metro once, generally at Concorde), the most amazing hotel staff and a lovely, comfortable room with a clean and spacious bathroom. From the moment we walked in we were greeted very warmly by the staff member at the reception and we were even lucky enough to check in ahead of check in time. Over the stay, the hotel was able to recommend places to go, explain to us how to get to places, book us transfers to the airport and attend to any other request we had. They even booked us dinner one night, which turned out to be great because even though reservations weren't required at this restaurant we were able to go ahead of a 45-60min wait for a table because we said we were staying at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. If like most people, you want a pleasant, comfortable hotel that is conveniently located and you know will leave you smiling and glad you stayed there, then I couldn't recommend this hotel any higher. You will love staying here and we will gladly return when we visit Paris again! A special thank you to the staff and management that made our trip to Paris such a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: CEM80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near to most things, not far from a metro stop and a fabulous bakery. They were happy to hold our bags for us before and after check-in/out. The view of eiffel tower is lovely. Room is small, but hey, it's Paris, and it's expected. I thought the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Fairytale in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bucketlist16
Reviews.Content: After dreaming and planning to see Paris all our lives, we finally got there in December during our first holiday in Europe for our 35th Wedding Anniversary Celebrations! We wanted to make sure our first experience was an unforgettable one so I researched extensively for a long time for a suitable hotel. I was very impressed with the reviews of the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel on tripadvisor. The location was exactly where we wanted to be, in a safe and friendly district, within walking distance of all the main attractions and the ultimate for me was to have a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room without paying a fortune, and to our absolute delight the hotel was exactly my dream come true and more! Thankyou tripadvisor for alerting me to this gem. We loved the fact that it was a small and intimate hotel which was another reason we were drawn to it. After an arduous delayed flight from Prague because of the snowy weather, from the minute we stepped into the lobby, we were treated with warmth and consideration. The hotel staff had organised the Airport Shuttle bus to pick us up and this was great and cheaper than a taxi. Helene confirmed that we had one of the top floor rooms, that I had been very careful to book early, with a cute little balcony(if you can possibly get one, do so) and on entering the room, we saw the absolutely stunning view of the Eiffel Tower. At night it sparkled and became even more beautiful! Yes, the room was quite small as expected from the reviews but we found it very adequate in size for our three night stay. It was well decorated and it and the tiny bathroom were spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable and cosy but who could sleep with that magic view out of the window! I was up all night taking photos! The next morning there was a dusting of snow over everything and we felt like we were in a fairy tale, coming from sunny Queensland where we never see this! We thought we would try the breakfast room the first morning and the ladies that took care of us here were delightful. The choice was limited but adequate and the selection on offer was delicious and you could eat as much as you liked. It is extra on top of the room rate, but we both felt it was good value. The cosy atmosphere and the great service brought us back again each morning of our stay. Not only Helene but all the front desk staff , including the managers Jennifer and Olivier(sorry if I've forgotten the names correctly) were so patient , considerate and helpful of two very inexperienced travellers, far from home, with very little French and I can't say enough about how they looked after us and put our minds at rest with information about things to do or how to get around. I only wish I had known that we could have booked some of our city tours through them. Keep this in mind if you would like to do this. We had booked a night tour from Australia which turned into a disaster and had returned unexpectadly very late/early morning from this tour and we were worried that because it was a small hotel, there would be no one up to let us in so we were very grateful to find the night watchman there to welcome us home! We were impressed and grateful! The lobby is a very welcoming, cosy, bright and happy area to relax or check emails(from memory, free) and it was here that we got to taste our first French Cognac! During our time in Europe, we experienced mainly five and four star hotels and I can honestly say that none were better than the Duquesne. It may not have had the size or the plushness of the bigger hotels, but we felt we got a six star experience and the hotel evokes such good memories of our trip, it became our favourite. I would never think of staying in any other hotel in Paris. Thankyou team Duquesne(and cute puppy!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller100Global
Reviews.Content: This hotel really offers great value for money: - The people working in the hotel have excellent attitude and are pleasant and polite (which is not always common in this city) - The location is excellent, close to a lot of attractions - Rooms are well appointed and clean Prices are very reasonable for Paris. Really an excellent find.

Reviews.Title: “My first Trip Advisor review because Hotel Duquesne Eiffel deserves it”
Reviews.Author: skyenat
Reviews.Content: Like most others on here, my partner & I booked this hotel after reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. The location was brilliant, and as highly recommended, we booked room 55, (6 months in advance) and we were not disappointed. Everytime we would walk past the window and see the Eiffel Tower we would just stop and stare in amazement, especially when it was sparkling at night! Then if you stepped onto the balcony, you could see Les Invalides & even Sacre Coeur in the distance. Yes the rooms are a little small but you expect that in Paris and it certainly was not an issue for us. The decor is aesthetically pleasing and is certainly inoffensive, clean and the bed was very comfortable. I also cannot speak highly enough of the staff here. My pathetic french wasn't even worth attempting and all the staff were very fluent in English, had great senses of humour and always greeted us with a warm smile and 'how was your day?" upon our return in the evenings. It felt like coming home to a warm haven after being out and about in the fresh chill of a Paris winters' day. They even shared their chocolates with us! I've never come across such personable hotel staff in all of my travels so a big thankyou, as it really made our experience memorable. I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone and have already started spreading the word.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Leeny3112
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here after reading tripadvisors reviews - and it was just as advertised. Great hotel in a great location - close to the metro and eiffel tower. The rooms are small but comfortable. The rooms were well decorated and the bed was very comfortable after a long day exploring the city. The breakfast room was charming and food was good. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful and polite. Our french is not very strong so we we're very thankful that the everyone at the front desk spoke great english. The lobby computer with free internet was great so we could check in with family.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: LizzieD79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Duquesne twice over the Christmas break - once in a smaller room as emergency accommodation during the terrible snow storms which left us stuck in Paris; and subsequently a week later in a superior room during a planned stay over the new year period. We absolutely adored this hotel. The decor is gorgeous, with rooms having been refurbished in a warm and charming style.
