The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the location is extremely convenient (there is a metro stop about 2 mins from the hotel, which allows access to most places throughout Paris, and there are plenty of cafes and patisseries within walking distance). The staff were friendly and amazingly helpful. On numerous occasions they helped us try to find ways to deal with flights and trains being cancelled due to the extreme weather conditions at the time, and even allowed us to use their internet facilities to book travel arrangements after we had already checked out of the hotel. The man on the desk at night even came out with us during a snow storm to help us find a taxi, even though this meant he had to go back to work quite wet! We were always greeted with a friendly smile when returning to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, and staff were always happy to help us with things that language barriers would have otherwise prevented us from doing (such as making/confirming restaurant reservations). The first room we stayed in was very small, but still lovely and a great place to stay considering that we were not there to linger in the room, but to explore the city. The second room was booked well in advance and had a view of the Eifel Tower (room 35). This room was substatially larger, and was a wonderful place to stay in order to experience the romance of Paris. It was lovely viewing the Eifel Tower twinkling every night from the comfort of our room. We specifically requested this room at the time of booking, and I would recommend that you do this well in advance of your stay in order to secure a room with this view. Even without the view, I think the superior rooms would be well worth staying in. We ill definitely stay here again and have already recommended this hotel to friends and family visiting Paris in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme”
Reviews.Author: luiztheodoro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on honeymoon and stayed at the hotel for five days and everything was perfect. The dailly room cleaness is done very careful, so congratulation to all of the cleaning crew. Ok, the rooms is too small, but who cares when you are in one of the most beautifull Paris places? The breakfast room is very cosy, creating a perfect atmosphere to enjoy all the delights offered by the hotel every morning. The hotel staff are all very friendly, even though we have not had much contact with them, wich means we had no problem with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: menlil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, well appointed and conveniently located. The people...Helene, Mel, Jenni and Patrick made the stay extraodinary...I cannot thank them enough for their kindness and help. We will definitely recommend the Duquesne. Pat and Tiger Lily

Reviews.Title: “Classic tiny European-style rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jack90291
Reviews.Content: Three people could barely fit in the elevator, and our room was cozy but claustrophobic. We stayed here on a lay-over on December 31, 2010, and the proximity to the Eiffel Tower was great. The staff was helpful and attentive, and they gave us a box of chocolates upon our arrival. Nice buffet breakfast in the basement. From our room, we could see the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Still Remains A Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: RobertaL
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Duquesne (first time was in October 2008) and it continues to be a wonderful experience. We celebrated my sister's 50th birthday and everything was perfect. I had prearranged a surprise bottle of champagne which was waiting for us upon arrival. I requested room #56 which did not appear to age at all since we last stayed there. The room is a superior double with a magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower. Spending time on the balcony each day after touring and shopping is truly a treat. Hotel Duquesne Eiffel is conveniently located within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, cafes, grocery stores and bakeries. Exploring other areas of Paris is very easy since buses and metro are close by. The neighborhood also boasts fantastic restaurants including Le Florimond and Violon D'Ingres. The one thing that makes this hotel a great place is the staff. Always helpful and willing to take out time to explain directions, make reservations, etc. Since we were only there 4 nights, we mainly dealt with Jennifer (one of the nicest hotel employees I have ever encountered). I have stayed in other Paris hotels but since returning to the Duquesne, I've decided to make it my "residence" for all future trips! Thank you for making my vacation memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: justhadtosay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over New Year for part of our honeymoon, after a lot of research into hotels in Paris. It was a perfect choice. The corner room (45) we were given had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. We booked a superior room approx a year ahead so did hope for a good room but we were not disappointed. Having said that, the room was expensive, but hey this is Paris! The hotel is not the Ritz but very comfortable, very clean and friendly. The weather was cold but the rooms very warm and cosy. It is also near to many cafes/restaurants and of course museums, famous buildings etc - the location is excellent. The service was great. The Receptionist helped us print off boarding passes, looked after our baggage and generally was very helpful and tolerant of our lack of French. We'd certainly recommend the hotel for a trip to Paris for location, service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for price but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LoveaGoodPub
Reviews.Content: This hotel was what we expected. Clean, good staff, not overpriced, good location, but very small rooms. Having stayed in NYC many nights, we expected similar hotel sizes in Paris, and thats what we got. We would recommend a stay here, as the location is good, and if you're in Paris, you just need your room for sleeping, as the city is the attraction. Walking distance to Rue Cler area, Napolean's Tomb and EIffel Tower. Good centralized location for seeing city. Watch out for somewhat tricky doors for rooms, as it took us a few tries to open them (Have to pull towards you first, then turn handle and push in... definitely felt stupid asking desk for help :-)) Recommended by Rick Steves, and his tour group was staying there while we were.

Reviews.Title: “What a View...”
Reviews.Author: Jenjen23_10
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I just came back from an amazing weekend break in Paris. The hotel was gorgeous. The View from our balcony was breath-taking [Room 51]. The hotel was close to the Eiffel Tower [5-10 mins walk] and some lovely restaurants. I was in a location were we could walk everywhere, and walking in the opposite direction to the tower was some lovely shops and restaurants, Best Tip: WALK everywhere! you can enjoy Paris instead of the walls of the metro. Tourist attractions such as the Arc de Triomphe and Notre Dame were free for us which was a pleasant surprise [18-25 years old with a EU passport] From CDG airport we got the Rossi Bus to L'Opera and then the metro from there to Ecole Militaire. It was easy and cheap however, the metro was mad. The hotel was nice and central to getting to everywhere, Invalides was just at the bottom of the road [to get some idea where the hotel was]. We had a short stay at the hotel and we did actually say its a shame we can't spend more time at the hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable, room was very clean and beautifully decorated. On arrival we had Champagne and Roses [ However, there is a very expensive charge for this as we sadly found out on departure due to a hiccup in translation] Other than that mishap, the hotel was wonderful, I would go back to this hotel and I have recommended it to Friends and Family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Robbbbie-H
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my trip to propose to my girlfriend (she said YES!!) wanted a room with a view of the Tower and WOW what a view and a terrific price. I had lots of contact with the hotel staff before we arrived and they were just ace. They all spoke very good english but on most emails I did try to use the Micrsoft translator - well its polite to try even iff you don't get it quite right. Location was really good only 5 mins from the Metro, 10 mins to the tower, 5 to Napoleon's tomb. Breakfast was simple, plentiful and nice and the rooms were just lovely, really lovely. Very warm but just as well as it was -5 outside! Its not in the hurley burley of Paris but is very close to what you want due to the metro. You really can book this Hotel with absolute confidence and the views are stunning. Oh and there is a great Thai restaurant next to the hotel if you arrive knackered and need a quick, close, tasty feed.

Reviews.Title: “Precisely what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: so_very_hungry
Reviews.Content: This summer, my wife and I went to Paris as part of a trip. The beginning of the trip was filled with me forgetting how to speak French, problems with a bank back home and general sleep deprivation. However, the one thing we did not have a problem with was the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. From the moment we walked into the cozy lobby, we felt instantly welcomed and cared for. The staff was extremely helpful in budget-friendly restaurant recommendations as well as offering assistance in sorting out my bank issues. As jet-lagged and self-conscious as we may have been when we came in that first day , the staff was pleasant and understanding. Everyone in there was wonderful to work with. Our room was fantastic. While it did not look out on the tower, we found it to be precisely what we wanted -- comfortable bed, flawlessly clean, attractive bathroom and tub/shower combo. It is important to remember, however, that the rooms in this hotel, while well appointed, are probably not what most casual American travelers are used to. The room was small (think: larger cruise ship cabin), but that's ok. Unless you are planning on sharing one room for more than two people, the space in these rooms is perfectly fine. And after a long day of traveling, you might not even care about how big the room is so long as the bed is comfortable (which it was). The room was great and very clean. Exactly what I expect. The location of the hotel is fantastic. You are just a few blocks away from a Metro stop, Les Invalides, the Eiffel Tower and a bunch of cafes. Since this part of Paris is predominantly residential, there is a supermarket just around the corner which was a huge plus for us when we didn't feel like spending a lot for lunch some days. The neighborhood is pretty quiet at night, so if you like a nice evening walk without too much traffic this is the right part of Paris for it. In all, our experience at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel was wonderful. The staff was fantastic, the room was great, and we were sorry to have to leave it. This hotel is a must for people who value great service with a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with a view”
Reviews.Author: MalandJess
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights room 55 at the end of August, sorry for the late post. Helene made our stay wonderful from the start,even learning how to make a gin and tonic to make me feel at home.The view is wonderful and there are great restaurants nearby. This was the first stop of a month long European trip and set a very high standard for others to follow. Many thanks to the staff especially Helene for making our stay enjoyable,hope you enjoyed the book. Mal& Jess

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area, helpful staff and great view of the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: Bulldoglb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights and had a wonderful experience. We stayed in Room 46 and went to sleep at night laying in our bed and watching the nightly light shows at the tower...magic! The staff was very helpful, Jennifer made our week a success with her great suggestions for restaurants. The rooms were not large by US standards but large enough to be comfortable. The location we enjoyed because it is a quieter area on the south bank and the subway was about a 2 or 3 minute walk from the hotel to get anywhere in the city. Great experience!! We plan to go back and stay in the Duquesne in the future.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Venus325
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in room 56 and WOW, what an incredible view!!!! The room itself was very nice as well and pretty spacious. It had two balcony doors that you could see the eiffel tower out of perfectly!!!! You could also step out onto the balcony which was really nice as well. The bed was very comfortable, and it was incredible to fall asleep looking out at a twinkling Eiffel Tower. Wow!!! The bathroom was a good size and very modern. Though the room overall was very clean and comfortable, the shower could have done with a better scrubbing as there was some mold in the grout in a few places. We found this to be true in the majority of hotels we stayed in in Europe and it wasn't a big deal, though the hotel maids may want to invest in some mildew spay and grout scrubbers : ) Not a big deal really, especially considering how much we liked this hotel overall. Jennifer at the reception desk was friendly and extremely helpful, ordering taxis, giving advice on getting places, even calling to confirm our cooking class for us as they only spoke French and we were having trouble communicating with them to confirm. We were traveling with my mother-in-law who got room 54, which was also supposed to have a view of the Eiffel Tower. Though, when we checked into the rooms, we realized that's true, but only if you step out onto the balcony to see it as it is on the side of the building. From the room windows itself you don't see the tower at all. Since we had been promised a view from both rooms, we were a little disappointed in that, especially as it was pretty cold in mid-November to be standing on her balcony to see the tower. But overall, we really liked this hotel and would definitely book room 56 again if we are ever in Paris. Also, it was very centrally located, only a couple of blocks from the metro and bus stations and maybe a 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “good for its location”
Reviews.Author: monopteros
Reviews.Content: Being in Paris, this hotel is excellent, altough a bit overpriced. Out of Paris, it would maybe have 1 or 2 stars only. The room is comfortable, but very small. The bathroom is slightly bigger than an airplane toilet. Overally the hotel situation is very good and practical for visiting Paris. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Views in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: rota21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room #55 and had the most perfect room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Paris skyline. The staff was very knowledgable and helpful, even had a basketful of different adapters for me to choose from when I wanted to recharge my camera. I'm kind of a light sleeper and flop like a fish when I sleep...I don't even remember falling asleep, the beds were that comfortable. The breakfast was so filling and good... pain au chocolat!!! I felt sad that I only got to spend a little time with Leeloo, the hotel resident dog, but she was a cutie and we had things to see and do... and eat. And, we got the best room at a discount for staying in the off season! I cannot say enough good things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: susan054
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 54 & it has a view of the Eiffel Tower by stepping out on to the balcony, we got some great shots. Great location & near to the metro, lots of bistros & specialist shops. We loved the atmosphere & & service of the hotel. Anything we asked they answered readily, they booked restaurants & a taxi to Orly airport. (33€) And more important, my sister in Australia arranged to buy us breakfast for our anniversary & it was done with no hassle! We left a photograph & Jennifer kindly sent it to us & wouldn't let us pay for the postage. We felt we were in Paris and a part of Paris not tourists but travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all tripadvisor reviews, I've managed to locate this gem in Paris. I stayed in room 56 from 1nov to 5nov. The amazing room has a direct view of the Eiffel tower, from the table and even on the bed! The room was clean but what make this hotel special, has to be their service. Special thanks to Helene and Jennifer for their unbelievable service! I wrote to them with regards to my proposal plan and they recommended a dinner cruise. They helped with the reservations with Bateaux Parisiens and even arranged for flowers to be delivered to the cruise! I could feel the amazing service even before I arrived! Helene was really helpful with directions when we were there and helped with lunch reservations. It's really hard to put these feelings into words but Hotel Dusquene Eiffel would definitely be our place to stay, everytime we are in Paris. Once again, thanks for making my proposal a success!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good quality, fair price”
Reviews.Author: Ryba08
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a baby and were accommodated very well by the hotel staff. The room was small but they managed to fit a cot in. Clean bathroom, pleasant neighbourhood. Excellent choice for a quiet night in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sindenb78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early September of 2010. Overall, I have to say it was a great Paris experience. The staff was always very friendly. We asked them quite a few questions...how to get around, help with booking tours, where to eat...they were always happy to help. They all spoke English as well. The room was quite smaller than we expected. Coming from the US, I think we just didn't have an idea of how small they would be (although we had heard rooms were small in Paris...we didn't realize THAT small). We were not in the room very much so it was ok for us. Hotel was walking distance to Eiffel Tower, train station, tour bus stops, and many great restaurants. We loved the area. We would stay again. Not necessarily due to the room itself (which was ok), but due to the wonderful staff and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyshultz
Reviews.Content: Mark and I absolutely loved our stay at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel! From the moment we contacted the team regarding our reservation until the day we left...the service was unmatched!!! We were drawn to this hotel based on its location, charm and stylish décor. We ended up choosing HDE after reading approx 100 hotel reviews on Trip Advisor and those who chose HDE before us were spot on...the staff is extremely friendly, the location is so convenient to the outdoor market, great places for dinner, the metro and all the major sites you would want to see. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Helene's friendly face and she was sure to take good care of us all week. Olivier, the owner of the hotel, went out of his way each day to speak to us, ask us where we were headed and even made sure we knew how to get there...he would sit down and highlight our map, put metro & bus stop info, etc...he was so awesome. Given that Mark and I have two Cavalier King Charles ourselves, we were excited to meet Leeloo the resident pup:-) Leeloo, Olivier and the team sent up a bottle of champagne and sweet card wishing me a Happy 40th Birthday! All in all, Paris is a special city, but certainly our stay at HDE was a big part of that and we would totally choose to stay there all over again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Killer view, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Zas1214
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the first leg of our European odyssey. The place is centrally located, close to the metro, the Eiffel tower and other key attractions. It's a boutique hotel with small rooms but a good portion of the rooms have stunning views of the Eiffel tower. It's very clean and the front desk staff are very helpful, speaking fluent English. A bit pricey but if you are looking to splurge a bit, it's well worth it and quite a bargain in comparison to similar hotels. Skip the breakfast and get incredible baked goods on the way to your daily outing at the multitude of bakeries and caves all around the hotel for a quarter of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accommodating stay while away.”
Reviews.Author: perducci
Reviews.Content: HDE was the first stop on our first visit to Europe. The hotel itself was appealing. It was located both slightly removed - yet near enough - to all the fun stuff we were hoping to do in Paris. Near the metro, that tower thing, the Seine, Rue Cler (for the RS crowd), plenty of cafes and bars... but a short two minute walk away from where the cafes started sprouting up, meaning the hotel itself was quiet. Best of both worlds. The interior was inviting as well, a smaller hotel that had a comfortable feeling to it (as opposed to a couple larger hotels we stayed at later, in which you were one of a herd of guests) ... Nice little sitting area, big iMac for guests, quaint little bar with a nice selection of scotch if you wanted one final night cap. Our room (20?) was small - partially based upon our American POV, and partially based upon our budget, as it seems more expensive rooms might have had more real estate - but it had a very comfy bed, and (just) enough space for our stuff. We were in Paris, so it's not like we spent any time more in our room than sleep and getting dressed/ready to go out required! The breakfast room was pretty cool looking, the spread was good enough when we needed a quick and convenient meal on a day with a tight schedule. However the extra effort of springing into action earlier our second (and more open) day in town and finding a nice cafe was worth it. And, finally, the staff. We found the staff very friendly and accommodating. They spoke English well and seemed genuinely interested in us and our adventures. They had no qualms in storing our backpacks our last day in town, after we had checked out, while we explored the city until it was time to head to the train station. Also, a nice, big gold star to the night clerk who did a wonderful job dealing with a frantic 2am Paris-time call from a non-French speaking American freaking out about a message from his booking service (hotels.com), 48 hours before departure, stating he might have lost his reservations... Merci! If/when we return to Paris, we would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: oceangipsey
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 3 nights during October 2010 in 2 interconnecting rooms. The 1st room facing the courtyard was VERY SMALL and the 2nd room a fairly good size. When we leaned out our window we had the most wonderful view of the Eiffel tower! We had breakfast all 3 mornings in the breakfast room, which was a buffet with plenty of croissants, bread and ham/cheese, fruit salad, cereals, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and juice- very good value. The rooms are decorated beautifully and the beds comfortable. The mini bar is well priced. The staff speaks English and is friendly. A special word of thanks to Helen for pre-arranging the 2 single beds for the children. The beds were comfortable. The street is relatively quiet and the neighborhood very pleasant! Our rooms were very clean and serviced every day with clean towels and toiletries replenished every day. There was free but slow wireless internet access at the hotel. The air conditioning didn't work during our stay. The rooms were hot at night but the area was quiet enough too sleep with the windows open. About a 20min walk to the Eiffel Tower. Good restaurant up the road for dinner- The Officers. Helen also arranged a Taxi to the airport which cost only Euro 60 for the 4 of us with 3 bags. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, cozy, luxurious and oh so friendly”
Reviews.Author: sonjar2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two daughters in a room (with three beds) for a week. It was painful for us to leave when a Rick Steves tour came in and they ran out of rooms! The rooms are decorated beautifully, as is the lobby. The staff is so friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us in the kindest manner, making us feel welcome and helping us to LOVE Paris! The beds are comfortable, the street is relatively quiet, the neighborhood very pleasant and when we leaned out our window we had the most wonderful view of the Eiffel tower! I wish I was there right now, but with my husband, as Paris is a very romantic city!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable although a bit remote”
Reviews.Author: indeptrav
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with relatively small rooms, although the common areas are a little worn. American tour groups (Rick Steeves org. had about a dozens of Americans staying there during our recent visit) have apparently discovered it. Our corner room did have a glorious view of the Tour Eiffel and its' light show at night. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. It is in a quiet area of the 7th, so, if you want some action or shopping "around the corner" you may want to book something nearer St. Gremain. All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations but ....”
Reviews.Author: drewaz
Reviews.Content: my expectations were high based on the many favorable TA reviews. The hotel is in a good location. The lobby is very nice and includes free computer access on their iMac! We enjoyed that. But ... We emailed the hotel before our departure from the US and asked for directions for the Metro from the airport to the hotel. While we eventually got there, the directions were for a very indirect route which was sort of a pain considering we had to drag suitcases up and down subway stairs because of the extra stops. Our room (52) was TINY but nicely decorated. The bed and small desk nearly took up all of the available space. There wasn't a chair. The bath was nice. The balcony view wasn't quite what I expected. My vision was a space with a table and chair and a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. Of course, this was just what I imagined to find. In actuality the balcony was very narrow and about all you could do was stand on it and catch the nice view. There was no hot water one morning and the air conditioning didn't work during our stay. The room was hot at night and the area was too noisy to sleep with the door to the balcony open. My biggest disappointment, however, was the affability of the staff. We asked to have the air conditioning checked but we didn't get any follow up and it didn't get fixed. There was no apology about the morning with no hot water (and no shower) and the evening guy with the shaved head seemed to have an attitude. When we checked out, we weren't asked about our stay. We didn't complain during our visit so I don't think the lack of concern was related to us being difficult. And it was totally opposite the attitude at the other Paris hotel was stayed at. All in all, not a bad place but we expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: romeriboell
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time on TripAdvisor researching hotels in Paris and settled on this one. It was a great choice. We chose this hotel for the view and because it seemed to be very nice. We did not get disappointed. The hotel is small, but really nice. The room is beautiful and the view is amazing. We were very happy with our choice. We spent five nights at this hotel. Four nights in a superior room with view and the last one in a standard room. The standard room is nice, very similar to the superior, but smaller and there is no view. So I really suggest people to pick the superior room. The view is what makes the difference in this hotel. Of course, the hotel is nice in all aspects, and the people who work there too. Especially Jennifer. I just don't recommend breakfast which is OK, I would recommend having breakfast outside, there are very nice places near Rue Cler. Rue Cler is about ten minutes walking. The metro ecole militaire is about 5 to 8 minutes walking. We had dinner in a restaurant near the hotel, it is called The Vin Sobre. The food is great there. Our stay was really great, I really think it is a nice place to stay in lovely Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and quiet escape in the 7th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Smo4320
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duquesne Eiffel was a terrific find for us on our first trip to Paris (thanks in part to Trip Advisor reviews). The place a couple of blocks from the metro and 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, which greets you every morning and evening out your window. Not a bad way to start and end the day :-) Pretty quiet street - some traffic noise but nothing substantive. If you want a lively neighborhood at night, though, you're better off in the Latin Quarter. The hotel is a few blocks from some great cafes on Rue Cler (and a bustling food market). The hotel rooms, though they may seem small to Americans, were fine for two people, and they were well-appointed, private and comfortable. The price was very reasonable for the location. Skip the over-priced breakfast and head out to one of the local boulangeries or patisseries for your morning meal. Great location, super-friendly staff - what wasn't to like? We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good value.”
Reviews.Author: maiczm
Reviews.Content: We wanted a small place to stay in Paris, away from the traditional tourist areas. We chose Duquenes Eiffel Hotel for the quite location. We were not disappointed; we stayed for 5 nights. The person that remodeled this hotel had the guest's needs in mind. Rooms are clean and compact, everything you need is there. If you need space, choose a superior room. Décor and colors are modern and elegant. Comfortable bed with good bedding, soundproof windows, flat screen TV, Safe, mini bar, plenty of reading light, dimmer was a surprise. AC always worked. Bath room was spacious with new fixtures, hairdryer, and granite counter. In the lobby there was a shoe cleaner, elevator, message center and a computer for you to check emails. Free WIFI. I debated in bring my 10 inch laptop, but it was worth it, most hotels in France had free WIFI and I did not have to depend on the hotel’s unfamiliar computer to be free. In the evenings, it was nice to sit outside the hotel and watch people go by. One night, we hear a strange rumbling sound, then hundred of roller-skaters passed by. Breakfast buffet in the basement was fantastic, plenty of coffee, assorted breads, scrambled eggs , ham, cheese, cereal . But what makes this hotel extra special is the staff, Julie and Jessica speak English and do whatever they can to help you. I would gladly recommend this hotel. The 7th Arrondissement area was wonderful, 10 minute walk to Eiffel tower, close to the subway, supermarket, laundry. Beautiful walking spaces like the promenade of Avenue de Breteuil facing the dome of the Hôtel des Invalides. An area where you can see the French people walk their dogs, play their ball game Pétanque or having piquenikes. I learned greetings in France are very important, whenever you enter a building, store or hotel a Bounjour Madame Monsieur is expected, also Au revoir when you leave. French people are very friendly, but reserved. Sometimes this is perceived as cold or being unfriendly. They that take care of their country, they have great food, great wine, open skies and no smog. Thank you Tripadvisor for having this forum and thank you readers for taking the time to write about your experiences in your travels. It is great to have unbiased information when you are searching for places to visit and stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dags200
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary after finding it while doing online research for a hotel. The rooms were as expected for European hotels. It was a small room, but it was very nice. We were in room 56, the Champs Elysees room. The view was fantastic. The staff was pleasant. We were there in December and the lobby had was decorated and it was nice. Breakfast was nothing spectacular. There was a grocery store about three blocks down from the hotel that we stopped at several times. Go out of the hotel, turn left, and it was right near the subway. The subway was easy to use, but my wife preferred taxis. Most of the drivers were friendly and some would point out some interesting sites and it was a good way to see the city. There was also a few places we went to a few times in that area. One restaurant that we like was called the Ecole Militaire, obviously name for the Ecole Militaire right across the street. It was tasty. There was also a nearby, late night bar that we got to know one of the bartenders. It was a fun place to stop on the way back to the hotel at night. The neighborhood was very quiet and we were told by a taxi driver that it was a more affluent district, the 7th arrondissement I believe. There wasn't too much night activity as there was not many hotels that I noticed in the area. The Eiffel Tower was about a 15-20 minute walk away, along with the Bateaux Parisiens, which was well worth it. I grew up in a French-Canadian family and studied it from first grade through college, though I'm very rusty. Take your time and learn some basic phrases and the locals become very friendly and you'll come away with a very positive impression of the French.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: SyedAhmad
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reading other reviews of this hotel and we were not disappointed. We were warmly greeted by Helene who was very helpful throughout our short stay. Yes, the room size is small, but it's clean, everything looks reasonably new, and the beds are comfortable. Breakfast was decent. It's about a ten minute stroll from the Eiffel Tower. Oh, and you get free wi-fi in the room that was a bonus we weren't expecting. S. Ahmad USA

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, comfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: The location is great, most everything in walking distance including Eiffel Tower and close to metro stops. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: gtc1126
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on September 2, 2010, and stayed through September 5, 2010. We had an early arrival time and we were very surprised that our room was ready for us! The room was small but quaint. We did not expect the room to be very big anyway. The room temperature could have been better but that was our fault for not informing the hotel staff about the air conditioning issue. The highlight for us was the location of the hotel to a metro stop, Eiffel Tower, and the wonderful staff! The front desk staff was very patient, helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. We especially enjoyed Jennifer! We highly recommend this hotel. Next time we visit Paris, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: PatMustard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, the hotel more than exceeded our expectations, nice small hotel so you felt as though you were getting a personal service. Our room was upgraded upon arrival, always a nice touch. The hotel itself is an ideal location to walk to all the main attractions in Paris plus its very close to the metro. The neighbourhood itself felt very safe even at 2am on a Friday night. The room was spotless, comfortable bed, nice view of the Eiffel Tower (well the top bit anyway) from the 2nd floor. Having read so much about tiny rooms I was pleasantly surprised with ours, ok it wasn't a big room but I felt it was roomy enough and after all you don't come to Paris to hang out in your room anyway. We had breakfast there both mornings and were very impressed, it was buffet style with scrambled egg, bacon, cold meats, cheese, bread, croissants, pain au chocolat, cereals, yoghurt, fresh coffee/tea, fruit juices etc. All served in a spotless and nicely decorated cellar area. Again the reviews of Paris had left me with a low expectation of what to expect for breakfast so we were well impressed and left each morning stuffed after a great breakfast. The free access to a computer/internet is really handy and welcome and was always available whenever we needed it. Overall this is a lovely hotel and really made our first trip to Paris a very enjoyable one and would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Jennylu
Reviews.Content: We are still raving about our good luck on staying at this hotel. Friends had recommended it. We were lucky enough to be in Paris in August so we were able to get the best room in the hotel for a good price. Our room had a small balcony from which we had the most magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower, both by day and night. The staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful about dinner reservations and public transportation options. Breakfast was not included in our room rate but we had it the last day and it included bacon, ham, and eggs, as well as bread and croissants, fruit, juice, and hot beverage. The chocolate croissant I took from breakfast and had at the airport waiting for our flight home was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Feel very confident about booking here!”
Reviews.Author: rspriest
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Very short walk to metro station, and had no trouble getting around at all using metro the whole week. Clean hotel, friendly and helpful staff, good location. Room was very small but we weren't there to hang out in the room. It's easy enough to get to the hotel using public transportation from CDG airport but I would take advantage of their car service if going/coming via Orly. Just email them through the website and they'll take care of booking a car for you. Staff was very helpful, especially the gentleman working there in the evenings. Several good cafe's in the neighborhood if you wear yourself out visiting the sites and want an easy but delicious dinner while watching all the foot traffic of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the view”
Reviews.Author: suebird6
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my teenage son at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. We picked it based on the Trip Advisor reviews and the location. We were not disappointed. It was clean, modern in decor but old world in spirit with views of the Eiffel Tower to die for. The staff was very helpful but not overly fussy. We stayed in room 54 which had a small step out terrace and room 45 (we came back a week later) which is the corner room with the really great view. Both had big bathtubs and good minibars. It's a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: dhuck88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we watched the Tour de France this year. Fantastic location close to the Eiffel Tower, and really friendly, helpful staff. Would've liked to have been able to stay another night but couldn't really afford it, but would definatley go back in the future. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “We just loved this hotel .”
Reviews.Author: MnC622
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough great things about the Duquesne. True the rooms are small, but they are extremely well appointed. This hotel is quintessentially Parisian: modern yet classic. The decor is warm and chic. Even the hallways and public spaces are very elegant. The staff was wonderful and so very helpful. For us, the location was unbeatable. If you are looking for a lively hot nightspot sort of vibe, than this is not for you. Just minutes to transportation, the Seine, the Eiffel Tower, Inavlides and Rue Cler. The dining in the area was also superb (all of the Constant restaurants are just a few minutes walk!). This arrondissement was so lovely, it had a true neighborhood feel. I have stayed a few times in the Latin Quarter which I liked very much, but this area has a lovely Parisian feeling, and is very romantic. For the value, I could not imagine finding a better place in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great upscale location”
Reviews.Author: DyerMaker
Reviews.Content: We live in France and took the train with our teenage son to see some sights, discover new places, go on a Segway tour and check out Bob Dylan in concert...and this location was perfect, easy walking to the Paris Metro from which everything we needed to get to was a quick trip away. We even carried our luggage from Gare de Lyon to the Metro and then to the hotel and it was a breeze. Great dining is all around here, particularly as you walk away from the Eiffel Tower and towards Les Invalides. The staff was exceptional and very helpful to Anglophone visitors. There's WiFi in the lobby...and it's accessible, too, from most first floor rooms. Of course the upper floor rooms have the views of the Eiffel Tower (some even from the bathroom). The rooms are cozy -- though some may say cramped. I'm not sure what they did before flatscreen TVs because there's just not much spare room for anything larger than a flatscreen without having to move out the beds or the desk. You will not be able to do your step aerobics in your room or anything like that. But if you need a place to sleep in comfort and peace, this is terrific. Please don't mistake my description of the compact space as being comparable to the spartan, bare-bones rooms like you'd find at 3-star European chains. These are terrific rooms...except that there's significantly less unused floorspace than you'd get at a 5-star hotel. We have stayed at other locations in Paris and near the airport, but we recommend the Duquesne Eiffel to our personal friends and family who want to explore Paris in full style while on a budget. And when we're not committed to a specific hotel for a conference or a specific neighborhood for various reasons and want to explore Paris, it's the first place we turn to ourselves, with kids and better still, without.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: kfacpa
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but what isn't in Paris... Ok location though we really did enjoy the brasseries in the local area about 4 blocks - 10 min walk away... lovely boulangerie-patesseries nearby and Cafe Marche was nice as well... Hotel was just ok... nothing special, but would return as price was reasonable... Oh air conditioning sucks! we were there on warm days and the AC was non-existent... as front desk said "not too powerful..." The elevator... omg... couldn't get two people in at same time with our luggage LOL.. no seriously... I'm recommending only because it wasn't a bad experience, just not great experience either... "3"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel ,room 46 has view of Eiffel Tower Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tourists1
Reviews.Content: Stayed between 16-20 August to celebrate our 3oth Wedding Anniversary. stayed in room 46 which had a magnifient view of the tower especially at night when lit. Room was clean and had everything we needed accept maybe tea/coffee making facilities but this is not commonly found in Europe. Breakfast ample and coffee good. plenty of french bread and jams. Location excellent short wAlk to tower and river and metro close if needed. Reception staff spoke very good english and were very helpful booking tours and giving directions. All in all very enjoyable stay and if ever we return to Paris we would definitely stay at the Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best"”
Reviews.Author: curlyfour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming little hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday, after reading the reviews here on trip advisor we decided it sounded the perfect hotel for us and we weren't disappointed. My fiancee had arranged for a bottle of champagne to be in our room for when we arrived and yes we had the sought after room 55...with the seriously 'wow' view from the balcony. The rooms were spotlessly clean, small (but they all are in paris), REALLY comfortable beds with great bed linen, The staff in this hotel make it really personal, Jennifer arranged our dinner boat cruise for us (seriously, pay extra for the premier service....it was sooooo amazing) she really couldnt of been more helpful. As for the location...it's great, it took us about 15 mins in the pouring rain to slowly walk to the eiffel tower. Les Invalides is literally round the corner and that's where you can hop on/off the paris bus tour (green route), you can buy the tickets at reception. It worked out alot cheaper to buy the 2 day tour bus/batobus tickets combined than to buy them separately. The hotel is in a quiet area so there was no traffic noise to keep us awake and the local bars are close enough to enjoy but far enough away to not be an issue at night. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and I cant wait to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict1964
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful specially that my luggage was lost and the receptionist kept on calling CDG to check. The mattress was actually same as the one I had at home which was excellent. Even price was expensive for the dates but it was worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view & convenient to metro!”
Reviews.Author: Stabone130
Reviews.Content: Anyone traveling to Paris should start here -- I couldn't believe the view of the Eiffel Tower from my bedroom. I'll try to touch on a few things American travelers want to know: the hotel staff is very, very friendly and speak excellent English; they were happy to answer any questions I had & made excellent suggestions for things to see & w/ dinner reservations; there is an elevator (a small one but it's still an elevator); it's only 1 block to the metro; there is a supermarket just 1 block away so that can help with the cost of breakfast/lunch/dinner/snacks. The rooms are a bit small but you are right in the middle of Paris so this is pretty common with most hotels. Overall, very happy and will stay again here when I return to Paris in just a few days.

Reviews.Title: “what a view!”
Reviews.Author: Louise187048
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by my parents who visit Paris yearly and stay here everytime. We took their advice and went for a deluxe room. Location is fabulous, very near to all the main points of interest, on a quiet street with some lovely restaurants and cafe's nearby. There's a Metro station just across the road also. Staff were friendly and helpful. Decor throughout was gorgeous, loved the colour schemes! And then to our room....Wow, what a view! If you have seen a certain episode of Sex and The City, when Carrie goes to Paris, and goes out onto the balcony..that's the sort of view! Gorgeous and romantic. Rooms are on the small side, but decor is very stylish with some lovely old black and white pictures of Paris. Size was never an issue, view, decor and location more than made up for it! I will definately be coming here again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect way to end our holiday....”
Reviews.Author: Jats10
Reviews.Content: We (my husband & I and our 21 and 18 year old daughters) stayed here for four nights as the last stop on a 5 week holiday. Like a couple of other reviewers, I was specifically looking for somewhere with a view of the Eiffel Tower. I contacted Hotel Duquesne and they told me I could have two rooms next to each other both with a balcony and view of the Tower. They did not let me down! It was magical to see the Eiffel Tower shimmering at night - after an exhausting day of sightseeing in Paris! The staff were all very helpful and friendly, our rooms were a good size and the bathrooms even had a bath! The beds & pillows were VERY comfortable. As other reviewers have said, the location is also great - easy to get to the metro, lots of cafes, shops, restaurants close by. If you get the opportunity try Le 7eme Vin restaurant for dinner - the food and staff are fantastic! We WILL return to Paris and we WILL stay again at Hotel Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, with fantastic staff in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Vixdoug
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great find, I did my research and trawling through the Trip Advisor reviews paid off as I was more than happy with my choice. After 5 weeks camping through Europe with my mate and my 16 month old toddler we were grateful to arrive in a hotel that offered comfort for our last 2 nights before a long journey home to Australia. Reception on arrival was fantastic thank-you to the young lady who organised a larger room for our mass of luggage and the baby. The rooms are lovely, huge comfy bed, amazing hot pressured shower, very clean and really quiet (we stayed in room 14). Location is excellent a 6Euro taxi ride from the train station and just down the road from cafes, restaurants, metro station and a Carrefour supermarket (great for grabbing baby food, snacks etc). The Eiffel Tower is a 15min walk as are the tour bus stops next to the tower to take you to all other top spots to see (red buses 24E for 2 days). The hotel also organise a shuttle to airports that I would recommend taking ensure you book earlier enough and confirm the rates, my own fault I failed to do this sooner and ended up with a bad experience in a taxi and a rather annoying argument before having to embark on a 24hour journey. I am a frequent traveller and can honestly say that this is definately one of the best hotels I have had the pleasure of staying in I assume it will only be a matter of time before I am back in the area and would be more than happy to return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: maxemoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Gem ! Close to Metro,Eiffel Tower,On-Off bus stop,etc. Friendly,Helpful staff,Large rooms,Bathtub !

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: SSH218
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time on TripAdvisor researching hotels in Paris and settled on this one. It was a great choice. The staff were lovely (they actually replied to me in French so that I got to practice, but speak English too of course), the location was great. Sure, the room is small, but not the smallest I've stayed in. It's totally functional and who is wasting their time in Paris hanging out in their hotel room anyway? We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but highly recommend Salon Flirt-The a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Duquesne & the Eiffel Tower view”
Reviews.Author: PixNZ
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I stayed here in early June for the last night of a wonderful European holiday. As this was her first trip to Paris (& possibly her ONLY visit) I wanted somewhere special to end the trip. For years she had longed to see the Eiffel Tower, so I felt a tower view was a must & began trawling the TripAdvisor site for likely hotels. Because of the excellent reviews, I chose Hotel Duquesne & everything clicked perfectly into place from the very first email. I booked Room 55 (which they say is the best room in the hotel) & it may even be the best room in all of Paris, with its wrap around balcony & fantastic view of the Eiffel tower. We did an evening tour of Paris, bought some cheese, bread & a bottle of Eugene Rothschild champagne for a late night feast while watching the twinkling lights of the tower change to a diamond cascade every hour. (Many apologies to the staff for the crumbs we left behind!) Later, my cousin moved her bed so she could lie there watching the very last of the lights from her pillow. Truly a magical way to close what had been a wonderful trip through Italy & France. Room 55 cost us Euro 198 which worked out to about $NZ380 - far more than our usual budget of Euro 90 per room, but I feel for the room itself. the location of the hotel & the service from management & staff it's probably very reasonable indeed by Paris standards. I cannot speak too highly of this hotel & its staff. My emails were promptly returned & all questions answered courteously. The manager tried every way to find us a shuttle to CdeG next morning, but when this proved impossible, arranged for a taxi to take us to the RER station at Invalides instead. One hears too much about the inhospitality of the Parisiennes. I must be fortunate as I have barely experienced it & I can positively state that the service in the Duquesne is second to none & the hotel richly deserves its many glowing reviews. I recommend this as THE VERY BEST place to stay in Paris & I would dearly love to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “You can see the Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: Njoytravl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a great hotel - leaning out the window we could see the Eiffel Tower. The staff were all very nice. The rooms, hallways, and elevators are very small, so if that bothers you this hotel is not for you (did not bother us, in fact it added to its quaintness). Great location to subway, stores, Velib bicycle stand, Les Invalides, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxed, friendly hotel, wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jezzer44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in a nice residential part of Paris next to Ecole Militaire. The metro is a short walk down the road and the Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk and makes for a great evening stroll. Whilst a quieter location it is not remote and the area has a sense of space unlike some areas of central Paris. Like many Parisian hotels it is compact but it is very tidy and well appointed for its size, the rooms are cleaned every so absolutely no complaints. The staff are friendly and accommodating and have excellent English (although it is polite to address them in French if you are happy to do so), they are a great credit to their boss who has run the hotel for nearly 20 years and is still clearly passionate about this. A very special thanks to Jennifer who took my daughter shopping on her day off it was a great experience for her (my daughter that is), so thank you Jenny. If you are seeking a friendly hotel that gives you a sense of being in the real Paris then this hotel hits the mark and I would without hesitation say 'stay there'.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: quiinc
Reviews.Content: Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, and the hotel is in a good location. Close to Rue Cler and the tower, and within quick walking distance of the Metro. The front desk was helpful whenever we had a question.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, relaxing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FormerTWABrat
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the other reviews on Trip Advisor, as well as the responses from the proprietors who seem to really care about making sure their guests are well taken care of. Although we didn't have a room with a view, we enjoyed our comfortable, clean, nicely decorated room, with lots of bathroom amenities. I actually liked our inner view of the windows from the other buildings. We also liked the quiet location, which was easy to access from Gare de Lyon and Charles de Gaulle. We arrived late our first night and loved being able to walk to the Eiffel Tower. Room is small, but it's Paris! Breakfast was delicious, especially the coffee, and served in a very cute room by the nicest ladies. Although we'd probably pass on breakfast on our next visit becaue of the cost (12 euro each) when there are good boulangeries and grocery store nearby. As mentioned in earlier reviews, staff was kind and helpful (only wish they had more information about the neighborhood where we found a great restaurant, ice cream store, bar, shops on a small street behind the main streets).

Reviews.Title: “WHAT WONDERFUL 50th BIRTHDAY MEMORIES I HAVE TO TREASURE!!”
Reviews.Author: KandJThomo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of July with my husband who had very very kindly booked this surprise trip for my 50th birthday (after recommendation from our 23 year old son who had taken his girfriend there recently, as a surprise, for her 21st birthday - who would have thought it!!) - first impression was 'wow' - a lovely place and a very helpful & friendly receptionist greeted us as soon as we walked through the door! We had room 54 - on the top and with a balcony & so had wonderful views of the Eiffel Tower which was a beautiful sight to behold day and night (over 500 photos which would confirm this!!). What a lovely hoel this is - nothing was too much trouble - we were very impressed and would certainly recommend The Duquesne for cleanliness, service, breakfast, rooms, location and best of all 'the view'. We chose to have breakfast on day one and although very nice we thought we might get something better elsewhere so on the second morning we tried something else but were very disappointed, wish we had stayed there so we returned for the third day! We ate at 2 pavement type cafe/restaurants - both of which were very good (The Recruitment Cafe & Bistrot de Robert) and very lucky to have been bought a dining package (and champagne!) as a birthday gift up the Eiffel Tower - this was fabulous and a very special treat. Lots and lots of special birthday memories to remember & treasure & we will certainly return .............not sure when (maybe the next 'special' birthday???!!! ). If you have never been to Paris and want to stay somewhere in a wonderful location and somewhere faultless then The Duquesne is a must! Enjoy - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a safe quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ilovebruges
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 10 am on Tuesday, June 15th, to a warm welcome. We were lucky to be able to get in to our room(#34) already for our 7 night stay. I haven't been to Paris for 25 years and stayed in dives or with friends previously, so don't know what to expect of a room in Paris these days, but it was well appointed with beautiful tasteful furnishings, a recently updated bathroom with gorgeous tiling and marble, and large sunny soundproof windows. It was me(a 47 year old male) and my 75 year old parents. They had a kingsize bed(two twins put together) and I had a single bed that acted as a sofa during the day. The room was quite spacious and we never felt cramped. I liked having the toilet room seperate and across the entryway from the bathroom(although a mini sink in the toilet room would have been nice). There was a fully stocked mini fridge(contents not free, of course) in our large wardrobe style closet next to the safe. No chest of drawers for storing clothing, but that seemed to be the norm in other hotels we stayed in other cities after Paris. I found the bathtub odd where you only had a clear glass divider that only protruded halfway out from the wall...ended up always spraying lots of water out on the floor. You only get to see the top third of the eiffel tower from the 3rd floor, and only if you stick your head out the window and look right, but it was still beautiful. The threesome rooms with a better view were already booked more than three months in advance, so book early for the summer months if views are important to you. They actually offered us a room with a better view for our first night, but we did not feel like moving after one night. Our room was $2136.00 for 7 nights, but did not include breakfast. I did ask nicely since we were staying so long if they could make an exception, and they did. I booked directly with the hotel. Breakfast was very nice with scrambled eggs, croissants, american style cereals, ham, yogurt, cheese, fruit salad(out of a can), coffee, and tea. There was never any deviation from the menu every day...always the same. Very quaint basement breakfast area. Nice lobby on the small side(mirrors make it look bigger) with small elevator. One beautiful Apple computer in the lobby for all guests to share. Be patient though. Often others were on it, and there were often access problems. I often had to use the french keyboard(one english, the other french) which takes getting used to, and they often had to sign me in with their manager's access code. All the staff were adequately friendly, but don't have grand ideas (after reading some of the gushing comments on this site). None of them would speak or look at me unless spoken to. Also, Leeloo, the dog, never showed up. Never took the public buses, but Ecoile Militaire metro stop is close. Unfortunately, that line won't take you anywhere you want, so you can't be afraid to switch to get to where you really want to go. The eiffel tower is an easy 15 minute walk. There are plenty of pleasant cafes nearby, and we loved the Thai restaurant literally next door to your right as you exit the hotel, and the cafe literally to your left(with a very friendly waiter). The Indian restaurant nearby is excellent too, but the waitstaff could be friendlier. ATM, self-service laundry, souvenir shops(open till midnight!), grocery stores and Rue Cler(sorry, highly over-rated) all nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, comfortable, clean, pleasant, and helpful hotel, with a view of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: honeysucklerose-7
Reviews.Content: I came to France with my niece, her two year old son, and a ten year old. It was a joy to reach this hotel, with its view of the Eiffel tower, its bilingual receptionists, and its proximity to restaurants and a food store (not open on Sundays). With the fear of confirming and not having a room be available when we arrived, as had happened at another hotel before, I confirmed twice. When we arrived we did have our two rooms. One room had a double bed and a large bathroom, with a shower, very clean. The second room was the same, except it also had a small single bed. They cleaned the rooms well each day. The hotel has free internet service, so I could keep in touch with my husband. The concierge helped us make reservations for dinner and also called taxis for us. We didn't eat breakfast there, as it was 12 Euros, but they gave the children bagels for free the morning we left. Our experience at this hotel was positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Great staff. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: e_vil_bili
Reviews.Content: Duquesne eiffel is a very good value with a competent, friendly staff. It is a small operation but it runs efficiently. Because of their size, each front desk person has to wear many hats and be versatile. The night staff is effective and reliable, I was able to get whatever I needed at pretty much any hour, from electrical adapters to reservations to fresh linens. The day staff is very good, again, in many roles: desk attendant, concierge, French tutor. The hotel is clean and kept up. We had only one incident with an unclean wash cloth (hair -- not ours -- eww!) but the soiled item was dispatched promptly and a proper item replaced it, all in the middle of the night. Duquesne eiffel is not part of a big, full-service, multinational hotel chain - it runs lean. You will have to fend for yourself for certain things like umbrellas and room service. that's ok, its Paris -- you should not be holed up in you room living off of the mini-bar anyway. Bring your own electrical adapters if your gadgets run at 120 volts. The neighborhood is a bit sleepy for my tastes but the proximity to the eiffel tower and hôtel invalidés is a plus. It's desolate on Sundays so get up and get out lest you be searching endlessly for your café au lait and pain du chocolat. The room was small, I suppose, but for Paris it was a great value. Our eiffel tower view was pretty good but I think you really need to book early to get that top floor balcony room.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed , comfortable but well run - how you would want home to be ...”
Reviews.Author: KieranMcC
Reviews.Content: We returned to this great hotel in June 2010 after a first visit 14 months ago . It says something about the hotel's culture that the staff were the same people we met last year - from the chambermaids , the ladies in the kitchen and the front of house staff - all seemed happy in their work and most obliging at all times . The young ladies on the front desk - Jessica , Jennifer and Helene went out of their way to be helpful on matters as diverse as drycleaning , reserving restaurant tables , assiting with the booking of tickets to the French Open , organising airport shuttles , forwarding us mail that missed us - even holding bags for us for a week while we went to the countryside . Patrick , the night manager , was also obliging with a late night Baileys and making sure we got email communications from home. I enjoyed the warm greetiings from the ladies in the breakfast salon each day . Travellers tip - a simple " Bonjour " goes a long way here - a smile even further `. Thanks everyone for making our stay our bets ever in Paris . See you next year !

Reviews.Title: “Charming people, charming place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: KRS1946
Reviews.Content: We recommend the Hotel Dusquene Eiffel for anyone, especially first-time visitors like us. There was a distressing mix-up in room type expectations (due to inconsistencies in the external booking site we used) right when we arrived--having slogged what felt like 10,000lbs of luggage upstairs and downstairs several time in the elevator/escaltor-free Paris Metro stations, in the rain: the staff (Helen and her supervisor, whose name I have, unfortunately, forgotten--but not her!) could not have been kinder, nor more intent on getting it all sorted out to our satisfaction. And they did. No matter who was at the desk, that person helped us find our way to restaurants, museums, even calling and booking reservations. They loaned us a much needed umbrella! Breakfasts were hearty and the service was wonderful. The room was small by US standards, but we were prepared. We would have like to have two seats to look out the window--sticking our heads out the window and looking to the right we had a great view of the Eiffel Tower, now immortalized by us in a photo. The view straight ahead was beautiful trees, and the interesting and energetic street sounds went away completely when we closed the window. We had so much fun! Go to Paris! Stay at Hotel Dusquesne Eiffel! Have a great time--just like us!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem. Clean. Modern. Great Neighborhood. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: unit731
Reviews.Content: Clean modern rooms. Friendly staff. Optional breakfast in basement restaurant. Restaurant next door - and friendly staff at that restaurant. Walk outside front door turn right and walk one or two blocks and find multiple sidewak restaurants and a Carrefour grocery. Hotel is in walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Some rooms have views of Eiffel Tower. My friend had a top floor room with walk out balcony and view of Eiffel Tower. I stayed on level 1 with no view of Eiffel Tower. But he paid more for his room. So you do have to ask if you want a room with a view. The hotel rooms are on the smaller side. But clean and neat. Nice marble full bathrooms. TV channels in English are limited to CNN, BBC, Blomberg - but all the hotels we stayed at had limited English speaking TV channels. The young lady at front desk was very helpful. For this part of Paris - within walking distance to Eiffle Tower - this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: KLibs7
Reviews.Content: We visited a lot of cities on our European vacation, and our stay here was the best. The rooms are so nice, and the bed was very comfy. The staff was excellent and went ABOVE AND BEYOND to help us with anything that we needed. You can see the Eiffel Tower from right outside the door. It was perfect! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel superb staff”
Reviews.Author: mikeandwendySydney
Reviews.Content: We were told about this hotel by friends and we were not let down, the staff (Jessica, Helen and Jennifer) were fantastic; the room (small but we expected that) perfect and always clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. Rooms have nice decor and at Euro 144 p.n., the value is good. Staff speaks English and very friendly & helpful. The hotel is less then 10 min walk to nearest metro stations, and close to grocery stores and some nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BoiseLisaD
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here as part of a Rick Steve's Tour. The hotel was lovely, very small spaces, as others have mentioned, and felt tight, but didn't really impact our enjoyment. My husband is tall. We requested a room with two beds, and received a lovely double room (small) with two beds pushed together under a headboard. We slept wonderfully. Although we were on a main street with loud traffic, you couldn't hear a peep when the windows were closed. Two blocks from the metro, so close to the Eiffel Tower and Napolean's Tomb (Les Invalides). Rue St. Clair was a few blocks away, start your morning there and pick up bread, fresh cheese, fruits, chocolates, wine. Keep some supplies in your room, as you'll wake up at strange hours initially, and be hungry. There is no coffee/hot water in the room, although there is small bar downstairs that will make hot water, drinks, etc. for you. The entire room and bathroom looked newly redecorated, marble and quartz in the bathroom, very, very clean and modern. Bus 69, across the street from the hotel, will take you on a tour around the city and bring you back again. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic, filled us up in the morning, but if you are paying separately for it, would recommend the cafe down the block instead. Overall, we were very pleased and would stay here again. There was free wireless, but it was sporadic, often going out and the staff didn't seem to know why.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: gogina
Reviews.Content: The hotel duquesne was great overall. great location from the eiffel, manageable walking distance from the restaurants. The rooms are small but of good quality- comfortable bed, nice linens, clean bathroom. Our first night we got a tower view, tinier room but had our balcony. I highly recommend going to a grocery store and eating out there. But be careful of course. Our second night we had a non tower view room but was a better size. A big thank you to the staff of the duquesne. The two ladies and the gentleman that worked the graveyard shift. They were very kind and accomodating. I will definitely stay at the duquesne again and would recommend it. Oh, and their breakfast isn't bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaMM
Reviews.Content: Good localization , because was our first time in Paris and it's very near of the eiffel tower. The best point was the service, specially from the hostess named Jeniffer, she made the difference in our trip. In general the staff was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is lovelier in the springtime, thanks to staff at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: ChakChel
Reviews.Content: Small hotel rooms filled with charm & ambience. Get the corner room with a view of Tour de Eiffel! I enjoyed a lovely breakfast w/ polite service and can't say enough good things about the terrific desk staff who were friendly & helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glassesontour
Reviews.Content: Spent a long time reviewing hotels, and glad we selected this one. Hotel was spotlessly clean. Room was perfect, staff were great. Would definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our vacation - perfect location and awesome room and staff”
Reviews.Author: mugsy58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The location is great, and the room was awesome. We upgraded and had a view of the Eiffel Tower outside our room. The bed was extremely comfortable, the shower was awesome - everything was great!! The staff was great, and everything about the hotel is perfect. I would stay there again in a minute and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel, for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: AngelaW002
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself visited Paris last weekend, and had a most wonderful time. This is a great boutique hotel, and absolutely spotless. The rooms are small, but I was expecting this as I had read the reviews before booking. My advice would be to take a travel kettle as no tea making facilities in the room, whilst the cafes are superb for breakfast and coffee, I did need my cup of tea!! The staff are welcoming and very helpful, especially Helene who put up with my poor attempts at French!! We had room 51, a superior room with a balcony, well worth the extra cost, as it has a great view of the Eiffel Tower, which is lit up at night. Have a look at it on the hour as it sparkles! A sight to behold! The hotel is situated only a 5-10 minute walk away from the Eiffel Tower, and 5 minutes from Metro. Getting around is easy, buy a book of 10 tickets, it is much cheaper than single ones.We would recommend the Batobus, the riverboat which can be caught at the Eiffel Tower, you can hop on and off all day long, a great way to catch all the sights. A perfect hotel for a perfect weekend, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, not so accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: mikijn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The rooms were somewhat small but we found them adequate and very clean. The location was perfect, with a view of the Eiffel tower and Napoleon's beautiful tomb right around the corner. Just a block from the metro stop. Our only problem was with the staff who weren't very accommodating when it came to changing room arrangements when an additional person joined our party. But "c'est la vie." Also, the free wireless internet was super super slow! It took a good 5 minutes for each page to upload! But they do have a computer in their lobby that is high speed so we ended up using that instead.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: fsunurse
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel in Paris for several nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We started our 1 week vacation by staying for 2 nights, then drove to Normandy and returned for additional nights at the same hotel. It was then that we learned about the volcano situation, which stranded us for an extra 7 days. The hotel staff (Andy, Patrick, Jennifer, Helene, Jessica) were all outstanding in helping us try to reach our airlines to rebook a flight home. The fact that they provide free internet/computer use in the lobby was invaluable in helping us stay in touch with family and airline flight changes. Breakfasts were very good each morning (sometimes included, depending on your room rate) and housekeeping even moved our belongings for us when we requested a lower priced room once we knew we would be staying longer. We made a 3 day side trip to Bruges once we had airline reservations and returned for one final night to the Hotel Duquesne. They welcomed us like family by that time!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL FRIENDLY / PROFESSIONAL / CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: strawberrycat
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Beds large and comfortable - slept so well! All staff friendly and informative. Nothing was too much trouble. Very supportive during current Volcano crisis when everyone was stranded. Apple Mac in reception area with free internet access - very useful! About 15 mins walk to Eiffel Tower. Wonderful view of the Eiffel tower from our window. 5 mins to Invilades. Hop on/off buses by Invilades (easy to use and great for seeing the sights). Metro nearby. Great restaurants and bakeries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Eamonn30
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Given the cost of the room it is excellent value.. the location in Paris is perfect, the rooms where bright and clean. Our windows sealed out the noise and we slpt very well both nights. Although the rooms are smallish they are not cramped and there is enough room for 2 people for a 2 - 3 day stay. We stayed in room 25 and had a view of the tower ( a bonus) but not the reason to choose this hotel -- choose it because of it's superb position in Paris and very friendly happy staff. We will return next year and we will recommend it to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: Rm0425
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in March 2010. Our stay there was wonderful - it made our amazing trip even better. The room was fabulous - we had a picture perfect view of the Eiffel Tower from our window. In addition, the room and bathroom were a nice size and kept very clean through the duration of our stay. We also loved the hotel's location - about a 5-10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, close to several metro lines and in short walking distance to many great restaurants! We also enjoyed Rue Cler, which is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful - and even assisted us in booking a day trip during our stay. We booked this hotel through a travel website and our rate included breakfast. It was convenient and pretty good, but I wouldnt say it is worth the money they charge if it is not included in your rate. Even if you dont eat breakfast at the hotel, you must check out the breakfast room, it is beautiful! If I am lucky enough to return to Paris, I will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HSGKKG
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed in both the Standard and Superior room. Both rooms were excellent. The rooms are extremely clean and the pictures shown on the hotel's website are true to what is offered. The standard room is a bit small, but that is expected for Paris. Washrooms were extremely clean and the stand-up shower in the standard room was great. We had room 55 for one night and it had the loveliest view of the Eiffel Tower. Staff at the front desk were unbelievably helpful and booked many of our dinners in advance of us arriving. My one comment would be to pick up a croissant and coffee elsewhere instead of having the hotel breakfast as it is much cheaper. The area is very quiet at night, which is good and bad...but the metro is so close that you can go elsewhere and come back. Felt very safe in the neighborhood, even very late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timp0088
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on the way to Germany for business. The staff is outstanding and friendly which is not the "norm" for France in my experience. Certain rooms on the 4th or 5th floor have a spectacular view of the Eiffel tower especially at night - straight off of a postcard. The room was small but very nice. This is a boutique hotel, so if you are looking for the Ritz or Hyatt, this is not a good choice. But I loved the hotel and will definitely be back. Good value. Nice location within a 5 minute walk of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Paris' best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: sbgtv
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a gorgeous hotel in a quiet part of Paris---you found your hotel.
