After reading dozens of positive reviews, I booked two rooms at the Duquesne and was very happy I did. We had a Superior and a Standard room. I thought both rooms were slightly larger than the average European rooms---and both rooms were extremely clean, updated and beautifully decorated. Helen and Jennifer at the front desk were amazingly sweet and helpful. The neighborhood is quiet, if that's what you're looking for...but the best part is the location. 10min walk from the Eiffel Tower and a 2min walk to the closest Metro. We loved loved loved this beautiful boutique hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andnoo
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were a little on the small side, but I wouldn't expect anything different in Paris! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location was within walking distance of all the major sights (and close to the metro for those who prefer not to walk too far).

Reviews.Title: “Small room with a Large View”
Reviews.Author: MDJNJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great the rooms were small but very clean and beds were very comfortable. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower its about a 10 to 15 minute stroll and the metro is a 5 minute walk. The staff was very helpful specially the gentleman that was assign to the evening shift. He was very pleasant even when arriving very late. The breakfast was delicious and the attendants were very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice”
Reviews.Author: You-and-Me759
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location - near the Eiffel Tower. You do have a view of the Eiffel Tower, but not from every room. The staff was very helpful. The room was very small but comfortable and clean. Tiny, tiny elevators - use the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “All That and Then Some”
Reviews.Author: T_Ravel_Zona
Reviews.Content: I generally preferred the larger hotels for the their amenities and room selection. After staying at the HDE for a week in February I may have to reconsider that. In short, our stay was superb. It really is all of the things I read about on Tripadvisor. The location is great, the staff friendly, it's within walking distance to rue Cler, the Eiffel Tower, restaurants and the Metro. We were in room #25 which is a corner unit with a decent view of the Eiffel Tower. For fellow Americans it is on what we would consider the third floor (the lobby is on 0). They have some terrific sound proofing windows that open to the street if you want some fresh air. I do not like noise at night and this room was very quiet. The room is a decent size and I would characterize it as being cruise ship stateroom efficient. Not cramped, but no wasted space either. The W/C is in a separate little closet away from the sink and shower adding to efficiency. The bathroom was operating room-clean. Spotless upon arrival and it was maintained as such through out our stay. The staff, especially the women, could not have been nicer, friendlier or more helpful. The guys on the night shift were fine, but lacking in the enthusiasm the women had during the day. There is an iMac in the lobby to check your email and such. I did notice it does not clear the history or the cache automatically but that can be done manually when you are finished with your session. The hotel offered free wifi which was perfectly functional, although it did seem to time out quickly. I recognize that both points are picky. I would post pictures but there is not anything I could add to the existing collection from fellow travelers. This is one of those rare occasions where what you see truly is what you get. I would stay here again and plan to do so. Bonjour and safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality, Good Price & Fantastic Staff/Service”
Reviews.Author: MelbTrav
Reviews.Content: Quite close to the Eiffel Tower and walkable distance to everything else in the city. Very clean, beautiful and comfortable rooms. Fantastic staff, who are always welcoming with a smile and very willing to help you out and give lots of advice on what to see, do and where to eat and drink. It was also quite a good price for Paris which allowed us to splurge on food and drinks at the great restaurants they will advise you of. I hope it stays as good as it was when we were there. Recommended. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel was epitome of what I dreamed Paris would be like”
Reviews.Author: StellaBella26
Reviews.Content: From our cab ride to the hotel, to the shuttle to the airport... Paris was a dream come true. The Hotel Duquesne Eiffel was an absolute wonderful find... Julie and all the lovely staff were wonderful. They suggested a great place for a massage, which was very close to the hotel. The little market nearby and the Eiffel tower being so close were added little bonuses. I had always dreamed of going to Paris and my boyfriend at the time took me there and he proposed in Versailles (a little day trip which is a MUST!!) The gardens were beautiful and the row boats were so cute and fun. I loved the Sacre Couer, the Notre Dame, the D'Orsay, the beautiful gardens. I can't say enough about Paris and the lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jade_Hoon
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated in 2009, Hotel Duquesne is located at a very good location - 5 to 7 min walk to the Metro (Ecole Militaire) and to the nearest Supermarket (Carrefour). The staff were all very warm, friendly and accommodating! Breakfast's reasonably priced and served at a cosy room. The variety is limited but the food is delicious and hearty. The rooms are small-ish (but similar to many other European hotels of the same rating) but they're very clean and well-kept. The contemporary decor is very pleasant too. Overall, we had a wonderful 4-night stay at the hotel in Feb 2010. Kudos to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: olesya154
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in Tripadvisor’s “Best Hotels in Paris” section and we are very glad we did. First of all, the location on this gem cannot be beat. It is located within a 10-minute stroll from the Eiffel Tower, one block from the Invalides (“Napoleon’s Tomb” and the Warfare Museum (a must for medieval armor and knights’ gear that is not represented at the Louvre)) and two blocks from a Metro station Ecole Millitaire on the 8th line. Rue Cler, a cozy cobblestone pedestrian street with multitude of shops, cafes and food markets is also very close by. For the first two days we stayed in room #55, which I assume has the best view of the Eiffel Tower in the entire hotel and a real balcony (as opposed to Juliette balconies on other floors). The tower is right there in your window in its full glory. However, due to the size of the room & the location of the furniture it is impossible to see it from the bed, which cannot be moved to the side as the headboard is attached to the wall. However, some clever positioning will let you see it from a teeny tiny bathtub ☺. For our last night, we were moved to room #44, which also had the view of the Eiffel Tower, but you had to look out of the window to see it. No big deal, as we were so exhausted from all the sightseeing that we used our room primarily for resting/sleeping purposes. Surprisingly, this room was much bigger than room 55 with a bigger bathtub and a separate toilet room, European style. Overall, the hotel is small and cozy, the lobby is pretty and the Reception Desk is attentive and extremely helpful with everything (they helped us a lot with those plug converters). The rooms themselves are small but very well decorated and clean. We had breakfast at the hotel once and for 24 Euros that we were charged, we could have totally gotten something better outside the hotel. The food was excellent and served in the beautiful basement dining room, which was probably one of the neatest hotel dining areas that I have ever seen, but the value was just not there if you are used to eating small breakfast. (Of course, if you like buffet style breakfast or breakfast is the meal of your day, you will enjoy it immensely). Now, some overall tips on the area and Paris in general. It was our first trip here and despite reading tons of reviews and guidebooks we still managed to have some hick-ups that were easily avoidable. First, we took everyone’s advice on using Metro for all of our travel needs and boy this was good advice. The system is very easy to use and gets you everywhere within minutes. Transfers are easy and the longest we waited for a train was 5 minutes. However, we failed to take advantage of the unlimited pass deal. When we wanted to buy our first Metro ticket, we saw that there was an option to buy an unlimited 3-day pass, but when the clerk told us it was 40 Euros per person, we backed off and we should not have. This pass allows unlimited travel for 3 days on ALL public transportation, including metro, buses and RER trains (airport and Versailles trains). Considering that one ride on the train for 2 people is 3.20 Euros and 2 tickets to Versailles and the airport are 30Euros, we should have taken the unlimited deal. So, if you are a heavy sightseer, take the unlimited pass and you will save some Euros. Second, we found the food to be excellent. A lot of people on this website recommended Café Du Marche on Rue Cler for meals and we did eat there twice but were not as impressed. It seemed a little on the cheaper side and on Sunday morning we found a bunch of drunk French men crowding the bar area and the waitress who served us breakfast had such dirty nails that I literally wanted to get up and leave. The food is also nothing to write home about. We tried the place across from Marche, Café Central and found it way classier in décor, service and food quality. We also tried the Ulysses for crepes that one of the reviewers raved about and were disappointed to see them re-heat the crepes instead of making them from scratch. We generally followed Frommer’s Guide to Paris (check it out for awesome walking tours of Marais, Montmartre and the Latin Quarter) and tried some of the restaurants that he recommended. But none of those restaurants came even close to the place right next to the Duquesne Hotel that was recommended to us by the Reception. The place is called 7eVino (still not sure what the heck it means) and it is located by the Ecole Millitaire Metro station (across the street from the big La Terraza restaurant). It is a small intimate restaurant (only 16 tables) with the most personable service that we have ever experienced. We come from NYC, the city of restaurants, but the owner of this place blew it out of the box for us. The food was amazing, just the right combination of traditional and modern French cuisine. Once we came in, the owner gave us complimentary glasses of wine and made sure we were 100% happy during the course of our meal. We tried escargots (Burgundy snails – 6.5EU per 6 snails), oysters and I had beef in duck liver sauce (19EU), the taste of which I will never forget. The wine selection is amazing at this place and is very reasonably priced (average of 4EU per glass). The crème-brulee desert (7EU) was heavenly. We came back for dinner the next day and the owner, who by the way speaks fluent English, gave us one of the reserved tables and arranged a complimentary wine and cheese platter within seconds. We had another heavenly dining experience with a baked prawn and scallop appetizer and roasted duck and fish specials. Hands down, the best meal ever! It does take a while for your food to arrive so make sure you allocate a lot of time when you come to this place. But overall, this restaurant was one of the highlights of our Paris stay. Upon departure, the owner personally came to say goodbye to us and gave me a long-stemmed rose from a huge bouquet that was standing on the bar to commemorate Valentine’s Day. Third, a Versailles trip is a must! We wanted to skip it first, but then reconsidered when we saw Napoleon III’s apartments at the Louvre. The trip to the Chateau is painless and quick (1 Metro stop and then 30 minutes on a RER C train) and is totally worth it. One huge TIP: MAKE SURE YOU HAVE THE TICKETS BEFORE YOU ARRIVE TO THE CHATEAU (you can buy them online before you depart to Paris). When we got off the train in Versailles, there was a tour guide advising people to buy the tickets at the tour agency right across the street from the station, but we totally disregarded the advice, thinking that the line cannot be that bad in February. And of course, we were completely wrong. We stood in line for at least an hour and in the end, we bought tickets at the ticket machine (credit cards only) located in the lobby of the ticket office. The machine had absolutely no line and if we knew about it, we would not have wasted an hour on that ridiculous queue. So if you do arrive without tickets, check the lobby first to see if the machines are working (3 out of 4 of them were broken) to save yourself some time. After snapping some beautiful pictures of the Opera House, we visited the Galleries Lafayette, Paris’s biggest and most famous shopping mall and it was an interesting experience to see European fashion (and prices!) at its best. The main hall of the mall is incredibly beautiful. I mainly did window-shopping as the prices are insane but I am pretty sure some reasonably-price shopping can be done on the street where the mall is located as I saw European H&M, GAP, Benetton & Zara there. We decided not to use the airport shuttle on the way back and took the Metro to the airport. The trip was a little complicated as there were a bunch of stairs to climb during transfers, but we got to CDG in about an hour after leaving the hotel. The cost for 2 people was 17EU but it could have been avoided if you had the unlimited Paris pass. (We got on at the Ecole Millitaire station and took Line 8 to Invalides station and then took Line 1 to Chatelet where we transferred to the B train to CDG). Overall, we had an amazing trip. In general, I would advise to avoid the Metro after 9pm as it seemed to be full of sketchy people and use the “big city radar” when visiting the major tourist cites that are swarming with the “souvenir sellers” with dubious intentions.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific stay...”
Reviews.Author: collee09
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough great things about this hotel. It was definitely one of the highlights of my European trip. The room was clean and very nicely furnished. The daytime manager and staff spoke English and were very kind and helpful. They were more than happy to direct me to some nice restaurants, landmarks and public transportation. The view of the Eiffel Tower from our room was amazing and the breakfast was simple yet satisfying. Bottom line, the staff, the accommodations and location made for a very pleasurable experience. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pretty Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: mattman26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 12-year-old son after I completed a business portion of the trip. If you want to be in this neighborhood, this is a pretty perfect place. Nothing super-duper fancy, but a perfectly nice (smallish, but it's Paris!) room, perfectly good bed and bedding (the kid's bed was sort of comically low and small, but worked out fine), nice bathroom. No internet in the rooms, though it sounds like they may be working on that. Free shared terminal in the lobby, or if you have a laptop, they'll lend you a wireless card that works in the lobby as well. Staff pleasant and unobtrusive. Oh, and our room had a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower, although you had to stick your head out the window to get it. Still, a very nice surprise (even the tenth time you do it!). Whether you want to stay in this 'hood is a slightly more complex question. Relatively easy access to Metro, plenty of cafes and restaurants, a Carrefour grocery store just a couple blocks away that came in quite handy. (And of course, handy to the Tower.) But it's not quite the magic of some of the more central areas of Paris. Then again, life is full of trade-offs, right? If the area looks good to you (and mind you, we were there in cool and drizzly November; spring and summer are probably a whole 'nother thing), you would do very well with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: JPFreitas
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel as part of a 2 day New Years surprise for my girlfriend. It couldn't be better! As soon as we arrived Jennifer made us feel very welcome and gave us what i think must be the best room in the hotel, room 45, with an amazing view to the Eiffel tower. I have requested a bottle of Champagne and there it was in the room upon our arrival, in a bucket of Ice with 2 Champagne glasses. Jennifer was kind enough and the most helpful when we asked about some information on what to do while in Paris, explaining every sightsee possible in such short time, available places to eat nearby and also all the transportation to get everywhere. Rue Cler is just maybe 7min walk down the road towards the center, and there you can find lots of places with fresh baguettes or other french specialities and shop fresh for vegetables, fruits, etc. The nearest metro station would be Ecole Militaire and is about 5min walk. Eiffel tower is just there, as soon as you reach ecole militaire, 3min walk, you will be in front of champ de mars and Eiffel Tower in the other end. On the back of the Hotel is Les Invalides, 3min walk and further 10min will be the Seine River and the Louvre very close, in fact, after the Louvre we still walked to Notre Dame. No subways needed at all (is a waste of time going underground in such a city as Paris, where every corner counts). Perfect Location i would say, and nowhere else beats the view from this hotel, not close or far from Eiffel Tower, just perfect. Absolutely gorgeous breakfast in the basement. The most kind and helpful staff. This place is spotless, so clean and neat that is nowadays hard to find on a 3 star. And you have free internet access in the hotel lobby. For a romantic experience, try the Bateaux Parisiens for a dinner cruise. I will definitely return to Paris and certainly will be staying at the Duquesne Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Great "boutique" hotel with a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: zabie
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my mom in October for her 75th Birthday. It was her first time in Paris and I chose the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel specifically for the the great view of the Eiffel Tower. We had a wonderful time! The view was in fact, great! The staff was really nice. Can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel right in the heart”
Reviews.Author: lilAnthony
Reviews.Content: we stayed here two nights and then came back after a night at versailles. what a great little hotel. the rooms are tiny and theres not much on TV, if your feet are killing you. but the views from room 44 & 45 are just out of a book. the rooms are clean and tidy, the toilet is seperate from the bath. during our stay we bought the "hop on hop off bus" there is a stop right down the street and a metro two short blocks away. there is also a local grocery store to stock up on water and snacks. also two blocks away is ave de clare (sp?) a small alley of local shops which you must go to.

Reviews.Title: “Compact city centre base, and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sesh_Seshep
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from Trip Advisor on the basis of its reviews, and wasn't disappointed. Hotels in central Paris aren't roomy, unless you're paying top dollar, and there wasn't much space in our double room after they had fitted the bed and a desk in, but the decor was tasteful, it was clean and comfortable, and the hotel had been nicely refurbished not long ago. The staff were friendly and helpful, and spoke good English when my French wasn't up to the job. The hotel is well located for a number of major tourist sites, and only a few minutes walk from a couple of Metro stations. We visited in August, when a lot of Parisians go on holiday, and not all the restaurants were open. Due to the collapse of sterling, prices everywhere seemed expensive, especially for drinks. The hotel came out as good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but don't count on the view......”
Reviews.Author: mayanlily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in December of 2009. I painstakingly researched hotels, and I chose this one. After my travel agent booked it, I followed up with an e-mail asking about the Eiffel Tower view and a large bed. I received an email telling me that the upgrade would cost me additional money. I wrote back and agreed to the upgraded cost. When I arrived, I was put in a small room at the back of the hotel. The lady at the front desk first claimed that they had not received my email, and to have a view for 2 nights, I would have to move rooms each of the three nights. I was moved to a clean room on the street side with a king size bed. When my email was located, the clerk brushed it off and blamed another clerk. Of course, this was upsetting as I chose this hotel for the view. Also my travel agent said breakfast was included, but it wasn't. While I was there, I found it to be clean , and the staff was very helpful. I even met a another traveller ( who also posted on this site) who told me what a wonderful view she had !!! (Quite distressing...) When we went to check out, the clerk who was working was the one I had been told who had made the error. I told her about the " email mix -up", and she said I had not sent back my response "quick enough." If this had been the case ( I sent it the day I was told about the upgrade.), why did no one contact me so that I could change hotels? Then the clerk then told me that they had given me a " great rate" for my stay. Nooooo, the travel agent did that. So, if you want a view or breakfast, make certain you find the manager and have an airtight agreement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kjh5475
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. The location was perfect, only a few blocks from several metro stations, laundries, pharmacies, and a couple of supermarkets. Free high speed internet was available in the lobby (though not in the rooms). Of course, you're in PARIS so you shouldn't be wasting time on the internet anyway!! My only complaint was that the rooms were a little warm. I think this was due to the stone construction of the building and simply opening the window solved the problem. The staff was exceeding helpful anytime I had a question or problem. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Duquesne Eiffel--a cozy and welcoming boutique hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: MLtravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for 9 nights in December 2009 celebrating my daughter's 13th birthday. It was a magical experience as we were in a room that looked directly at the Eiffel Tower. Every night we could sit in our room or stand on our balcony and watch the hourly glittering lights of the Tower. The hotel staff was beyond helpful!! To our delight, they all spoke english and never tired of our many questions regarding metro's, buses, show tickets and directions to museums and other sites. I will also comment that even before we arrived to the hotel, my emails with questions were answered quickly and completely. Special thanks to Oliver, Helene, Jennifer, Jessica, Alain and Patrick for making us feel so welcomed during our entire stay. There is a shuttle service that the hotel can arrange for a pickup from the airport...very reasonable at 36 Euros for 2 persons--this shuttle service can also pickup at the HDE for a return to the airport. The room was cozy and clean. It did not matter the small size of the room since we could lay in bed and look to the Eiffel Tower---a priceless experience while in Paris!! The lobby was welcoming to sit and read or to use their computer. If you bring your laptop, they only offer wireless in the lobby, to present. The breakfast was delicious, though with the same foods offered every day, we opted to only eat there a few days during our stay. The Rue Cler neighborhood is sweet and safe and very much the feeling of a small town in itself. We enjoyed Bus 69 which is a local bus that takes you all around the city--very reasonable for all the sights seen along the way. After traveling to many European cities and staying in larger hotels, I can say I am so happy I was told by a friend about Hotel Duquesne, a wonderful and friendly boutique hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for its staff, location and view of the Eiffel Tower. Enjoy your trip to Paris....it truly is one of the most special cities of Europe to be experienced. We will surely return to the comforts of Hotel Duquesne Eiffel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, beautiful room in a good location, with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: finickytripper
Reviews.Content: Good: - Great room and public space decor; we even took pictures to reproduce some of it at home! - Comfortable lobby - Free high-speed Internet access - Interesting subterranean dining room for breakfast - Friendly, helpful front desk staff - Great location, walkable to the Eiffel Tower and Napoleon's Tomb, five minutes to Rue Cler and the Metro - Our room on the back side of the hotel was very quiet - Good restaurant options and small grocery stores in the near vicinity Bad: - Tiny, tiny, tiny room, but unfortunately typical for Paris at this price - Pricey, but probably competitive for the area - Internet connectivity was fairly unreliable during our stay due to wireless issues - Noticed one couple getting locked out of the lobby for several minutes after-hours when the night clerk stepped away

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: SESeattlemom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Tour Eiffel area about 5 minutes from the Metro stop and 10 minutes walk from Rue Cler (the Rick Steves recommended area of Tour Eiffel). In fact, during our stay, a Rick Steves group was staying at this hotel. Rue Cler and the Tour Eiffel area are quite walkable and have numerous restaurants of various prices. The hotel was spotlessly clean. Rooms were smaller than a Marriott (but we didn't want to stay in a chain hotel outside of the main areas of Paris!) We had read that Parisian hotel rooms were too small and that towels were tiny, but the rooms and the towels were fine. We had wanted a triple but got two adjoining rooms for a similar price. Our teenage girl got her own room, and she absolutely loved it! Staff were helpful and pleasant. The lobby has free wi-fi and one large screen iMac computer. We have zero complaints about this hotel. Although one of the rooms faced the street, it was not too noisy because it's a residential neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikki1011
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris for two days as a stop on a business trip. I had never been to Paris before and was traveling by myself. Booked this hotel based on other reviewers recommendations and the moderate price of the room and LOVED it! The hotel is very clean and modern. The rooms are small (but not so small I felt suffocated), but that is typical of European hotels. I even had a view of the Eiffel tower from my window! The walls are paper thin so you can hear other guests in the hallway, but the hotel is generally quiet anyhow. The location was the best part-walking distance to everything! 10 minutes to the Eiffel tower and other attractions. Rue de Cler is a few blocks away with numerous bistros, bakeries, and small shops. The only downside I can see about this hotel was that there was no internet access in the room. I will be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mihaj9
Reviews.Content: Hello. We liked this hotel from the first minute we came in. The staff is friendly, they helped us with everything. Room was great, we took superior, because we heard its bigger. View from the room was great, we could see eiffel tower. Location is very good, 5 minute walk to eiffel tower and Les Invalides... or you can take Metro its very easy. It was a great weekend we enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: kirstykjg
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in Dec 09 for a short city break. It is a gem in Paris and location wise is everything you need - You walk out of the front door and see the Eiffel tower....what more do you want!! It is a few minutes walk away from a Metro station that runs central lines through Paris, and has cool, modern and classic French bars, resturants and Cafe's all within a few minutes walk away! The rooms are modern and well equipped, although a tad on the warm side! The staff are excellent, very friendly and helpful. We found the hotel excellent value for money given it's such high standard of decor, cleanliness and style and for its location! In all, this hotel is exactly what you need to go to Paris - I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: morag_seahag
Reviews.Content: We loved this little boutique hotel. although we didn't have a view of the Eiffel tower from our room you will if you stay in the front rooms. The room was a decent size for Paris, small but not tiny and beautifully decorated. I can honestly say this is the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in! the reception staff were lovely and spoke good English, breakfast was continental....nice and fresh. there is free internet in reception which is a bright stylish welcome when you arrive. we felt comfortable here for the weekend and we also got a special price on Expedia that no other brokers were offering. Breakfast is 12euro. Location is excellent and 2 mins from the metro station (Ecoles Millitaire??) which is just a few short stops from all the main attractions. BTW the metro is so cheap to get around on that you be mad if you didn't use it! fantastic and easy system to use.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: TheMells
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after consulting TripAdvisor and we were very happy with the decision. Although we were warned that rooms in European hotels were generally very small, ours was large enough and comfortable, with a king-size bed and divan. When booking, we e-mailed the staff requesting a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Initially, we were told there were none available, but if anything changed, they would attempt to accommodate us. True to their word, we were given a room offering spectacular views of the Tower when we arrived. Although the room faced the main boulevard, the nearly floor-to-ceiling casement windows were completely soundproof when closed. Located in the 7th arrondisement, it is close to the Seine, the Louvre, the Musee D'Orsay, etc. The Metro station is only two blocks away. Jennifer and Jessica at the front desk could not have been more friendly and interested in assisting us with our explorations, whether it was arranging a taxi or booking our dinner aboard the Bateaux Mouches river cruise. Both spoke perfect English, which was great as we spoke no French. Small drawbacks; the air-conditioning was weak and we relied on opening the windows to cool the room. Also, the night staff was polite but a little less knowledgeable than the young ladies. If we travel to France in the near future, we would certainly return to the Hotel Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “DESTINATION EUROPE APPROVES - WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DestinationEurope
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Duquesne Eiffel in three years. The rooms are small for US standards, but for Paris, they are great and the rooms in the front on the fifth floor offer balconies with full views of the Eiffel Tower - not just the top part that some hotels have - full views. It is really a great value for what you get - the location is excellent in the 7th district - five minutes from Rue Cler, where there are many excellent cafes, bakeries, cheese shops, wine shops, etc. The Champs de Mar Park and the Eiffel Tower are also only five minutes as is Invalides, the Rodin Museum and excellent for the Metro as there is a station also five minutes walking. Julie, Jessica, Helen and Jennifer and all the staff are excellent and attentive. We recommend many of our clients here that are looking for a great central, moderate priced hotel with wonderful amenities and service. I will be back to this hotel and will continue to send many clients. Kayla Zeigler Destination Europe

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Merv49
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we wanted to find a hotel close to all the sights we wanted to see. The Duquesne Eiffel was perfect. Located just 10 minutes walk from The Eiffel Tower and 10 minutes walk from 'Musee de l'Armee (Invalides) and with the Metro just a short walk away it was easy to reach places like the Louvre. The hotel itself is lovely, very clean, trendy and friendly. All the receprtion staff are very helpful and all speak very good English. The room, athough small, was lovely and the bed was especially comfortable with nice fluffy pillows. Room was very hot and we also had to switch the radiator off and open the windows. We stayed two days and the room looked spotless after our return on day one, the bed had been made beautifully and clean towels put in the bathroom. We did not have breakfast either day, but the breakfast room looked lovely. The area that the hotel is in is very clean and safe with great coffee shops and plenty of places to eat. There is a supermarket just up the road also and plenty of banks etc. It seemed to be a particularly nice part of Paris. We did not have enough time to see all the sights that we wanted to, so will certainly be returning to Paris in the future and would not hestitate to stay at the Duquesne Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room, Great View, Nice Location = Wonderful Value”
Reviews.Author: Cutinos
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for our honeymoon, and after much research and advice from others decided to stay at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. We were advised by friends that the nearby "Rue Cler" was a great little street with lots of shops, boulangeries, fromageries, cafes, etc. This was one of the high points of staying at Duquesne Eiffel. We spent so much time just walking around this area, and enjoyed every minute. Their are some fantastic resturants and cafes in the area... we tried many of them and liked them all. The Eiffel Tower is about a 10 or 15min walk from the hotel. Also, close to a metro station, or easy to catch a taxi right outside. Another high point: we had booked a standard room, but were upgraded for free to a room with a balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower. We did not ask for the upgrade, it was just offered to us when we checked in :) Our room was very nicely decorated, tiny, but beautiful. Even the soap in the shower was divine (rosemary, something or other). We reccommend spending the extra money for a room with a balcony and view - as we found this to be our favorite thing about the room. Their "petit dejeuner" was expensive (well so is everything in Paris), but worth it. Delicious, convenient, and the breakfast room itself is lovely. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Each time we passed the front desk we were greeted, and when we asked any questions they did their best to answer thoroughly. Whether we left our room early in the morning or late in the afternoon, we always returned to fresh towels, clean sheets etc. Housekeeping is very flexible as to when they clean your room. We appreciated that. Everything about the hotel met or exceeded our expectations for the price. This newly remodeld, adorable, well located, affordable hotel was a delight. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfrect location and wife loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jitters001
Reviews.Content: Paris trip would have been miserable if my wife was uncomfortable with Hotel. Everything was small by American standards but more than adequate for my wife. We may have had a 3 star hotel but thankfully the bathroom was a 5 star bathroom. Much more spacious than I imagined it could ever be and with a granite top on the sink and a real shower. The linens, carpet and towels were all in perfect condition as if they were very new. We could find nothing to complain about other than the size of the room. That really did not matter as we were so tired when we returned we didn't exactly want to do any more walking than was necessary. Plus it was all part of the Paris experience. Small room, narrow halls and a tiny elevator. All quaint. From our first floor hotel room (second if you count the American way) we could look out and see the Eiffel tower. I did it once and never looked again, so don't bother looking for a hotel with a view. When we left the hotel and came home we could look at the Eiffel Tower all the way to and from the Metro station. The location was perfect. Two blocks to the Metro station and some of the best restaurants in the area. For breakfast go to the Pettte Brasserie PTT at the bottom of the Rue Cler. Coffee was good and with Rick Steves' book you get an Amercan breakfast with an egg and ham for 6 E. For a cheap dinner go the Tribecca on Rue Cler. Great food and service but 4 days in a row was a little t0o much for us. For excellent but slightly more expensive food try Le Florimond on Avenue de La Motte Picquet which is located at the end of Rue Cler. It is not open on Saturday and Sunday and doesn't open their doors at night until 7:00 PM. Stop by the night before and make reserations. Also go to the Restaurant Pasco which is farther down de La Motte Picquet. Walk doiwn past La Florimond and when you get to the corner turn right and you will see it 50 feet down the next street on the right. Both of these last two were very good restaurants and worth every penny. For a big time expensive meal go to La Fontaine de Mars and see why Obama ate there. Don;t eat dessert at any of the restaraunts. Stop off on the way back from sightseeing and buy desserts at the Lenore which is located between the Metro station and the Post Office on De La Motte Picquet. The cheesecake was light and tasty. The chocolate candies were terrific but I couldn't see buying a box of chocolate and a dessert. If you need to convert American dollars go to the Post Office. Best conversion rate in town. If you stay here say hello to Jennifer and Jessica. They worked the front desk many of the days we were there and tipped us off to much of what I have listed here. There is computer available in the lobby so you can check your email. They also had a limited number and types of power converters you could borrow. Great stay and if I ever go back I would stay here again. Especially since it was up to my wife's standards

Reviews.Title: “Fireworks for Bastille Day from our balcony!”
Reviews.Author: Tangosnow
Reviews.Content: Went to the Duquesne on recommendation of friends, who often stay there. It was Bastille Day, and we had a room with a balcony looking out to the Eifel Tower. Thousands of people wandering around, and we sat on the balcony watching the people, looking at amazing fireworks and light show display from the Eifel. We could hear the bands playing, and we sat with Champagne and sweets from a bakery just down the street. Absolutely the best time in the world! I had gone with a reservation for two, but my friend had to go back to the states. So when I arrived, the management gave me a single room, for less money, without my asking. They were kind, and helpful about getting around Paris, and what to do. If I get back to Paris, I will definitely stay at the Duquesne!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: circleofbeads
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of searching for a hotel for our two weeks in Paris.....we made a great choice! Room....beautiful view of Eiffel Tower. Staff......extremely helpful and very friendly. The room was clean and comfortable, quiet with the windows shut. We enjoyed sitting outside in front of the hotel with a glass of wine!!

Reviews.Title: “good small hotel -friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: john12345678
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in oct 09 , The hotel is smalll but clean with nice rooms . The best thing was the friendly staff , at one point i left my room safe open and when I remembered we were on the other side of town . Afrer one call to the hotel the desk staff went to the room and locked it for me .... they would not even take a drink for their trouble also when i needed help with the matro map they where more than happy to help . we didn't eat in the hotel rather chose to picnic during the day and breakfast on the move , there is a carrefour near the local metro that will help you do the same . good location to metro and if you like a walk the tower and river are not far ... enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: NancyTwiga
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel is perfect! It is in the Rue Cler area, a short walk to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine River, the Hotel des Invalides and Napoleon's Tomb. It is also located on a main bus route that we used several times and very near the Ecole Militaire Metro stop. But the best thing about the hotel is the fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. I can still see the look of delight and awe on my husband's face when I opened the windows and showed him the view. Wow! It is an incredible view, especially at night when the Eiffel Tower lights up. The room was a nice size, on the corner with two sets of windows, and very clean. The bathroom was big, with a shower in the bathtub. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They had free wi-fi and also free internet on their computer in the lobby. Their buffet breakfast was very good. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: swimfan923
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely hotel in August, 2009. Our trip to Paris was a graduation gift to my 22-year old daughter, and I wanted the hotel to be perfect. The Hotel Duquesne exceeded my expectations! I decided on this hotel mainly because of the great reviews and the location, location, location! I will never forget my daughter's reaction when she realized she could see the Eiffel Tower from our room! Priceless! The hotel is minutes from shops, restaurants (check out the nearby Rue Cler neighborhood, a favorite of travel writer Rick Steves), and major attractions such as the Eiffel Tower, of course, and Napoleon's Tomb. And the nearby Metro station provides easy access to everything else. This hotel gets fabulous reviews because it is, indeed fabulous! The staff are friendly and accommodating, the rooms are charming and immaculately clean, and the breakfast buffet gets five stars for including a pot of coffee with free refills! I couldn't have been happier, and I will definately stay here again if I am lucky enough to return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but good location and very good staff”
Reviews.Author: billinsugarloaf
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a residential area very near the Eiffel Tower (walking distance). We stayed here for that reason on our last night of a two week trip in France, and it was just right. Rooms are very tight, but have been recently redone. There is an elevator. Jessica was on the front desk that night and was really helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: 000KaTe
Reviews.Content: The eiffel tower was in view from our hotel room. Amazing breakfast. Close proximity to metro. Walking distance to many great sites. Around the corner from the amazing Rue du Cler. We already talk about returning to Paris and specifically staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: MaraT4
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful room where we could lie in bed and watch the Eiffel Tower light up at night! Great breakfast also included!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: HB525
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely - the rooms are tastefully decorated, the staff are really friendly and the location is great. I emailed when I booked and asked for a hotel that overlooked the Eiffel Tower - even though I'd only booked a standard room you could still see the Tower and one night we sat and watched it twinkle from our room. The rooms are small, but it's Paris! Staff were very helpful and chatty, all we spoke to spoke English. The double glazing also worked really well, with the windows closed you couldn't hear a thing outside. Fabulous. would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Duquesne Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: jstep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 3 1/2 weeks in France, spending our last 3 nights in Paris at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. It was a perfect ending to our trip. We had a standard double room that was beautifully decorated and very well maintained. At night we could see the dazzeling lights of the Eiffel Tower. On a rainy morning we sat in the gorgeous lobby and read newspapers. I love the color scheme! Plus the staff is friendly and extremely helpful. I've been traveling to Paris for over 20 years and this is by far the most beautiful 3 star hotel I've stay in. We plan on returning to the Duquesne Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and extremely clean and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: oldchop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in August and found it a truely lovely experience. We read several reviews and can agree with others. It's in a fantastic location, close to the Eiffel Tower which was what I wanted. The room was small as they all are in Paris, however spotlessly clean and beautifully maintained. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from our bedroom window, which I also had a look at during the night. Spectacular. The staff were extremely helpful and even though we only stayed 1 night I would not hesitate to go back again. Well done to all the staff at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel

Reviews.Title: “Greta value hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ferroequinologist
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable rooms and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel Centrally Located in Paris”
Reviews.Author: orlandotourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our London, Paris, Rome European vacation this past June. After arriving at Gare Du Nord via Eurostar, the transportation company I had arranged was waiting for us after getting off the train. I would highly recommend a transportion service, particularly with a family of four. Two cabs would be needed, and the taxi cues at the Gare Du Nord are famously long after a train arrives. It was 60 euro for a minivan to take us all and luggage through Easy Transfer Service of Paris. They were always on time, and made our transfers effortless. It was a quick 10-15 minute ride to Duquesne Eiffel. The check in at the hotel was quick and easy, and all of the front desk staff were friendly and able to answer any questions on how to get to places from there. They provided maps with the directions, and all spoke fluent English. The elevator is small, and will only accomodate four people, so people and luggage took us two trips, but we were aware of this before we booked. We found small elevators to be the norm in Europe at the smaller hotels. This is similar to the transportation problem: A taxi would only handle two people and luggage, like the elevator. Our biggest concern on this trip was finding hotels with air conditioning. As we progessed from London to Paris to Rome, finding hotels with air conditioning became an increasing challenge. This hotel had great air conditioning. The hotel is located two blocks from the Ecole Militare metro station for easy access to the subway system. There are bank ATM's, small grocery store, and a famous local French pastry shop and bistro's within the two block trip to the metro station. The rooms are smaller than usual, and we were prepared for that. We read a review of someone who left immediately because of the small rooms. The hotel is a 17th century building, hence the room size, but for lack of size, the rooms were completly updated recently with modern features, and very clean. The room our kids had was a bit bigger than ours with two twin size beds. As before, the important feature for us was that the air conditioning was great. The bathrooms are small as well , but very well appointed for their size. We do not spend a lot of time in the room anyway, so being for lack of room was not a problem for us. The free wifi had to be obtained in the lobby, as they were in the middle of gaining a new contract service for wifi when we were there. There is a small bar in the lobby as well with drinks that are not overpriced. The rooms have a keyed safe, obtaining the key on request from the front desk, as well as a minibar that is not terribly overpriced as they are in the US. But, as I mentioned, there is a small store a block away where drinks and snacks, etc. can be bought. The service of the room was outstanding; never intrusive, and immaculate on return from a day out. The continental breakfast is served in the basement in what could have been an old wine cellar. There was French bacon, like Canadian bacon, scrambled eggs, as well as cerals, toast, coffee, juice, etc. The service personnel where all very friendly and helpful. I couldn't help but leave a few euros for a tip, although it is not expected. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Ecole Militare, at the end of the Champs Du Mars, making about a fifteen minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The front desk personnel warned us to hang on tightly to our cameras around the Eiffel Tower from snatch and grab theives. We did make it to the top of the Eiffel Tower in the early evening, and it was well worth the 45 minute wait to start our way up. The view at night was incredible. Among other sights we visited in the four days we were in Paris: The Louvre was an all day affair to see a third of it as we well knew. It worked out well that day since it rained. Notre Dame, as well as an organ recital there one night. A day trip to Versaille with Fat Tire Bike Tours; I wrote a review of the wonderful trip we had. Montmartre for the girls to go shopping. We even made it to Père Lachaise Cemetery to visit the grave of Jim Morrison. We liked this hotel, although I would not recommend it for people not used to some of the smaller features of European hotels. Anything with the expected space of American chains will cost twice as much in a central location such as this. This hotel served our purposes well for ideal central location, clean and modern furnishings, helpful and efficient staff, great air conditioning, and wifi.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: nette_m
Reviews.Content: love the comfy bed and pillows. love the room love the location, easy access to metro love the bed and breakfast package love the color and furniture

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: KirklandWashington
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all, if anybody thinks foreign hotels have the large rooms we get in the states - THIS IS NOT GOING TO HAPPEN. So, get over it and quite complaining about small rooms in Paris. That said, this hotel is in an historical old building (they all are - this is Paris) and has wonderful modern rooms and baths. The bed was great. Air conditioning, electronic keys, a safe. Clean. I will stay here again and I am picky. Near the Ecole Militaire metro in the 7th Ar.

Reviews.Title: “A view of the Eiffel Tower, wonderful staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: quiltmaven
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel and couldn't have been more pleased. We booked it based on reviews on tripadvisor (which have never steered us wrong!) and are delighted we did. Staff is friendly and speaks numerous languages including very good Enlish. Jessica checked us in on the morning of Sept. 6th and kept our luggage while we went to Versailles (with her map and directions). When we returned late that day, she greeted us warmly and asked if we were tired. How nice to be remembered! There is a computer with an Enligh keyboard in the lobby at guests' disposal as well as wi-fi also in the lobby. Breakfast is available but we didn't have it as we loved going to a boulangerie and buying croissants out of the oven to enjoy with a cup of coffee. Our room was small but with everything we wanted including a safe and refrigerator. Standing on our small balcony we could admire the Eiffel Tower, especially at night when the lights twinkle for 5 minutes every hour on the hour. Stay here. You can't go wrong! Craig and Mo from Summerfield, FL.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location but spotty internet service”
Reviews.Author: Corkette
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. We found this hotel very easily. I requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower in advance. When we arrived we were told that we had the room with the best view in the entire hotel but the person had not checked out yet and we should come back later in the afternoon after it is cleaned to check in. We arrived later as instructed but then found ourselves in a room with no view. The same front desk clerk then told us she was mistaken by her earlier statement - very odd & disappointing. Then when we checked out they gave us the worst directions on how to drive out of Paris to the north. The lobby internet service is very spotty. Didn't eat any meals in the hotel. The pictures on website match what we saw. Very clean and no complaints about our room. Most hotel rooms in Paris are very small (expected) but we are not fat Americans so this did not bother us. Highly recommend this hotel for location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, super staff, great rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: brookesotto
Reviews.Content: The entire stay at this hotel was excellent! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris. The room was gorgeous and quaint and the best view in Paris of the Eifel Tower, super clean, beautiful decor, close walking distance to the tower and Rue Cler and also close to the Metro. I traveled with my mom for her birthday and the staff was the best part of the hotel!. They all were so helpful, spoke beautiful english (to help those out who don't speak french well, like us). They best part is they had tons of ideas for us first timers to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “FANTABULOUS View with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: SusanRozsas
Reviews.Content: I am a female traveling solo and comfort and safety are very important to me. I was in Paris for a week to celebrate my birthday. I'm an amateur photographer and a view was important to me as well. I put in a request for a room with a view and they made every effort in providing everything I asked for. The room was comfortable, quiet and best of all I felt safe. There is 24 hour service at the reception desk. They offer a computer for guest use in the lobby and their wireless network is accessible only in the lobby. You just need to request the password for the network in order to use your own laptop in the lobby. The location was perfect...a few blocks from 2 different metros and an easy walk to many great cafes and of course the Eiffel Tower and Invalides. I would definately stay there again and would recommend it to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “great room at a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: feeireland
Reviews.Content: wow! just back from a long weekend in paris and booked this hotel from trip advisor and was very glad i did!! fantastic location ,very easy to get around with the metro just around the corner and only a short walk from the eiffel tower.we stayed in a superior room(25) which was worth the extra money due to the view of the tower!! it really added to the whole trip waking up to that view!! the staff were very helpfull( thanks soo much for the european plug adapter for the vital hair straightners!!) good prices for the minibar also,we didnt have breakfast there so cant comment on that but otherwise everything was really really good... definately be making a return to this hotel when we go to paris again...

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DHB-Somerset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel (pronounced Due Ken!) for the August bank holiday for 3 nights and I'm so glad I booked this as a surprise for my husband. It was our first wedding anniversary and our first trip to Paris. The location is great, a few minutes walk to the Eiffel tower and lots of bistros and restaurants nearby as well as the Ecole Militaire metro station. The staff are very friendly and helpful advising you which metro lines you'll need, maps and directions should you need them. Our room was lovely, a little small but we were expecting this as it's Europe. It was clean, the bed was very comfy (a proper feather duvet and pillows!) and the shower was amazing! It was cleaned every day and the air con kept it cool. I was hoping for a view of the Eiffel tower but our room was facing the wrong way and to be honest it was much better joining the bustling Champ De Mars and watching the Eiffel tower twinkle away (it lights up for 5 minutes on the hour) such a stunning monument! Breakfast was also very good, buffet style with plenty to set you up for the day. I would definatley return to this hotel and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience I've Had in Paris”
Reviews.Author: USDoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all of my expectations - and exceeded them! From Julie at the reception to the late, late nights my wife and I kept the night manager up serving us glasses of wine while we sat outside and enjoyed the cool air, the Hotel Duquesne experience was marvelous. We were lucky enough to get room #55 and were amazed at the view and quietness of the place. The metro stop is close by, Saint Germain very close by cab; in all this is a great base camp from which you can enjoy Paris at an affordable and extremely enjoyable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, extremely quiet, other reviewers were right!”
Reviews.Author: No_RUTH
Reviews.Content: Given the number of positive reviews, I will bullet point the good stuff and some observations: Familiarization and Previews of the neighborhood: Use Google "streetview" for an amazing high definition preview of the area. If you use streetview for the US, you will be amazed at how much better the Paris version is. E.g., you can zoom in 4 times and read 2 inch font on storefronts - the photos seem to be equal to 2-3 megapixel cameras versus the just 1 megapixel version in the US. We used this feature to find HSBC ATMs in the neighborhood. (see pic of La Terrasse restaraunt attached) -Shower Interesting swing out door that seems to invite water to leap onto the floor took some gettign used to. However, by the second try I had mastered the relatively dry shower technique and did not flood the place. See the pics - the door swings out and covers only half the tub surface, so water splash goes everywhere if you are showering. If you are tubbing, be aware that this a half tub and unless you are 3 ft tall, won't be able to stretch out. Not t a biggie for me as I prefer showers. -Window Came with a nice sidestreet view (see pic) and was really dead silent when closed. Really - there was construction down the street with jackhammers that were rendered silent - not quiet, but dead silent when I closed the window. And, we heard no other guest room noise. -A/C Is not US spec A/C. So, it does not get extremely cold. It keeps the room reasonably cool, about 75F, but not cold. Several nights dipped to the low 60s and I simply opened the window because the street noise was not that bad. There is a dial on the wall, but ignore it, becuase we kep it at "full blast" for the entire week we were there and the temps never went below 75F. Again, not a huge deal, but there is no really cold breeze, it comes from the ceiling at a drip and a slow drip at that. That said, it was not enough of a problem to complain about, even on a 95F day. -Location Within about 7 minutes walking to the Eiffel tower and 5 minutes to Champs de Mars, the perfect picnic location. Nice, safe, quiet neighborhood. We felt fine coming home late at night. -Staff Perfect and helpful. Enough said. -Tip There is a shoe buffer-type machine in the lobby to clean you shoes after you have been off galavanting in the tan powdery dirt of Paris - which is everywhere - use it. The carpets are dark and show the foot prints if you do not. -Lobby internet Stop at the fron desk to get a free login password and check your email. The speed, according to speedtest.net was fairly low (0.96mbps down and 0.23mbps up), but perfectly suited for checking the weather and email. Great public-use Apple in the lobby if you don't have a laptop. -Breakfast We didn't eat at the hotel becuase there were so many cafes within easy walking distance. For an excellent continental breakfast that will carry you for hours of walking, try La Terrasse de 7eme, mentioned in Rick Steve's Paris 2009 book. It is on the corner of Avenue Bosquet and Avenue De La Motte Picquet, within sight of the hotel. For 12 euros, you get a few slices of ham, 2 eggs, café creme (incredible coffee with cream), two slices of white toast to dab the eggs, a 10-inch buttered half baguette, two jellies, sugar cubes, and a huge croissant. As a 6ft, 200 pound American, I was more than satisfied with the quantity and quality, and at 12 euros, a steal for the food and experience. Try sitting just inside the restaraunt on one of the window border seats. You get a nice cushy fabric chair while still being able to see the outside crowds pass by. -Food The hotel is very near Rue Cler (again see google street view) and there are several very good and reasonable eateries there - including Cafe du Marche and Tribeca Italian Rest., two small CVS type stores for emergency food supplies, etc. (we bought three 6-pack real 100% orange juice boxes for only 1.50 euros each), There's also a nice English-speaking creperie - "Ulyesses" in the middle of Rue Cler.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for short weekend”
Reviews.Author: Markus26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveiently located for a short weekend in Paris close to Invalides,Eiffel and the metro. Rooms are recently refurbished ans higher floors offers excellent views of both the Eiffel tower and the Invalides. However the room size for this price range is small - even by Paris standards and the service is almost totally absent. At least basic service should be available at a 3*. Overall an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: nurdie
Reviews.Content: Last week for the first time in paris, i was in Duquesne Eiffel, very good quality regarding it's only a 3 star hotel. Nice hotel, good acomodations and nice location, very good price. Only 5m walking to Eiffel Tower. From my room i could see the tower. The only review is the wireless wi-fi internet. Only works in lobby and not in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend this fabulous Hotel to anyone Visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Thistlerose81
Reviews.Content: Paula had went to a lot of trouble on the internet to find a hotel that was just right for our first visit to the most romantic city in the world. We managed to book a superior room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. Mini bar was well stocked and reasonably priced as was the overall price of the stay with breakfast. Breakfast set us up nicely for the day Staff were very friendly, always helpful when asked and they respected your privacy.There was never any attempts to try and sell you anything. We chose the open top tour bus to get around for our three days. Price was reasonable and it also got you on the boat bus on the Seine. Stop for this was just at the end of the road. Only problem with the bus was it only went one way so you have to plan the journeys well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerry7mac
Reviews.Content: First time to Paris and this was an excellent hotel choice. After reading the reviews on trip advisor I thought this would be a good choice for our honeymoon to Europe. It was very close to the eiffel tower and metro. We ended every night sitting on the grass in front of the eiffel tower watching it sparkle! The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. The room was very clean. Don't be surprised by the sizeof the room, after all it is Europe. The staff was very informative and helpful. Alexson was extremely helpful and very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: WalterF
Reviews.Content: The roomas are small and very clean with ample storage space. The bathrooms are modern and everything works; especially the shower. The hotel offers free internet on their computer in the lobby which has both an American and French keyboard. There is also free WiFi in the lobby. The desk staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel also has functional central air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: RDHnewjersey
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I travelled to Paris this August and were lucky enough to find Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. The front desk staff were warm and friendly and speak perfect English. It was in a wonderful location near a main Metro station and some charming cafes. It couldn't have been better for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah004
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here at the start of August, having chosen this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Lovely room, with view of Eiffel Tower. Easy access to metro lines. Air conditioning a welcome bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, A ways from the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: TIA-Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, with tons of room (booked a superior). The staff was very helpful especially when we needed them to hold all of our luggage for the day. A short walk to the Eiffel, but unfortunately it is quite a ways from the other sights of the city (i.e. Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame, etc.) The metro was only a block away so you could always take that to get to your destination. The room was always spotless when we returned, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Plenty of local cafes and restaurants nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations for a 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gromitny
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we booked this hotel. The staff were friendly when we arrived and provided us with everything we needed for our stay. Rooms and bathroom were very clean. Our room was comfortable - good size for Paris. We did not have a view of the Eiffel Tower but that was okay. There's free internet access in the hotel lobby. Also, there's a great Thai/Chinese restaurant right next door - its one of the best thai restaurants i've been to. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast since there were cafes nearby for coffee and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveller-nice
Reviews.Content: I must say I have stayed in more than 100 independent hotels in Paris itself over the last few years, 2 to 4 star hotels. I have a pretty good knowledge of Paris hotels in terms of service, room size, breakfast... I booked there because I had meetings around there. Reservation online was fast and easy on their official website - old website layout but I understood from the girls at frontdesk that they will have a new website very soon. Rate was same as on Booking/Venere... and rate was in line with competitor hotels nearby. Check-in's been fast and easy. Efficient girls at reception. Unfortunately I put my room card key by my blackberry case (the one with a magnet inside, which means my card key did not work. When I went down to reception to get it activated again, it took a few seconds and staff was willing to help. The room had a great view to the Eiffel tower. Room size was quite good for a 3* property in Paris. Separate toilets. Bathroom was small but I'd rather have extra square meters in room itself than in the bathroom. Very good bed. Flat TV with lots of channels. minibar with reasonable rates: a Perrier was 2.60 Euros. Usually I pay 3 to 4 Euros for a Perrier in hotel minibars. I checked details such as hangers, bathroom line, guest supplies... and everything was cleaned and where it was expected to be. When hangers are different and bad ones, it reflects a good idea of how the hotel is maintained and managed. At the Duquesne Eiffel, their maids know their job. Air conditioing worked well and did not smell. Carpet was cleaned. I did not use their free high speed Internet access since I'm using a 3G card everywhere I go in France. So many hotels have been late providing such a basic service as HSIA that travellers like me have a 3G card in laptop. However, while waisting time waiting for a friend in hotel lobby I checked available wireless networks and found theirs.In hotel lobby they provide free use of a Mac computer with very large screen and 2 keyboard - 1 french and 1 English, next to the bar. Breakfast room is lovely. There was everything needed, including eggs, ham, cheese. Unsual in a 40 room parisian hotel. Breakfast room is small but staff seems to be efficient and refresh tables fast. Coffee was good breakfast coffee - it is funny saying that but I experienced so many terrible coffees elsewhere... Checkout's been fast and easy. "Have you had something from the minibar", a few clicks on their computer and I got a printed bill that was right. They called a taxi for me. I have stayed many times on left bank but can't remember having stayed in 7th district. This is very quiet, very accessible - metro is one block away. It looks easy to park outside. Easy access to main train stations. At 8.30am it tooks my taxi driver less than 8 minutes to get to the Chamsp Elysées. I'll stay there again soon... Congratulations to management. Their team work very well

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariaZT
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3-night break in Paris. We selected this hotel after spending ages on tripadvisor and very glad that we ended up booking it. It is situated in a very nice area: a few minutes walk from Hotel Invalides and very close to Metro station. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom was immaculate, newly decorated and clean but very petite! Really tiny! After reading many reviews it seems that small rooms are typical for Paris. The room had a very comfortable bed but too soft for my liking. The breakfast was of a good standart: continental + scrambled eggs and bacon. There are a couple of good restaurants nearby which frequented by locals, on Rue Saint Dominique - La Fontaine de Mars and Constant. There are a lot of cheese/fruit/seafood/meat shops on Rue Cler which is close to the Metro Station. We didn't have Eiffel Tour view from our room but it wasn't a problem. We would definitely recommend this hotel to couples as the rooms could be too small for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ICT_Nessie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! Had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from our bedroom window. I'm not sure if it's still there, but there was a fantastic Chinese place next door. Best fried rice ever!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DublinCarolk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , in a great location, rooms 51 and 52 have magnificent views of the eiffel tower, breakfast a little pricey but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but I wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ComicTragedy
Reviews.Content: For downtown Paris, the hotel was decent and decently priced (though expensive for anywhere else). The room needed some help, though: the mid-range room was very small (a travel crib for our 19 m.o. daughter would barely fit, they requested we leave our stroller downstairs because it wouldn't fit in the room, and we had to squeeze past each other around the bed) and it had off-colored paint over repaired holes in the walls. The staff was pretty nice, though, which helped.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: April7California
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful bonus to our trip to Paris. We arrived before check in time and were allowed to leave our bags with the reception desk so we could start sight seeing. The beds were so comfortable! We slept a lot seeing as we had flown from California and were experiencing "jet lag". They had CCN in English so we were able to keep in touch with what was going on at home. The room was clean, stylish and comfortable. The location of the hotel was great. Right around the corner is the Invalides, Napoleon’s tomb, the Eiffel tower is about a ten minute walk away. There are a lot of cafe's near by. Rue Cler is a short walk away and has many choices of places to eat. There is a great bakery right across the street from Cafe De Marche on Rue Cler. The front desk staff were extremely helpful to us in finding directions, getting us a cab and with any questions we had. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dark5un
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. I was informed by friends that most of the hotels in the center of the town had small rooms, were old and unattended. I can assure you that Hotel Duquesne Eiffel is not one of them. I stayed there for 5 nights 30th Dec - 4th Jan. The hotel was warm and clean. The people were very kind. I would definitely stay there on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable, clean and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyflowerCairo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but comfortable. Make sure you get a room with a view. The higher you go the better view you have of the tour eiffel. Location is close to metro and at walking distance from the UNESCO, from grocery stores and restaurants. Rooms are clean and breakfast is great. I would recommend the hotel for leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT - Just what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Harveyvics
Reviews.Content: I do not tend to wriet reviews, but had too for this hotel. It has been refurbished and really is very stylish, but SO clean and friendly. Took my Mum to Paris for her birthday and the location was perfect! Mum can be a touch of a snob and she LOVED this hotel, we both did. And such good value, I hope it is the same good value so I can book again next year. The manager was so helpful - even helping book our restaurants, breakfast was yummy and simple. It was just perfect. We had a view of the Eiffel tower and the location is great! Quiet but very central. Perfect for a famiy or romance. Loved it! Oh and LIDO is a great night out, DO not miss the Champs Elysees by night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: HappyCat_8
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel...it was perfect for my young adult daughter and I. Very clean; small. of course, but not cramped. Not far from the Eiffel Tower (of which we had a nice view) and Hotel des Invalides but at the same time not in the middle of everything which we liked. Metro station nearby (though we walked everywhere); cafes, restaraunts, shops, food markets all convenient. The hotel staff was wonderful-very friendly and helpful. Will not hesitate to stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect view...perfect anniversary celebration!”
Reviews.Author: Laineylane
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 9 days glorious days in Paris, where we celebrated our 10th anniversary. We stayed at the Hotel Duquesne for the duration of our holiday, and chose it after reading so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We’re so happy we did...we absolutely loved it! The location is perfect: in a quiet neighbourhood near the Eiffel Tower, Hotel Invalides & Napolean’s Tomb, the Rodin museum, and the Rue Cler area. If you like to walk (and you can do plenty of it in Paris!), it’s within walking distance of the Louvre and Tuileries Gardens, Place de la Concorde, the Orangerie and Orsay museums, Grand and Petit Palais, and Pont de l’Alma (site of Princess Di’s accident). But the Ecole Militaire metro stop is also close by and the system is so easy to use, you can get anywhere in Paris in very little time. The hotel itself is charming; the outside façade is quaint with little tables set out front – perfect for enjoying a quiet drink outside. The lobby, reception and bar area is well kept, and the provided laptop and free lobby WiFi access is a nice bonus. The staff, both day and night staff, are efficient, pleasant and courteous, and their English is far better than my limited French. Julie, Jennifer and Marieaux (sp?) were very helpful both during email exchanges before the trip, and to all of our inquiries during our stay. The elevator is definitely the smallest I’ve ever seen. I’d read about it, but was still surprised to see it when we arrived. You can fit 4 people who don’t mind getting close, or one person and two suitcases. Since we had three cases, we each went up separately, but this was no inconvenience at all. I had reserved our room well in advance and specifically requested room # 55 (Gustave Eiffel), based on the recommendation of Trip Advisor contributors. It was an absolutely lovely room. While small in comparison to North American standards, it was perfect for Paris, where you’re not expected to spend much time in your room. And truthfully, the size contributed to the Parisien feel for us. The décor was contemporary, and the wardrobe, dresser, desk and night stand drawers provided adequate storage for our needs. The bathroom was very clean and it was such a thrill to be able to lounge in a bubble bath and gaze out at the Eiffel Tower through the balcony window! Which brings me to the best part of this hotel...the view. We expressly wanted a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower – and you can’t get a better view for your money than Hotel Duquesne! I never did get over the thrill of opening the balcony doors and looking straight at the Tower...it was a highlight of the trip for me! Our room had a wrap-around balcony and provided some great views of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and plan on staying here again on our next trip to Paris. The only constructive criticism I would have is with regards to attention to details. When I made our reservation, I explained that we were going to be in Paris to celebrate our 10th anniversary, and I indicated which day that would be. Typically, a hotel will make note of special occasions and then acknowledge it in some way during a guest’s stay—this did not happen. Further, a day previous, I asked Jennifer to make a dinner reservation for our anniversary at Le Florimond (a very nice restaurant we’d read about in Rick Steve’s Paris 2009 book). She graciously did, but didn’t mention to them that we were there for our anniversary. At the end of a truly delicious meal, I asked for a picture to be taken of us, explaining that this was our 10th anniversary.
