I was told that they typically do something special for couples celebrating occasions and would gladly have done so for us had they known. This in no way took away from the wonderful anniversary and stay that we had, but it’s those kind of “little” details that separates a first-class, 4-5 star property from others.

Reviews.Title: “Duquesne Eiffel is the best hotel I ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: happyinparis123
Reviews.Content: I don't really know where to start, but my mother and I had made reservations via the internet to a hotel that is located a block away from this hotel. Needless to say we could not stay at the "other" hotel as it was completely AWEFUL! Duquesne Eiffel gave us a beautiful room and included breakfast for the same price that we had to PREPAY at the "other" hotel. The people at the front desk were EXTREMELY helpful and very knowledgeable about activities for us to do. They set us up on a wonderful city tour, a spectacular dinner at a very fancy restaurant and sent us to a quaint little local place for lunch. The location was a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower which is FABULOUS!! My mother had no prblem walking to it. The breakfast was very good. Internet was free. I was hesitant about going to Paris but Duquesne Eiffel and the city of Paris made our stay wonderful!! I recommend this hotel with no reservastions. You will be treated fairly and properly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: whereareweg0ingnext
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Duquesne for 5 nights in November 2008. We picked this hotel based purely on reviews from this website and we definately were not dissapointed. We made our booking directly with the hotel and made sure to book the superior room (thanks to the reviews). We were suprised to see that the hotel had just finished being renovated and were very impressed. We arrived at the hotel around lunchtime after coming in on the overnight train from Venice and we were prepared to have to wait till 2pm to check in but the girl on the desk organised for us to check straight in which was great after the long night. We knew our room was going to be good when we saw that it was named 'tour effiel' (room 41 I think?) and we were blown away by the views from our window! Having travelled all the way from Australia so that I could see the Eiffel Tower I was very excited. The room was beautifully furnished with a massive bathroom and hot shower. The bed was soooo comfy and the room was huge. We would recommend this hotel to anyone intending to visit Paris and we will be returning in April next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with an incredible view and a prime location :-)”
Reviews.Author: TP2112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for the first time in early June 2009. I picked this hotel based on so many positive reviews here on TripAdvisor. The hotel staff were always helpful and friendly - epsecially Estelle, Jessica, Patrick and Julie. We were fortunate enough to stay in Room 35 for our week-long visit to Paris. The view of the Eiffel Tower was awesome to see when we woke-up in the morning and also when lit-up at night. The 7th arrondissement neighborhood is ideal for us because of the proximity to the École Militaire metro stop, Rue Cler and several great cafés. We were all over Paris -- the metro is very easy to use...and far less expensive than using taxis. I highly recommend the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel to anyone planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Scoobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on our honeymoon! It was very clean, in a safe neighbourhood, small but comfy. The motel is very modern and most staff memebers were very nice. The breakfast was included and it was excellent!! I highly recommend this motel! It was also a very short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the invalides!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdeame
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our expectations based on the reviews here. We were fortunate enough to have room 55, with it's wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. The location is excellent - close to the metro, Rue Cler, and a variety of restaurants. The staff was very courteous and helpful whenever we needed anything.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, Charming & CONVENIENTLY located”
Reviews.Author: FrugalMamaCojo
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated, this hotel is delightful, if a bit pricey. For location you can't do much better. The breakfast is fabulous in their quaint castle-like, below-ground breakfast room! Their elevator holds two people + luggage, and that's not true everywhere. I absolutely recommend this hotel to sight-seers as it is but a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and several other tourist "must-see" locations. TIP: Catch a red, double-decker sightseeing bus anywhere you see the sign: LES CARS ROUGES, and for 24 Euros you can ride for 2 consecutive days, hopping on and off anywhere you see their signs. They will take you to most off the main tourists locations around central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: Life0ftravel
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel perfectly situated in Paris. It is very close to the subway and walking distance to most of the sights. I remember walking back from the Eiffel at night and being at the hotel in less than 10 minutes. There is plenty of restaurants and cafes around the area -which we really enjoyed. Great great location!!! We stayed in room 55 which had the most amazing view. We watched the Eiffel light up at night right from our room. The rooms are a good size and updated. The beds are very comfy and the bathroom is very adequate. We enjoyed our stay at this great hotel and hope to visit soon. I

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and homey feel”
Reviews.Author: NycTraveler25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It is close to several metro lines, very close to the Eiffel tower and the Rue Cler which is a great market street. The breakfast was a bit expensive so we never tried it. For the value you're better off going to Rue Cler and getting a baguette or go to a cafe and get some pastries. 24HR staff fluent in English and helpful. Room is tiny but Paris is known for that. Rooms were spotless and nicely decorated. No complaints especially pleasant to be near the Eiffel when you're coming back at midnight. Very safe neighborhood and very residential which gives it a pleasant feel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ash_mitch80
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Duquesne for 2 nights and thought it was such a lovely hotel. When you get over the shock of the size of the lift up to your floor!! 3 people plus suitcases is a tight squeeze! I had booked a triple room and upon check in was advised that they dont have triple rooms but that we had 2 adjoining rooms. This could not have been more perfect - we had an outer door that could be locked. We then had the two seperate rooms across the hall from each other - it work out like having our own little suite - 2 bedrooms & 2 bathrooms - always a plus for 3 girls travelling together!! Though the rooms are very small - its something you come to expect in big cities. The rooms were beautifully decorated and spotless. Staff in reception were very helpful - with fluent english. Location was great - could see the Eiffel Tower from our room. All in all an excellent stay and would highly recommend - inexpensive in what is quit an overpriced city in other aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have hoped for anything better”
Reviews.Author: Sooli
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paris for New Year's, and we stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel from December 29th to January 3rd, following the advice of Trip Advisor's reviewers. While the fireworks were a bit disappointing (because of the heavy fog, we figured) this hotel was certainly not! We made our reservations through their official website, and we didn't have any problems with it at all. I exchanged a few e-mails with Julie Palisse, who replies to the reviews here, and she was extremely helpful with answering any questions I had. We also ordered their airport transfer service, which was quite efficient and convenient; the annoying part, however, was having to wait for the car outside the airport gate in the cold for much longer than we had been told. Our first impression upon entering the hotel was a very good one: the interior was clean, cozy, and the staff at the reception was not only quite friendly, but also spoke very good English. We stayed in room 18, a standard double room that had no view, but was very nicely decorated. It was, of course, small, but that should always be expected in Paris. Everything was spotless clean, and the bed was absolutely fantastic (something very important after a long day of walking and sightseeing). Unavoidably, the bathroom was indeed small, but since it was just as well-taken-care-of as the rest of the room, that was not a problem. Something worth mentioning is that we never really figured out how to make the air conditioning work as we wanted it to. So I guess we were lucky that even though the room was always very hot when we returned from a day out, the problem could be easily and quickly solved by leaving the windows open for a few minutes. Admittedly though, we could have just called the reception. One of the reasons why we picked the Duquesne in the first place was its location, and it was on a par with our expectations in that aspect as well. The Eiffel Tower was within walking distance, and so were a few subway stations (which is really all you'll ever need to get around in Paris). Although the street the hotel was actually in didn't have many services or amenities, it was relatively quiet, which was a bonus at night. Besides, there were many other streets nearby that more than made up for it, with their many boulangeries, brasseries and shops in general. Rue Cler is particularly worth mentioning, offering many options of places to eat, have a drink or even just buy some fresh bread, cheese and good wine for a simpler, economic but still delicious meal in the hotel room. We usually ate breakfast around that area too, since the menus offered were quite filling and still cheaper than the hotel breakfast, but we did choose to indulge and ask for room service on the morning of January 1st. With a generous assortment of breads, jams, juice and coffee, plus the added convenience of having a breakfast for two in bed, we think the meal was fairly priced. Finding affordable places to have dinner in the direct area of the hotel wasn't easy, but upon asking at the reception for a suggestion, we were told about Le 7ème Vin: while it wouldn't be accurate to say it was an inexpensive place, it was definitely the most charming, and the best meal we had during our stay. We believe the hotel staff definitely contributed to make our trip even better: the service was excellent, from the receptionists to the housekeeping ladies. Coming back from a tiring day to find our room as cozy and clean as it was on the first day we arrived was always a very pleasant part of our routine in Paris. We were even surprised by a box of chocolate-coated nuts waiting for us in the room after New Year's, so we were glad to be able to show our appreciation with a few small gifts to the staff as well. Just writing this review and remembering the many good memories from the trip has really reminded us of how much want to come back. My boyfriend is from the Netherlands and it was his first time in Paris, hopefully out of many more to come. Next time, we definitely intend to stay at the Duquesne Eiffel again, and we hope to be able to enjoy Paris for a few more days than we did last time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, overpriced but so is the City”
Reviews.Author: gseire123
Reviews.Content: We payed quite a bit for this hotel. In fact it is among the dearest hotels I have ever stayed at and no where near the most comfortable, clean or even well located. The Hotels one and only selling point is its proximity to the Eiffel tower - we payed extra for a room that would give us a view of the tower. We could just about see it around the corner of an adjacent building. And to be honest there is very little else on this side of the river. The room was very very small, and the decor was old - infact some of the wallpaper was peeling and badly marked. The toilet was half the size of the room - which was frustrating as it was a waste of precious space. The breakfast was expensive and average at best. As I said earlyer the one and only thing that even comes close to justifying the price of this hotel is its proximity to the Eifell tower -and that dosent even garauntee you can see it from your room - as Ive said that costs extra. Romance wise this almost covers the price. Dont be fooled by the over the top reviews here - this hotel is 2+ or maybe a low end 3 star hotel. Its old and small and I would definately try elsewhere for this money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but there are better choices”
Reviews.Author: atlbeme
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 8 nights in Paris. Our trip was originally 7 nights but we decided to go a night earlier about two weeks prior. Based on availability, price, and location, this hotel was a good pick up front for a one night stay. It was really cool being able to see the Eiffel Tower out the window while laying in bed. The room was clean and had a very comfortable bed. Now for the bad parts- noise travels extremely well into the room from the hall, we found this to be true in the other hotel as well, must be a common trait. We expected the room to be small, which it was, but the bathroom was Tiny! The other hotel we stayed at had a bigger room and MUCH bigger bathroom. The hotel was close enough to the Invalides, the Eiffel tower, and such, but Duquense St itself was void of any restaurants or shops etc. They weren't far but it seemed like every other street we walked down had a least few restaurants and a small grocery. All the above does not make this a bad hotel, but my last thing is the worst- we found one hotel clerk in particular to be unfriendly and at one time just plain rude and mean. There was little or no explanation when we checked in about services from him. We went looking for ice and wound up being scolded like children for looking in the bar area for it. Foolish us, they bring it direclty to the room when asked. Please check out my other review for the "Lenox Montparnasse Hotel" it gets nothing but praise (except for noise)

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: JKY2010
Reviews.Content: We requested and got room 55! Room with the view and the balcony. The view was amazing. The room is small, as we expected, the bed very comfortable. The bathroom wasn't great. The towels were super thin, there were not a lot of them, and the shower was very awkwardly placed. We walked a lot and the metro is very close to the hotel. Some of the staff were very friendly, others not so much. We had breakfast twice and quite enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend Duquesne Eiffel Hotel for paris stay”
Reviews.Author: ramsi
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel trough (http://www.duquesneeiffel.com) which is not the official hotel website, but got a nice rate (172 EUR for the room / night) compared to other servies. breakfast is additional EUR 12 but had a nice range and fresh pastries, tea, coffee, ham, scrambled eggs and cornflakes. Our superior Room was No. 35 which had a great view to the Eiffel Tower out of the window. As rooms in paris are always quite small, the size was as expected. bed was comfortable and shower/toilet were clean and modern. The location of the hotel is great, about 10 minutes walk from the eiffel tower away. Athough the hotel is directly at the street, there was no noise inside the room. Reception was very helpful (giving tips for restaurants). Two ideas for improvements: There was just one small wastebasket in the bathroom but no one in the bedroom. The blankets were quite thick, so night was quite hot. Negative impression was the airport shuttle (yellow van) which is arranged by the hotel but is an external company. The driver was very unfriendly and over 20 minutes to late, what is quite much if you have to catch a plane. As in all big cities, there are tour buses, so we bought tickets for "open tour" which offers 4 different tours. If it's warm enought to sit on the on top (open bus area) it would be quite nice, else the windows are not so big an you won't be able to see much of the monuments. Overall the hotel is definitely a good deal for a paris stay and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: swayo
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviewers have already said it really is a great hotel and is in a great location. I must say, Jennifer at the front desk did a great job with our stay as well as the rest of the staff. Our room was spotless and the bathroom looked brand new. Some things you might not have read which might be of interest. Great wine shop a half block away. The are a lot of cafes, a few bakeries, and even a supermarket within a few blocks. The 8 train (only 3 short blocks away) is extremely easy to navigate. It is clean,efficent , and safe with connections to every part of the city within a few stops, even late at night. We take the New York subway system practically daily and this system blows it away. It was one of the highlights of our trip. We never needed a cab...there also is a bus stop right outside the hotel and that we used a few times which worked great. At night it is quiet around this hotel and if you are looking for action you have to wonder somewhere else but we believe that is a good thing. Internet access in lobby was available 24/7. We couldnt have been happier with our stay and location of this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: traumaknight
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a Rick Steve's tour in May, 2008. The staff were very friendly with one small exception. I stayed out late to take pictures (till 2 am) one night and almost got locked out. The gentleman working the desk was either slightly annoyed or surprised by the fact some nutty American came trumping in at that hour. I probably should have made arrangements in advance. Overall, the hotel is excellent. Very good breakfast, one of the best I've had in Europe (real scrambled eggs!) Room was small, but very clean. Bed was comfortable, shower - good. Had a nice little flat screen TV with a coupld of news channels in English, although, it was more fun to watch the French ones and see how much I had forgotten. About 10 minutes (I do walk fast) to Rue Cler and the Eiffel Tower; close to the Metro stop as well. Highly recommended hotel for Paris in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TangoTim
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of friends we booked the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for a long weekend (5 days) to celebrate my wifes 50th birthday. We have been in Paris other times but this time we took our friends advice and specifically requested room 55, and we couldn't have been happier. This room is on the fifth floor front corner and has the most magnificent view from the balcony of the Eiffel tower. Absolutely delightful. This is a small boutique hotel and while the rooms are typical in size for Europe they would be considered small by US standards. They are however well equipped with a comfy queen-sized bed with a down comforter and a well equipped bath. The windows are absolutely soundproof, the best we have ever encountered, so there was no street noise in the room. The hotel is nicely located about a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, two blocks from a Metro Station (Ecole Militare) and quite near several good and inexpensive restaurants on the Rue Cler. Plus it is near Cantin, on the rue Mar de Champs, the best cheese shop anywhere. We skipped the daily breakfast (13euros) and instead had our juice, cafe au lait and croissant at one the many cafes/brasseries nearby. All in all a wonderful trip and a very nice hotel which we will gladly return to the next time we are in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice, charming hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Moniqa
Reviews.Content: I have organized a trip to Paris for my mom’s birthday. After a lot of searching on the internet after a good, well-positioned and price-acceptable hotel, I have come across Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. The location seemed perfect for us with two subway stations close by. The Eiffel tower is close to the hotel so this tall tower can be used as an orientation point when walking from or to the hotel. Reviews on Tripadvisor and the hotel’s pictures looked great. Luckily I have found an offer on www.hotel.de which included a double room with breakfast buffet and welcome drink (100 euros per night for the whole, min. stay 2 nights) so I have booked it immediately. This offer wasn’t available on the hotel’s website. If you are booking a hotel in advance (2-3 months before the trip) or taking a trip in the next days, you can find various good-value offers (e.g. early bird offers, last minute offers) so search through more websites (HRS.de, hotel.de, FastBooking.com, Expedia.de) before booking the hotel. The feature of “Check rates” on the tripadvisor is very helpful to see the price differences on most of the hotel booking websites, these price differences can be quite high on certain occasions. Upon arrival and during our stay of 4 nights, the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. In the lobby, you can find a laptop with internet connection for free use. Our room was on the 4th floor with a view to the Eiffel tower. I was admiring it every morning when waking up and every evening before going to sleep. I had a W-Lan connection in our room, but, due to some miss-configuration, the internet didn’t work unfortunately. It is well-known that hotel rooms is Paris are small so don’t be surprised. Our room was tasteful and nicely furnished, its size was comfortably enough for two people. The bathroom was modernly equipped. The location of the hotel is even better than I thought when booking this hotel. Visiting Paris by foot is the best way to get a real taste of the city so we took nice walks to most of the sights starting from the hotel in the morning. The neighborhood seemed safe; we, two women, walked back to the hotel every evening without any fear, only by following the Eiffel tower from a distance. A good idea is to plan your daily itinerary upfront in order visit every day the sights close by in one chose area by foot if possible. We used the subway only for coming from and going to the airport. We had lovely chats with the hotel’s owner who stayed at the reception every evening and appreciated all the tips about Paris which he gave us. The breakfast buffet was delicious and more than sufficient to charge our energy for the upcoming long day. Various choices are available: ham and cheese, omlette and bacon, 4-5 different fruit jams, 4 types of cereals, orange and grapefruit juice, milk, coffee, tee and last but not least the typical French bakery products: croissant, pain au chocolat, pain au raisins and baguette. You can request to have your breakfast delivered in your room. We have chosen to serve it in the charming and tasteful breakfast room. I am already planning my next trip to the lovely Paris in the near future and I will be staying at Hotel Duquesne Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Paris where I stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel with my 10 yrs old son for three nights. Thanks again, TA, for helping find the right accomodation for our needs! Son wished for a hotel with a view to the Eiffel Tower, and Mum had to find something acceptable which wouldn't break the bank. The folks at the Duquesne gave us a lovely superior corner room (no. 45), with a window facing directly the Tower and another facing Avenue Duquesne and the Sport Ministry opposite the hotel. The room was perfectly soundproofed and pleasantly warm (you can set the airconditioning by yourself). Despite residing there with a rumbunctious fellow, I didn't find the room tiny at all. Very functional lighting system (spot reading light especially nice) as well. Bathroom modern and clean to a fault - no conditioner, shower cap and bath foam, but the products available were very good. Very pleasant reception staff - very helpful without being cloying - steered us to visit St Denis church together with the Stade de France, and helped with a very good restaurant, flight check in and a last minute request for a shuttle to CDG. Public areas pleasant and clean. Breakfast room in the lower ground floor. Breakfast a bit minimalistic (eggs, bacon, three kind of cereal, tinned fruit salad, cheeses, yoghourt, two kinds of juices, baguette, pastries, butter & jam, tea and coffee - when I asked for hot chocolate I was told I could make my own with hot milk and when I asked for a jug of cold milk I was told I should take the milk from the cereal stand with a glass) but all in all satisfactory. Wifi and free computer in the lobby. Rather not private, but didn't disturb me. Son was over the moon with "his" view of the Tower and nightly displays of lights on the hour and I had a very good time too. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DCIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our first wedding anniversary.  It was in a superb location - approx five minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower.  The rooms were very clean and beautifully decorated.  We stayed in room 56 ( a superior room) with a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower and a little balcony.  The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make our trip more enjoyable.  We highly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive City to say the least!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsLeek
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and modern but as I'd already read and prepared myself for, the rooms were very tiny! Although they were small they were perfectly formed and had everything you needed apart from tea/coffee making facilities. We were on the 5th floor in a superior room and had a lovely view of the tower. Paris itself was outragously expensive. A pint of Lager cost 10 euros and we struggled to get a snack under 10 euros also. A cup of tea was 5.50 euro. It ruined our weekend slightly as the euro is so close to the pound. We tried to eat and drink slighly out of the main streets but the prices were just as bad. I will say though how efficient their train services are, the metro was every couple of minutes but as you'd expect everything was in french and the train announcer only announcd the stops in french so you need to keep your wits about you. It was about an hours journey from the airport to the hotel and you need to change trains a few times. All in all we had a lovely break away and I would go back to the hotel and paris but not at those prices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, brilliant view - breakfast a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Moore1982
Reviews.Content: I had taken my partner to Paris overnight for his 30th Birthday and booked a superior room at the Duquesne Hotel. I had read numerous reviews and was very impressed by what I read. I have to compliment the hotel on their excellent service, even before we got there! I was so intent on having everything planned that they helped me (by email) to have directions to the hotel, discover nearby attractions, book restaurants etc. It was a brilliant help. I had asked for a room with a good view of the Eiffel Tower and got exactly this. We were in the 'Tour Eiffel' room (room 45) which had the most amazing view of the Tower, especially at night. The bed was huge and the room and bathroom were very clean. The staff were very helpful when we had queries about the area and when we checked out they looked after our luggage. The only disappointment was the breakfast which we paid 12 euros each for. Admittedly we didn't get up until 9.30am but they did say it was until 10.30am. On offer was only cold scrambled egg and bacon with some french bread and a few pastries. There were some cereals but they didn't look too appealing. Knowing how much my partner loves a cooked breakfast it was a little disappointing but this was a minor point. I would just recommend using one of the cafes or patisseries down the road instead.

Reviews.Title: “feels like it's my home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kanakea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris on 2/27/2009 and I miss it already. It's my fifth year at this hotel and they have done many upgrades, including free wifi. What makes this hotel special are it's owner Oliviier and Julie, Estrelle, Patrick and all the staff. Julie always makes us feel like we are returning home and extremely warm and a true professional. There are many choices of places to stay in Paris, and I would always return to the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel. Its true a Five Star feeling when I am there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and sevice but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: chumpies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Soccer World Cup and it's location was ideal for all our needs. We were greeted like old friends and were well looked after,nothing was a problem to the staff.The bakery up from the hotel was amazing and near-by resturants were everything we'd recalled about Parisian food. Clean rooms with little missing. Our only initial surprise was the bedroom size especially as we were travelling with big cases that got in the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: Magnetic_Travels
Reviews.Content: I searched for quite some time, many hotel search engines. In the end I used tripadvisor to find this gem. I saw the reviews and photos and it did not disappoint. Based on tripadvisor I requested room 55, but it was very short notice (maybe 3 days before) and was given room 35 instead. It was definitely worth the extra to get a Superior room. When I arrived, we had a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. Each hour on the hour, it lit up with an amazing light show. I dont think we would have appreciated Paris if we did not stay here. The view is really what made it. It is a bit away from the main center, but easy to get to with the metro and the Paris €1 a day bicycles. (These were a great way to get around and are found on many streets.). Due to the location, we only had to look out for the Eiffel Tower on our bicycles and could easily find the hotel. The room was small, but I knew this is the case with most hotels in Paris. It was definitely modern and clean. The only bad thing was that they did not have tea or coffee in the room, but you can get this in the bar downstairs. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to friends. For your 1st weekend in Paris, you have to stay here ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Must visit!”
Reviews.Author: rachel29689
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over the recent Valentine's weekend and I couldn't recommend it more! I booked it less than a month in advance, and as could be expected, was told that there was only a room overlooking the Eiffel Tower avaliable for the first night (13th) However, when we got there we were told that we could keep our room for the entire stay. Next time, I'll book further ahead and request a room with a balcony...I can only imagine the views given how amazing our room (without balcony) was at such short notice. The staff could not have been more helpful...booking us a restaurant for Valentine's night, translating menus, giving directions, nothing was too much trouble! A 3 minute walk away from the metro (Ecole Militaire), lovely surrounding bars/restaurants and a 10 minute walk from the Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful once we got settled”
Reviews.Author: rockychocolate
Reviews.Content: I forgot to write this review last year when we had returned from 2 weeks in Europe. I had booked this Hotel as I had planned a big trip with my teenage daughter and senior mother, and I wanted something special to stay in for our 4 days in Paris. What at first was disappointing and aggravating later turned to great satisfaction. I booked the Hotel almost 6 months in advance, but when we arrived the hotel was under construction and had had a delay - and the staff hadn't been able to contact me. So we arrived after an arduous time at the Train station and a few mixups to the Hotel and were informed there was no room. Then we were directed to another hotel, that was only a short walk (45 minutes with my mother towing our suitcases behind us) where they would put us up for the night. The other hotel was not nice..and we were told that the whole city was sold out and it was the only equal hotel they could find. The next day we came back and they had our room ready, and it was totally gorgeous! It was completely renovated, and a real retreat after walking all day in Paris. The front desk payed for a cab to bring us from the other Hotel back to Hotel Duquesne, and the breakfast was very good, by European standards. We were sad to leave. I would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Winter!”
Reviews.Author: add_09
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I went to Paris for a winter break & decided to stay at the Duquesne Eiffel. After much deliberation on where to stay, we decided to be near the Eiffel Tower / Ecole Militaire. Wwe picked the Duquesne Eiffel because of the views that we could get of the Eiffel tower. We stayed in Room 54 (photos have been uploaded by others on tripadvisor), which was a superior room + balcony. I must say, the extra money for this room was worth it - the view is excellent (again, as photos show on this site). The room itself was well decorated & cosy, with a good size en-suite bathroom. The room did have a mini-bar, although we didn't use it!! (£££) We didn't try the breakfast (although the breakfast room is v.nice) & preferred to get breakfast from bakeries/cafes on our way out to many of the sites in paris. My only gripe, was that the beeding wasn't changed while we were there (5 days) + we randomly received an early wake up call on our 2nd night! The Hotel is very well lcoated for the Metro (which is very reliable + efficient). We very much enjoyed our stay the Duquesne, I don't think I will ever forget the view from the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Duquesne”
Reviews.Author: siiri81
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was fantastic.. clean beautiful room with great view of the Eiffel Tower. The bed was really comfy, only wish we could have stayed longer!! The staff was friendly and helpfull. This hotel is easily accessible from the airport (Roissy Bus to Opera and then subway 8 to Ecole Militaire). Close to the Important sights too!! The breakfast ok as well. We will defenetly come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JubuOui
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to return to the Duquesne! I originally booked a Standard room through Orbitz, then found the hotel's site offered a Comfort room for less money (buy 2 nights, get 1 free), so I cancelled with Orbitz and re-booked directly. It pays to do research on their promotions. Even though it was just five days before our arrival, I requested a room with a view if available. When we arrived there was a Superior room that wasn't booked, so we got it and no extra cost! It had to have had the best view of the Eiffel Tower of the whole place. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and the bathroom was very nice. Everything seemed recently remodeled. Breakfast was rather pricey, but at 12 euros I think it was cheaper than many hotel breakfasts. There was no Wi-Fi in the room but there was in the lobby and it was free, so we were blogging and Skyping from there every night. There was no clock in the room, but I think this must be normal in French hotels. The reception desk can provide wake up calls easily. I recommend the cafe La Terasse for dinner. It's right at the exit of the Ecole Militaire metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but please beware of metro pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: Gaelic_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a trip with my mother. I contacted the hotel in advance of our stay to find out what rooms had views so that I could book one with a fair chance of having a view of the Eiffel and so increase our chances. When we arrived we found we had a super view of the Eiffel and we were in superb proximity to many places either walking or via metro so the location is excellent. The room was smallish but as expected for a boutique hotel and beautifully decorated. The beds were incredibly comfortable. We elected not to have breakfast in the hotel as we enjoyed checking out the local patisseries. It was a spotless hotel and room service was discreet and efficient. We had an excellent stay in Paris except for the one mishap - my mothers wallet was taken from her bag on our very last metro trip. Please please beware of groups of young girls - they were waiting on the platform a few carriages up but when the train came they crowded us along with other 'regular' travellers. In the push of the crowd they managed to swifly undo mums bag and whip out the wallet - it only dawned on me it had happened when they jumped off the train before it took off. These people are experts ! I have travelled a lot and this was the first time I have the benefit of hindsight to see how these things can happen so easily. A lesson learned! So a tip - carry minimum cash in a wallet, have your cards/money elsewhere on your person and always always have your wits about you when waiting for or standing on the train - if a distraction occurs or you feel the push of crowds - beware- there are pickpockets all around !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value & would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CAM66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights between Christmas and New Year in one of the Comfort level double bed rooms. On arrival the staff were friendly and throughout our stay they were always helpful. The room itself was clean, a decent size, by Parisienne standards, and looked like it had recently been refreshed/decorated. The facilities inside the room were good including a mini-bar service, flat screen T.V. and modern/new shower unit. The only things worthy of critical comment are pretty minimal, however so that others are aware: if you stay in rooms at the end of a corridor you need to know where the light switch is, to illuminate the area in front of your door, otherwise it can be quite difficult to see the handle and unlock the door. Once you've found the light ouside the door for the first time it's no problem from then on. There are some areas with suspended panels for the celing and when you open/close a door the pressure can sometimes cause these to move and they can startle you a little. Finally, like many older buildings you can hear most every noise in the rooms around you. This is just the way things are in older built apartments & hotels and simply cannot be avoided. So, minor criticisms aside, overall we liked this hotel, it has a good location and is near the Metro and Rue Cler market/cafe areas, where there are several excellent little bistro's and retaurants. We would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shefford
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a "confort" room at the Duquesne for 3 nights in December 08. The room (no 34) had twin beds, a sofa, sufficient storage space and a WC separate from the bathroom. The hotel has recently been refurbished and is spotlessly clean. The beds were very comfortable and the double glazing keeps out traffic noise from the busy road outside. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower when we leaned out of the window. There is a small bar and a PC for guests' use in the lobby , as well as a seating area with newspapers. Didn't try the breakfast, but there are several cafes nearby which we used instead. The hotel is also in a good location for restaurants, as well as being near the Eiffel Tower, Rodin Museum, Invalides and Musee d'Orsay. Would definitely stay at the Duquesne again,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fmck49
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel. 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower, 2 minutes walk from picking up the Open Tour Bus at Les Invalides. All the staff are very friendly and welcoming. We chose superior rooms with a view of the Eiffel Tower and neither of us were disappointed. We were both very comfortable and slept well. Despite being on a main road, not a sound is heard through the heavy balcony windows. Breakfast is fine and for Paris good value. I would recommend getting down early though as there is less choice later on. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: yamato8
Reviews.Content: Hotel Duquesne Eiffel is a small hotel rated at 3 stars. Comparing to other hotels of similar class, the room size is a bit small but very clean. The furnishings are new, tasteful and comfortable. They have free Internet access which is a plus. However, their elevator is small and made a jerking motion everytime it stops at a floor. After using it several times, we got the hang of it. Location is very good since it is near a Metro station and some notable spots like Rue de Cler, and the Eiffel Tower. Area also felt very safe. Glitch we experienced during our stay was that the hotel staff who checked us in did not give us a complete orientation. Finding our room was a bit difficult since the hallways were dark. The motion sensitive lights in the hallways on our floor did not always work. Also, staff did not tell us on how to turn on the lights in our room. We were supposed to insert the card key in the light switch to turn on the power. Then our safe did not have a key and we were given the option to leave our valuables in the front desk. Not that we did not appreciate the effort by Julie. Thanks to her we were able to go around the city without worrying about the safety of our travel documents, etc. Jessica was equally helpful in giving tips on which sights to see and also provided logistics on how to get to those places. Even the guy who checked us in was helpful in providing us hot drinking water late at night for my grandmother's tea. Probably he just needs more training on how to entertain guests. Lastly, breakfast could use more variety. They served eggs and ham everyday. Maybe they can mix it up with bacon and sunny side up some other days. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would therefore recmommend it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kate08
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel for a visit to the beautiful city of paris. the location is pefect the staff are friendly and helpful. the rooms were small but ideal for our needs. the rooms were very clean and we had a great view of the eiffel tower. overall i would recommend this hotel and i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable stay & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nat24s
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel directly after seeing it here. We stayed from Friday until Monday and found it to be overall - perfect. Location: In the 7th, quiet area, yet within easy walk to Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, Louvre, Saint Germain and many other attractions. Rue Cler minutes away for a wonderful breakfast and supermarket/pharmacy even closer. Room: We booked a superior room and requested a balcony/view if possible. We were given room 54 on the 5th floor, with a reasonable balcony (approx 1m wide), at least a metre and a half from the bed to the desk and plenty of room to move. The bed is the best bed I have ever slept in in any hotel. The place was spotless - and I am pedantic. Shower quite small - to be expected however I am not a small lady so it will be OK for most. Service: We received the best service imaginable from all the staff, who were more than happy to book cabs and give advice, and even to keep our bags whilst we waited for our train home. They all speak excellent english and were happy for us to use our basic french as well. We will be staying here again (already booking our next trip) and will definitely be recommending it to anyone who will listen. Merci Beacoup Hotel Duquesne!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyeatheart
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned a trip to Paris and booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. After booking the hotel on the hotel website, I sent an email requesting a room with a view. I received a response stating that it could not be guaranteed. We arrived at the hotel 1-2 hours before check in, but luckily our room was ready for us. We were put in a wonderful room on the fifth floor in the corner. Could nto have asked for a more beautiful view of the eiffel tower - the balcony was amazing. We were lucky to have received one of the rooms with a view, and I don't know if this was due to our request or because the hotel was not full. The room was very quiet and clean. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice. Receptionists were very helpful and spoke English very well. Our only complaint-which we did not actually complain to management about-was that one day we came back to the hotel to find that both of our contact lens case were missing. I assume that the cleaner would not steal these, so my guess is that she just swept them into the trash without regard for whether they were temporary or not. Besides that, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Holling
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for six nights and had a great experience with this hotel: Rooms - Spotless! Hotel Staff - Very helpful and caring. Location - You can walk to any attraction / museum from this hotel. Food - There are hundreds of places to eat within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. WiFi - Free in the lobby. We Skyped and video chatted home every night. The front desk will book any tour you like for no additional fee and they will arrange for a ride back to the airport if needed. Some of the reviews comment on the small size of the rooms. Think about it, who goes to Paris to sit in their hotel room? We showered and we slept. The rest of the time we were out touring, eating, shopping and drinking wine.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches?”
Reviews.Author: YesAnotherTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the high ratings on Trip Advisor. While it did live up to what many people have written about in terms of the recent remodeling, our big problems was probable tiny roaches! On our first night, we accidently turned the fan/air conditioning (?) on, and we later noticed bugs that appeared to be tiny roaches on the ceiling and one later on the bathroom floor -- for a total of 5-6. The second night, we left the fan off and the window cracked open, and no bugs... We also requested the rooms on the 4th and 5th floor mentioned in previous reviews, but they couldn't guarantee it. We ended up getting a 2nd floor room (224?), which had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower when we leaned out the window, but not like the others. The hotel is in a great location, as people mentioned -- a 10-15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, 5 minute walk from the Ecole Militaire metro stop, and 7 minutes from Rue Cler which has great places to eat. But, the night we had difficulty sleeping because we were afraid the bugs would fall on us kind of outweighed the positives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: xodar
Reviews.Content: I chose the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel based on the hotel's location, price and favorable reviews on tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. Our room was on the 5th floor. While small by US standards, it was more than adequate. The room and bath were clean and well maintained. The staff were all very pleasant and most spoke english. One point mentioned in an earlier review was no alarm clock. My wife and I stayed in 8 different hotels while in France and none had an alarm clock. Lucky for us that my pocket translator had one! The location of the hotel is excellent, close to Les Invalides and Eiffel Tower. I would definely stay here again. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: PlainsWoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen for us by our tour. After a night in the Hotel Splendid, we were sure that anything would be a step up. The Hotel Duquesne Eiffel said that they were upgrading our room because of the inconvenience of making us stay elsewhere our first trip, so that our room would have a view of the Eiffel Tower. Our room was on the 6th floor (European 5th). Again, the room was tiny, but this time we had a queen-sized bed that was very comfortable, with a choice of hard or soft pillows. The room had a small balcony, from which if you stretched way out, you could indeed see the Eiffel Tower. It was quiet and no bug spray smell! However, the towels were worn and threadbare. We did not have hot water on either of the two days that we stayed there; we guessed that the hotel was at capacity and that they ran out of hot water. No luggage rack. No alarm clock. Amenities were okay (why is it that everyone thinks a shower cap is the height of luxury?), but no Kleenex. Breakfast was included the next two mornings, for which one would normally pay 12 euros. It included both hot and cold items; very runny scrambled eggs, wafer thin slices of ham, cereal, yogurt, coffee, pastries and juice. Some packaged items were sitting out there too - things that looked like Melba toast and Swiss cheese (they call it Emmenthal). Don't leave the breakfast room for anything - they won't let you come back in! Frankly, I wouldn't have paid $18 USD for that breakfast when a 10 minute walk to the Rue Cler would have bought me a great selection of pastries and pain du chocolat, but it was included with my tour, so I didn't have to pay extra for it. For what it's worth, there's also a great "Supermercato" 2 blocks down, and a bakery shop open weekdays just 1/2 block away with super pastries if you want a light, cheap breakfast in an authentic setting. The staff were absolutely super, and fluent in English. They could answer just about any question - except about church services. If you need to go to church while there, look it up before you come. This is very unlike the States, where every hotel/motel posts local church services in the lobby. I had done my research ahead of time and ended up going to church (in French) about 15 minutes away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to call home in Paris..”
Reviews.Author: scarpia
Reviews.Content: Winding up a positive 8-day stay. Here's how this place paid off: -- Quiet rooms! Paris can be noisy, but not here. If you need 2 rooms ask for 17 and 18, end units so no shared walls with others and you can create a mini-suite by locking an outside hallway door. -- Rooms recently redone, clean and well appointed. We found the beds comfy, nice bedding, a good night's rest through the jetlag. -- Helpful, hard-working front desk. Estelle and Julie are formidable one-two punch, proactive on problem solving, fast online with reservations, etc., better English than one would find in Paris, Tx. -- Location, location, loc... you get the point. 3-minute walk to Metro, 5-minute to Napoleon's mausoleum, Invalides, 10-minutes Rodin museum, 15-minutes to Eiffel Tower. Best of all, just off Rue Clare 5 minutes to stunning fromagerie Marie Anne Cantin, another 30 seconds to equally awesome boulangerie Pain d'Epis, both Top 10 Paris ratings. Gives you Paris' best meal under 10 Euros if you bring it back to the room. -- A word about the 7th. Pleasant and very safe, but for slamming nightlife you'll need to Metro elsewhere. Some nice cafes and parks adjacent, but this is not the spot for clubbing. -- And full disclosure asterisk. As I sit here typing, about the only downside that comes to mind is that rooms can run small for a standard, as does the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_savman
Reviews.Content: This is a very well maintained property in good location near the Eiffel Tower and very close to the Metro station for exploring Paris. The rooms are very small but spotless, cosy feel and v comfortable bed. The hotel is very expensive for what it is but that seems to be the norm for the City as a whole. Free internet access in the lobby for hotel guests which is a very nice feature. We did not sample breakfast as we did not feel it was worth €12pp when there were cheaper alternatives within very close walking distance in the many cafes etc. One seemingly insignificant grips, but irritating nonetheless, is the total lack of any English channels on the in room TV, not even by PPV. If you do not speak French you will go bonkers if you have to spend any long spells relaxing in your room. Very strange considering one would assume this property would attract many international visitors and to not even have a basic news channel to watch is frustrating (let alone Hollywood movies badly overdubbed). Minor issues aside, we would recommend the Duquesne for first time visitors to Paris, it's in a good neighbourhood with decent accessibility to everywhere. If returning we would probably stay elsewhere but that's taking nothing away from this very nice hotel. The staff were generally friendly although (just a tip) when your guests are checking out in the early morning and request a taxi, it's not good etiquette to send them out onto the cold dark streets to hail down a cab to try save some call out charges. Good intention perhaps, but we nearly missed our connecting airport coach transfer (hardly worth the stress for €6). There was also no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which we found strange but there was a chargeable minibar if one was so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely choose again!”
Reviews.Author: LFoley
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at approximately 2pm after our overnight flight from the States. The Ecole Militaire metro stop is very conveniently close, and we chose to take the RER and metro into town from CDG. The lobby area was small but very pleasant with some rustic touches like wood beamed ceilings. We got checked in right away and were given the room I had requested some 9 months before when I booked - one with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. We were in the Eiffel Tower Room (appropriately named!) on the 4th floor, and, let me tell you, it was wonderful to have our first good look at the tower come from the hotel room! We would spend some very romantic moments gazing at the sparkling tower at night from our window. Being in a big European city, the room was small, of course, but quite comfortable. Everything was super clean, and I'm very observant about that sort of thing when it comes to hotels. There was the queen bed, a dresser-ish piece of furniture with a mini fridge in it, a desk with a chair, a flat screen TV, a small closet, the bathroom with sink and shower/tub, and a separate toilet closet. One thing I found very nice is how sound-insulated the windows were. When open, you heard the usual city noise, but when closed, it was extremely quiet. We didn't partake of the 11 euro breakfast, so I can't comment on that. Instead, we went around the corner to the nearby Rue Cler where there are fruit stands and bakeries to put together a nice breakfast from. Our first morning there, we bought some croissants, beignets (more dense than New Orleans beignets), nectarines, orange juice, and goat cheese (the cheese was all for hubby, bleh) and walked down to the Eiffel Tower where we found a nice park bench on which to enjoy our meal. A much preferable experience to breakfasting in a hotel, IMO. The hotel is very convenient to everything since the metro stop is so close, and with the metro cost very reasonable, we traveled all over the city with no problem. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jchin1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 separate stints in our Europe trip. 1st part: Arrived early afternoon at Hotel Duquesne and they told us that we didn't have room for 1 night out of 3 nights, and that the booked us a room at the Hotel Splendid down the street. We stupidly agreed to this arrangement not knowing that Splendid wasn't so splendid. the only redeeming part was that we had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our hotel window. But after getting our room at Duquesne the next day (they took our bags for us), we realized that Duquesne was so much nicer. We didnt' have a view of the Tower, but the bed, bathroom and room was so much nicer. Breakfast was covered for us, because of their mishap, which was great. Eggs, ham, good coffee, etc. 2nd part: came back to Hotel Duquesne after a couple more cities in Europe and it felt like home instantly. They gave us a room on the 4th floor with a perfect view of the Eiffel. If we go back I'll definitely request that room. Great location, 7 minute run to the Eiffel Tower, right by some good brasseries/cafes, metro, clean rooms, good breakfast, pleasant service, decent price. When i go back to Paris I'll definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: steveoNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and if time had allowed , we would have been happy to stay for our entire holiday. we were given a room on the top floor with balcony and an amazing view of the Eiffel tower. Night time views are even more impressive with hourly light shows lighting up the tower. The room was extremely comfortable and no traffic noise. Cleaned daily and great breakfasts. Would recommend this hotel as one of the best that we have stayed at and central to Paris. The tower is about 10 minutes easy walking distance and subway is 5 minutes away. A special thanks to Lucy who does a fantastic job at the desk in welcoming you and making sure everything is as you want it. She has a lovely, friendly personality and is a credit to the hotel and deserves special mention for making our stay so relaxing and enjoyable. Thankyou

Reviews.Title: “loved duquesne!”
Reviews.Author: lilafoxermel
Reviews.Content: my husband & i stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel for a week in early May 2008. great location, reasonably priced for 7th Arrondisement, nicely renovated rooms, super shower / bathroom, concierge "Lucy" was fantastic, tasty breakfast in the neat cellar, fun little cafe next door, near Rue Cler & Metro...could go on and on. would highly recommend to anyone wanting a comfy, quiet, clean, friendly & well-priced hotel close to everything in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Duquesne”
Reviews.Author: LoveChicago
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the overwhelming good reviews here and were not disappointed. The Duquesne Eiffel Hotel is located in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, close to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and the Musee Rodin. We like this area of Paris, it's quiet and safe, close enough to the sights to either walk or take a short metro ride, close to the Rue cler area where there are a lot of restaurants and patisseries. We stayed at a budget hotel in the Latin Quarter the last time we visited and were disappointed so this time I was looking for something affordable but nice and found it at this hotel. The reception staff was very pleasant, not particularly helpful on restaurants but fortunately we had printed out some recommendations in advance. They had a computer set up in the lobby where we checked our email which was very nice for us. Breakfast was not included in our rate of €102, it was an additional €11 so we got breakfast at a local patisserie instead since we just want a pastry. We had a standard double room, there are also comfort rooms and superior rooms, some of which appear to have a view of the Eiffel Tower and balconies. We booked the room on booking.com, the rate was lower than their normal rate I assume because it was August when a lot of people avoid going to Paris since a lot of Parisians vacation at that time. Room 58-very clean, our room was not overly large but certainly big enough for the two of us. The bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. The room had a plasma TV with the extremely odd feature of being able to rotate the picture so it was upside down or reversed, air conditioning, minibar with just a small amount of extra space for your own stuff and modern decor, looked to be newly remodeled. No view from our room but then again we didn't pay for one. Bathroom-plenty spacious, very clean, shower and tub with good water pressure and plenty of hot water, toiletries included shampoo/bath gel on the wall in the tub, lotion, emory boards and a few other things I didn't need. Hairdryer in bathroom. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcselz
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the web and couldn't be more pleased, although we were only able to stay for 2 nights. We pretty much agree with the other reviews on this site -- it delivered everything we had hoped for -- it was clean, modern, well-air conditioned, well-located and with a very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in room #55, which we would recommend -- the view is to die for (see pictures), and certainly added to our Paris experience. We also loved the neighborhood, and after walking around other Paris neighborhoods decided this was our favorite. We will definitely return in the future for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dori12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 nights. We loved our stay. The rooms are very stylishly decorated, with attention to detail and impeccably clean. The beds are really VERY COMFORTABLE - which is important after walking around Paris all day. Our room was on the first floor and overlooking the street, but it was not noisy at all. Everybody at the reception was very kind and helpful and they all spoke English very well. The location of the hotel is very convenient - if you want to walk as much as possible - like we did - this hotel is very conveniently located. There are bakeries and a supermarket nearby, so you can buy mineral water and croissants at normal prices. And of course, the Eiffel Tour is within 10 minutes walk so you can go there early and ahead of the long queues The only minor shortcoming was that there were no TV channels in English and as we speak no French at all, we had to ask the receptionist what the weather forecast was. Anyway, I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandMary_Jane
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel - very clean and comfortable and staff were always helpful and friendly. Location was excellent and only a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. Would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed EVER!”
Reviews.Author: jrk_23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duquesne for 5 nights to start off our European honeymoon. The staff were very courteous at the front desk and showed us to the room. Everything in the hotel is small. The lobby is small, the elevator is tiny and the hallways are tight but that's Paris for you. The Room: The room was TINY!!! It was room 10 and it was basically a bed with about 6 inches on either side. The bathroom was tiny as well as only one person could stand at it at a time. There was no real storage in the hotel room either but that being said, it was the most comfortable bed ever and we slept well into the first morning there. The next day we requested an upgrade and were immediately shown a deluxe room that was still small by North American standards but was much more appropriate. The Staff: For the most part we were very pleased with them. They all spoke good english and were able to help us with any problem. They were having a computer problem while we were there so our upgrade took some time but as we ended up with what we wanted, we arent' going to complain. The Location: Great location, close to metro and the Eiffel tower. No complaints there. Food: The breakfast there is not included and at 11 euros, I would suggest grabbing a croissant or baguette at the patisserie on up the road. The thai place next door is indeed really good. All in all, while it was not the nicest hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon, it was a very comfortable stay and we would recommend it, although only the upgraded room. We also stayed at the Plaza Tour Eiffel which has a higher trip advisor rating and I would stay in the Duquesne over it.

Reviews.Title: “best Hotel I ever stayed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: steffenxy
Reviews.Content: awesome clean and friendly hotel, perfectly situated in the center of Paris. With a little bit of luck you have Eiffel Tower view. Very clean bothroom, some rooms have nice balcony(we were 6 and had 3 rooms), climate machine was working, not loud - perfect stay for 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spupixy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel for 10 days and loved every minute of it. We were in room 45 the "Tour Eiffel" room and had a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower from our main window. The staff was friendly, helpful, and informative; we were especially fond of Lucie. They all speak English wonderfully and make you feel very welcome in their city. The hotel has a computer with internet acess that is helpful to keep track of family at home. My sister and dad were at home so it was helpful for my mom to be able to check on them. The hotel has an amazing location only a few blocks from the metro and an easy walk to many of our favorite sights. We were dropped off at the airport by their shuttle for a reasonable price saving us from the hassle and outragous cost of a cab. We will stay there again any time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth E
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Duquesne Eiffel Hotel to celebrate her Sweet 16th birthday. We could not have picked a nicer hotel. The hotel is located very near the Metro stop Ecole Militaire about 3 blocks away and once you get the gist of the subway it is a great way to get around. You can buy a "Visite Pass" which gives you unlimited use of the trains and buses for a certain number of days. We bought a 3 day Visite and when that was done we got a carnet of tickets ( a 10 pack of tickets ) and used that.Our hotel was in the 7th arrondismont literally a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. Our room overooked the street and we could just catch a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower when it was lit up at night. The hotel sits on a corner and it is very convienent to many sites that are very nearby. Les Invalides , where Napolean is buried is right down the street, the Eiffel Tower is very close by, The Rodin Musum is around the corner from Les Invalides that is where the famous statue of The Thinker is . It is a magnificient statue and it sits outside in the middle of a rose garden- fabulous!! The mostly pedestrian only street called The Rue Cler is one block behind the Ecole Mitaire Metro stop. We really enjoyed Rue Cler , it is a slice of life for the local Parisien. There is a boulangerie called The Artisan where you get the best croisannts ,baguettes and pastries. We ate breakfast at Le Pettitte Bistro next to the Post office , and dinner at a restaurant down further called Tribeca both were excellent. If you are a Rick Steves fan he recommends them both. We also ate at la Terasse on the corner by the Metro stop Ecole Militaire, also very good food .The hotel has recently been remodeled and our room # 47 was beautiful. The windows are brand new and double glazed so there was no street noise at all, we were on the 4th floor just above the trees.The size is small but that is standard for Europe. It was very clean and everything was brand new ( linens - towels etc ) The closet is the only place to put your clothes, there are shelves and hangars. It was adequate for our stay of 5 days. The hotel staff were very nice especially Lucy who was a huge help with everything. All the staff spoke perfect english so there was no problem. It was so nice to meet Julie, the manager whom we've read so much about on Trip Advisor, she was very sweet and she should be proud of her staff. We had use of the hotels laptop computer and we were able to check our email and keep in touch with family back home. The hotel lobby was the last thing being remodeled and it was finished on the day we left, the floors looked great! We used the hop on/hop off Batobus boat tours as our transportation and also walked a lot! You can get the Batobus boat at the base of the Eiffel Tower and it literally stops at every major museum or place of interest. It was a nice and calm way to travel ,but it is not for those in a hurry. I loved it and found it to be reasonably priced.It will take you to The Lovre, Notre Dame, Champs d' Elysee, Orsay Museum etc.. most of the major museums are along the river Seine. We took the Metro up to Sacre Couer Church in Montmartre ( get off at Anvers and take the funicular up to the top, it costs one metro ticket approx 1.60 Euro for the funicular) the view from the steps of Sacre Couer down into the city of Paris are amazing. We looked around where the artists set up shop on Place du Terre right around the corner from Sacre Couer. My daughter had her portrait drawn for 35 Euros ( a little less than $ 50 US ) it was well worth it, it was an amazing experience, one I'm sure she'll never forget. Paris is a beautiful city and I'm glad I got to go. I would highly recommend The Duquesne Eiffel Hotel, it is ideally located, clean, and well staffed .

Reviews.Title: “What a great view!!”
Reviews.Author: maridat6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and was most impressed with the hotel. The room was gorgeous, beautiful decor, comfortable bed and very clean!! The view from our room was wonderful especially at night when the Eiffel Tower was lit up. The staff was friendly and helpful. We preferred to walk all over Paris but we did find the train system very efficient and easy on our day to Paris Disney. If you are looking for a place where location, cleanliness, and a relaxed comfortable room is important, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheCards
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 2 nights in the hotel, we met our Rick Stevens tour there. While there I had a family emergency and we had to leave. Trying to get things done in a foreign country is very intimidating but the staff there went above and beyond to help us. We cannot say enough about their help. The hotel itself is great, well kept and in a great location both for metro and ATM. They were doing some work in the lobby while we were there. We were in room 57 and had a view of the Eiffel tower. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaRocky
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenaged son & I stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel for four nights in the beginning of July and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. We had booked a triple room (with a view of the Eiffel Tower if possible) and were given separate adjoining rooms, one with a view out the window if you open it and look to the right. The rooms, not large but adequate, were recently renovated to a very high standard and had very comfortable beds. The weather was fairly warm for a couple of the days we stayed and the air conditioning was a great relief after a full day of walking and touring. The rooms were very quiet as other reviewers had mentioned because of the new windows. The staff was very helpful at the desk and the cleaning staff do an outstanding job. It was our first (and definitely not last) trip to Paris and the location was perfect for going to the Eiffel Tower, Napolean's Tomb (really worthwhile) and excellent restaurants. The Metro is great for getting around anywhere and the station is a five minute walk. Paris is a truly great city and our stay at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel made it all the better. I do not hesitate to recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Très Bien”
Reviews.Author: jseliger
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is virtually unbeatable. From the balcony on the fifth floor we could directly look at tour Eiffel. All major sights are in walking distance and there is a Metro station 5 min away at Place de l'Ecole Militaire. The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful, the guy at the front desk had some very decent tips about where to go and where the tourist traps are. Paris as a whole was a very pleasant city to explore. I am German and my wife is American and we discovered only friendliness and world openness in this amazing city. Next time we are in Paris, we will certainly stay at the Duquesne Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “Au revoir et à bientôt”
Reviews.Author: Ninav_fin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just perfect for everything. Eiffel tower and river Seine are in few minutes of walk. Hotel rooms are small, as they usually are in Paris, but very clean and nice. Spotless, I would say. Thank you for cleaning it up every day. Very nice decor. Nice little Patisseries and Boulangeries around the hotel to have breakfast or coffee break. We highly recommend this hotel for its location, exellent service and recently renovated rooms. We had wonderful holiday with my husband, and will come back in Paris and to this carming little hotel. We will not want to stay anywere else when coming back. Great value for the money. Merci. Nina and Kimmo, Finland

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: mgebbie
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris to celebrate our 10th Anniversary, and chose to stay at the Duquesne based on other reviews we had read about the Hotel. It certainly lived up to our expectations. We arrived at 9am, when check-in is at 2pm. Lucie was really helpful when we arrived, we were able to leave our bags with her, and she helped us get our bearings and find things to do until we could come back to check-in. In our booking, I had requested a room with a good view of the Eiffel Tower, and I think we were given the BEST room. The view of the tower from our private balcony was absolutely spectacular. Of course the rooms are small, the hotel was built 200 years ago, but the rooms are extremely modern and comfortable. Electronic door locks, flatscreen TV, very well appointed bathroom amenities, modern furniture and a good number of power outlets (not in the bathroom however, which seemed to be common in the other hotels we stayed in Europe). And quiet! The windows/doors were double glazed, and the room was really quiet. It was surprising to open the doors to go out to the balcony and realise how noisy it was outside. The staff were very helpful and had no issues with regards speaking in English (though I tried attempting French). Lucie really helped us get settled on the first day, she also helped me arrange flowers for the room for our Anniversary to surprise my wife, she helped explain the Metro and navigating around, and they were able to arrange a Yellow Van for us to get us to the airport when we checked out. Nothing seemed too much effort. The Hotel is a 20 min casual stroll from the Eiffel Tower, about 10 mins from Les Invalides, and 5 mins from the Ecole Militaire Metro Station. Very convenient location. We would definitely stay there again and they really helped make our visit to Paris a special event.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, affordable, well located, welcoming and stylish”
Reviews.Author: L878765
Reviews.Content: Wow - where to start? It is an excellent hotel, and the best value hotel I have used in Paris. I've been visiting Paris for 20 years and this is the best hotel (but not the most expensie) I've stayed in. Excellent location in a pleasant, quiet but very central area. Close to metro, but you can walk to many places in central Paris from the hotel. You can also stock up on mineral water, fruit, bread etc in shops nearby. The hotel is very stylish, in fact I'd say it is sophisticated - I got the impression that someone with an interior design background has been involved in this or they've paid a lot to get a good professional designer in. The room I stayed in was very nicely decorated and furnished - in fact better than most 4 star hotels I have stayed in. Everything was perfect, including the choice of paint colour on the woodwork and the inspired striped carpet! The lighting was unusually good - with all the lights on it was bright enough for me to read by, I'm really sick of dismal rooms when you turn the lights on full and you still can't read. Reception staff spoke fluent English, were efficient, friendly, and more approachable and helpful than I have found before in a Paris hotel. The breakfast serving staff were great also - good English, friendly, helpful. I'm not one for asking a lot of questions of reception staff, but I noticed some other English speaking guests doing so and the receptionist was really helping with advice, hints etc. Both check-in and check-out were rapid. The reason I booked here and not another place? Fire safety. I have a thing about it, and, being English, despair of why such an advanced country as France doesn't have the same standards we insist on in hotels in the UK. I only book Paris hotels if there are smoke detectors, which rules a lot of them out! And there are mains-wired detectors, and alarms, in the public areas - so I felt safe. But there didn't seem to be a smoke detector or alarm in my room. I was disappointed about this - I had read on some website (maybe not the hotel one, but one of the many that carry details about hotels) that there were smoke detectors or alarms in each room. If there was a detector or alarm in my room I could not find it. However, I would stay again - it's well built, and as well as the public areas coverage there was a sturdy fire door to segregate the bit of corridor my room was in from the rest of the corridor, and so I felt entirely safe. (PS I wish reviewers on tripadvisor would comment on this feature - a couple of years ago I stayed in a very positively reviewed Paris Hotel that I thought was a death-trap, with no smoke detectors or alarms - and yet there were dozens of people who'd written how nice the receptionists were! Hotels like this one, that invest in safety, should be acknowledged for this). Good quality flat screen tv with reasonable range of channels. A great view of the Eiffel Tower, shimmering and glittering. On a reasonably busy road but not too bad, and the double (or is it triple?) glazing highly effective. Good plumbing, in fact very good - easy to get the temperature balance right, and a proper shower screen (which you don't always get in Paris). I stay in hotels quite a lot, and this one was unusually clean. There is not even a hint of limescale build-up anywhere in the bathroom, and no dust. You get the impression that someone obsessive about quality is involved in running this hotel. Attention to detail is everywhere. I didn't use it, but there was a laptop with internet access and checking it briefly it seemed to be working okay. Oh, and whilst it's a newspaper I abhor and never buy because it attacks my home city (Liverpool), the English newspaper The Guardian was stocked.
