Nice for those English liberals, public servants and Liverpool-haters out there. Bed comfortable - I prefer a firm mattress and found it ok, not as hard as I like at home, but a good hard hotel firm. If I stay somewehre with a soft mattress I usualy end up sleeping on the floor, but no such problem here. I slept very well. Noise between rooms was a bit of a mystery to me so hard to judge after just one stay of just one night. Generally I think it's very good indeed - for an old building excellent. However, the doors close noisily and someone staying in a room close to me came back late and seemed to open and close the door a lot......the hall lights (movement activated?) may have confused them, I don't know. It woke me up. But no noise of neighbouring bathrooms (which is common in old converstions) or of TVs, which makes me think the sound insulation is good. I think if you are noise-phobic (as I am, as well as being fire-phobic and rudeness-phobic) you will probably get on well with this hotel. What can be improved? The quality of breakfast was acceptable but a bit disappointing for the price (12 euro) despite the lovely staff. Coffee in particular was a let-down - murky and just quite not good enough. I mainly stay in English hotels, where the quality of coffee has come on hugely in recent years, and sadly Paris hotels (this one is not alone) aren't quite there with coffee at the moment. Choice of food very limited. Just not quite good enough for the money. Okay, don't be put off, it's not a deal-breaker, but I think it could be improved. Served in a lovely stone room. The minibar prices are not at all good! 2.50 for a packet of crisps!!!!!!!!!! (chips to Americans). I know all hotels charge a lot for minibars, but with the pound-exchange rate being so bad, it just hurt as I arrived hungry and raided the mini-bar! Lots of little shops nearby, so don't make my mistake! So there are two things that I think might be improved, but obviously everything comes at a price, and the price for the room was excellent, so I won't complain too loudly. At last I have found a hotel in Paris I really like, and feel comfortable and safe in that doesn't cost a fortune! Whoever is repsonsible for all this, well done and thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great with a 4 year old!”
Reviews.Author: lvsCleveland
Reviews.Content: We loved being so close to the Eiffel Tower. We had 2 nights in Paris with our 4 year old son and just wanted to be near a place he'd hopefully remember. The hotel was very comfortable and we had a corner room on the second floor that was a nice size, We had booked a double superior room and made sure that the reception knew we were traveling with a four year old. I was expecting a folding bed in the room but found that there was a port a crib instead (like a long pack-n-play). I was concerned that it would be too small but our son just fit in. Since it was directly in front of the window where you could see the Eiffel Tower, and because he was so tired, he had no trouble sleeping there. Neither did we, the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was terrific and separate toilet were great for our stay. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Our room was not available when we got in around 11am but she told us to return around 12:30 or 1:30. We were able to walk directly to the Eiffel Tower - 10 to 15 minutes - and go directly up. It was fabulous and when we returned the room was ready and we were able to take a nap. Unfortunately, we had a problem with the airport shuttle. It was easy arranging it and finding it. We paid 51 euros for 3 people and gave the driver 60 Euro. While we were taking a nap, reception called and said the shuttle company said we only paid 40 Euro. While they eventually said that they would let it drop, it was not a great experience. Otherwise, the hotel was very nice with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price and Service!”
Reviews.Author: 3fromseattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only two nights and we knew we had to make every moment count. The location was perfect for this. We walked almost everywhere and when we needed to motivate our 9 year old we jumped on the subway (Metro). The room was very comfortable and large for european standards. The staff was welcoming and helpful. We came to Paris via the Eurostar and you can easily jump on the subway from Gard du Nord to the hotel. Again, great location, price and service. We would definitley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieb8
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very, very good. We (sister, daughter and myself) booked a triple, hoping we would be assigned the room with the view of the Eiffel Tower, as others have stated in their reviews, but we were not. Instead we were assigned two connecting rooms. They were very nice, the beds were soooo comfortable. Subway was close. Lucie was great. Asked for help from one of the night front desk men and he didn't seem too interested in helping us find an address. Different man the next night looked at me like I had three heads when I asked him to dispose of a broken suitcase for us. Other than that everything was great. Would definitely stay here again. Restaurant nearby that Lucie recommended, E Vin 7, was excellent. Mentioned that the hotel sent you over and they gave us a free glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: kate026
Reviews.Content: I just completed an 11 night stay at this hotel (business and vacation mixed.) Having been to Paris three times previously, I have decided that nowhere could be better than the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel in the 7th Arr. (neighborhood area). I read a lot of reviews on Trip Advisor and decided this time on the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel--and I didn't go wrong! It is a charming hotel located across from the Ecole Militaire and about a block from Les Invalides in a beautiful area of boulevards, trees, and lovely cafes. Cross the boulevard, and walk directly to the Champs du Mars, the gorgeous park in which sits the Eiffel Tower! Just two blocks from the hotel is the Rue Cler market street (think chocolate, wine, flowers). Julie, the hotel's manager is a dream to work with. She helped me make the reservation directly with the hotel (and didn't get frustrated at all when my travel dates had to change). All of the staff are fluent in English and were most helpful in making reservations, taxi services, and offering directions. As an addicted-to-ice American, I even had that available from the lower-level kitchen! My room was lovely, and large compared to other places I have stayed in Paris. Of course, I was most fortunate to have a room on the 5th floor with a gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower, glittering at night like a diamond pendant hanging from the sky. The hotel has recently undergone a decor change (from most online photos). The subtle tones of ecru, plum, green, and burgundy are most relaxing after a long day of working, walking, and sight seeing. The rooms are cleaned daily and everything in my room and bath was always spotless! Breakfast at the hotel is a bargain, particularly with a large pot of coffee, juice, eggs, and all of the wonderful pastries of Paris. Convenient to the hotel is the metro stop---the easiest and fastest way to get around Paris. From my metro I could travel with no difficulty to the area of the Louvre, Grand Boulevards, the Marais, Latin Quarter, and the outer areas of Paris. If you are going to Paris, make sure not to overlook the Hotel Duquesne. Although listed as a 3 star hotel, I give this darling spot a 5 star rating in every way!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PierreShanghai
Reviews.Content: Having trawled many websites looking for the perfect hotel for our silver wedding anniversary celebrations we happened upon Duquesne Eiffel Paris. We booked a Superior room for 5 nights and had a fantastic stay. Lucie was very helpful and the room was spotless – they were just renovated. We enjoyed the balcony and, an added bonus, the subway station was just near the hotel so travelling in Paris was amazingly. Altogether great accommodation in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Redgarnet
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice boutique hotel. Although our room was very small, it was very comfortable and quiet. Great location for the Eiffel Tower the Metro and bistros. We had one of the best meals from a restaurant called Romantique Cafe located 3 blocks from the hotel and also recommended by the hotel. The breakfast was good (excellent coffee) for 11 euros -sounds expensive, but when you are paying $6 euros for coffee and a small croissant in the brasserie $11 isn't so bad for a full breakfast. The two ladies that serve in the breakfast room were just sweet, and the hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. We will be going back to Paris and hopefully the Duquesne will be available for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “What A View!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJohnsonmidwife
Reviews.Content: ROOM 55 for my 55th Birthday! I contacted the hotel directly & was pleasantly surprised with the quick response to my reservation & later for airport taxi information. LUCY was charming & oh so helpful with our requests for a nice resturant, a taxi to the pier, airport, or how far was this or that. The hotel was recently renovated & is taorable & clean. We had a view of the E Tower not only from the bed, but the small bathtub. Nice little touches like maps, shoe cleaner machine, free internet access & a small bar in lobby which opens in the evening.. The outside tables & chairs were relaxing both day & evening, We walked just about everywhere but Sacred Heart Basillica - far right bank. Quiet safe neighorhood, with a few cafes nearby. E Tower 10-12 minutes, Rodin museum 10 mins, Napoleon's tomb 5 mins, dO'rsay museum 25 mins, Louvre museum 35 mins, Seine River 15 mins to dock where boats leave for tour of the city which is especially beautiful at night. Only needed to use Metro once. Don't miss Monet's WALLS of Water Lilies in the de l'Orangerie museun on the border of the beautiful Tuileries Garden which is in front of the Louvre. Monet's pond, gardens & house (Giverny) is worth the trip.- 50 miles north of Paris. If you can't fit it in -on the right bank is the Marmottan-Claude Monet museum. It has many of Monet's work. The most beautiful stained glass was in Saint Chapelle - not to be missed. We couldn't have found a sweeter hotel in a better spot. Why stay in a big city hotel when this boutique hotel has so much to offer? I searched for hours on the internet for a romantic hotel & we couldn't have been more pleased. The mangement reads these reviews & answers & addresses any problems - that says a lot. We will be telling ANYONE we know going to Paris to book at Hotel Duquesne and to say Hi to LUCY for us! The Johnsons Long Island, New York

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Georgiagirl99
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at your hotel in part due to your excellent staff. Estelle was very helpful as she assisted in booking reservations for dinner and to a local spa (which was fabulous by the way) as well as providing directions when needed...Merci Beaucoup, Estelle! The hotel is in a great location...very safe to return to at night. We enjoyed our stay and would return for another trip to Paris. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Helpful, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: johnriggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for 3 nights in May 2008. Very efficient check-in by helpful, English speaking staff. Found all staff over the duration of our stay to be very friendly and only too willing to assist. Hotel is about 200 metres from Ecole Militaire Metro station with good connections to CDG Airport. As you would expect, the bedrooms are not huge but they are well-appointed and very clean. Free internet access in the lounge and a small bar. Very convenient location, as the name implies it is only 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and 5 from Les Invalides with Napoleon's Tomb. If, like us, you are looking for a comfortable base in a nice area for a few days, I would certainly recommend this hotel. Plenty restaurants within a 5 minute walk and lots of bars. Little or no traffic noise during the night even though we had a room which overlooked the main street. Found Paris to be more expensive than previous visits due to the Euro exchange rate. Still a wonderful place to visit with a multitude of things to see and do. Beware of con artists pretending to have just found a large gold ring beside you and willing to give it to you for a few euros - watched a few of them try this well-rehearsed routine with unsuspecting tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFromTampa
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris was perfect. A big part of this was the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel. This hotel is centrally located and you are able to walk to all the major sites. It is also very close to the metro if you would rather not walk. We asked the front desk to call many taxis, set up our airport transfers, etc.; all with no issues. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony; be sure to look out the window at 1am as the tower sparkles with only it's blinking lights. It's quite a sight!

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY UNORGANIZED”
Reviews.Author: Willneverreturnagain
Reviews.Content: At first we were impressed by the location (quiet avenue, walking distance from the Eiffel Tower) and the fact that the rooms had been recently renovated and everything was super clean. But later the true quality of this hotel was revealed. First, the air conditioning was not working properly, so the 2 rooms we had were a hot as a sauna. The very friendly but absolutely incompetent girl at the desk simply apologized but did not provide any kind of solution. We were basically told to grin and bear it, as it was a holiday in Paris and there was no staff to fix it. Changing rooms was not a possibility either. Later on the day, we asked for an iron, which of course was not available in the room. My husband was sent to a steamy room in the basement and had to iron his shirt himself, as again, there was no staff/laundry service available. The last straw was when, having tickets for the Opera, we asked Reception to book a taxi for us with an hour in advance. The girl said that it was not necessary to book it that early, as 10 minutes was enough. Of course, the taxi she called was over 15 minutes late, so we started to get worried and went out to the street to get one ourselves. Guess what? When we are sitting inside the car, already running late and risking missing the show we had booked months in advance, she ran outside to the street, opened the door, and demanded us to get off the car immediately as "she had already called a taxi for us and we could not cancel it". We replied it was her own fault as she had evidently called it too late, but she was mad and demanded the taxi driver to stop. Just then the other taxi arrived, and we were forced to get in it. By the time we got there, we barely had time to get to our seats a minute before it started. We were so stressed and shocked that the whole evening was ruined. Oh, and did I mention that the transfer she booked for us to pick us from the airport was ALSO 20 minutes late? To sum up, the administration of the hotel is completely unreliable, so if you decide to stay there, be prepared to book all your services independently and deal with the insane girl at the front desk. After the taxi incident she was SO rude that we were actually happy to leave Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Room double booked! Rigid & uncomprimising”
Reviews.Author: Redjewell
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel I was welcomed with information that my room booked double booked. The Duquesne Eiffel had arranged another hotel in the area to take us, the Hotel Splendid, which was OK but not my hotel of choice. The option of staying one night, at the Splendid, and the remainder back at the Duquesne Eiffel or staying at the splendid for the entire stay was offered. I suggested that as compensation for the error made by the Duquesne Eiffel that they pay for the night at the Splendid and that I would then stay for the reaminder of the time with them; A fair and reasonable request (where the Splendid, the Duquesne Eiffel and myself benefit equally) I thought! This suggestion was meet by a unyieldng and, in my oppinion, some what incomprehensible no! Why the Duquesne Eiffel would rather pass my entire custom to the Splendid, a competitor, rather than reimburse me for my inconvenience astounded me. I therefore did not stay at the Duquesne Eiffel! Prefering to stay with the Splendid who were very welcoming. The only compensation offered was free breakfast which, if the Splendid is anything to go by, would be the bare essentials continetal for 11 euros; not what I would call value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Dempsies
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights from the 18th April in an inside double room. We had high expectations based on the other reviews, and I'm glad to say we were in no way disappointed. Professional, attentive and friendly staff in reception who are a credit to the hotel. Room was immaculate, modern and although was on the small side it had everything we needed and more (mini-bar, flat screen tv and a very comfy bed). Great location with only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and a couple of minutes to the Ecole Militaire metro station. Thai restaurant next door was very good and some good pavement bars beside the metro station where we enjoyed several late night bottles of wine. Would recommend this hotel to my friends and would definitely go back. (Would book a superior upgraded room to try and get a view of the Eiffel Tower twinkling at night, although this cannot be guaranteed). Rooms on the top floor have a balcony! Suggestion = some background music in the reception area/bar would be nice to listen to when having a drink. Everything else was PERFECT. P.S (Experienced some rather rude and arrogant staff in other french restaurants - one waiter argued that I wouldn't need a side order of fries with my dinner . I am a big eating tiny woman!! Another refused to let us sit at an unreserved outside table where we could both see the Eiffel Tower because it was a table for 4 people. This was at 11pm and the place was half empty!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: C0unt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Duquesne during our stay in Paris. We originally booked our stay there because of the reviews we read on tripadvisor.com and because it was so close to the sites in the Invalides area. The hotel was very clean and all of the front desk were extremely polite and helpful. The floor our room was on had some renovations but there was nothing in the way and the room we stayed in was beautifully renovated. We had a magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower and even though hotel rooms in Paris are quite small the room we had was quite large. The room had a very comfortable Queen size bed, small desk, spacious closet, mini bar, in room safe and detached bathroom with a full tub/shower. The hotel is quite close to some great restaurants, cafes, many scenic sites including the Eiffel Tower and close to the Metro also. There is breakfast served in the morning for an additional fee but we always ate at a cafe near by. The rates were very reasonable and this is one Hotel I would stay at again!! I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: katandalfie2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated for all central attractions, especially the Eiffell Tower, which we had great views of from Room 54. The rooms are quite small, but well equipped and very clean and well maintained. We had a balcony that ran the length of the room, with two large patio doors, which gave plenty of light. The bathroom was marble, with a great shower. The bed was comfortable. The reception staff were helpful and spoke English very well. We did not use the bar / restaurant, as there were so many other options close by, offering great set menus. The lift is tiny however, but was fine for two people with a suitcase. I would highly recommend paying slightly extra to stay here as the location is perfect, just a 5/10 minute walk to the bottom of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: DrCorona
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor in Paris there are many hotels in different areas to choose from. Tripadvisor proved to be invaluable and we booked the Duquesne for 4 nights after reading all the rewievs. First the location: The hotel is located near the "Ecole Militaire" Metro station with lots of stores and restaurants within a short distance (5min from the famous Rue Cler). The streets felt safe at night so we always used our feet to move around. On the negative side is that the 7er arrondissement is a liitle bit pricey. The hotel: Our room had neewly been refurbished and was well decorated. The beds was comfortable and the cleaning was perfect! We didnt try the mini bar but it had some nice wines at reasonable rates (half bottle Duval-Leroy Champagne 20 euros). I'll attach a photo that was taken 5 minutes after arrival that shows the view from our room if you stick your head out of the windows. The only problem we had was that the morning traffic was pretty loud so we had to keep the windows closed. This was a great overall experience and I will definitely book this hotel on my next visit to Paris! /Joakim C

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleRene21
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews about the Hotel, I contacted them directly and reserved a room with out any problem at all. We arrived in Paris at 10am on the very first day of our Honeymoon, and because I work for a large Hotel Group in San Francisco, I expected to hear the usual 'your room will be ready at check in time...' To our surprise, the room was ready and we were able to check in early and divulge into our first day of sightseeing in the most romantic city in the world! The front desk staff were polite and courteous throughout our entire stay. Even when we reported little problems we were having in the room. Nothing that was terribly upsetting, the T.V. froze on one channel on our second night and no matter how many times we turned it off and back on it stayed frozen...no need for T.V. anyway, we were in PARIS on our HONEYMOON! Then on the third night the heater stopped working, in our room! Again, no big deal the desk quickly brought up a space heater which was exactly what we needed and offered us complimentary breakfast the next day. We were also very surprised to find that the room was completely different then anything we saw here or on the hotel website. It was 10 times better! With a super modern Paris vibe, the colors were relaxing and sensual and the Hotel all together was the perfect place to begin our European honeymoon. After the two little mishaps, we had during our stay, the desk was nice enough to give us a 6pm check out on our last day, we only asked because our train didn't leave for Italy until 730pm that night. There is not one negative thing to say, the staff was lovely, the room elegantly appointed (make sure to ask for a corner room on the top floor, you get the best view and a little balcony!) and the Hotel breakfast was also a great way to start the day. We will no doubt be back for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: ortonioni
Reviews.Content: Getting a nice hotel in a big European city at a price you can afford can be a problem. The Duquesne (pronounce it Ducain or the taxi drivers wont understand you) was recommended by friends so we knew it would be fine. We were not disappointed and like most of the reviewers here we would highly commend the staff. Yes the rooms are small - that's the compromise. For a similar price in other European cities you would be lucky to get the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms and the peaceful, spacious location. The avenues around the hotel are wide and the streets are populated but not crowded, so you feel safe walking home at night. We didn't bother with breakfast in the hotel as there are nice bakeries, cafes and brasseries nearby and it was fun to check them out each morning - these are all cheaper than the hotel too. We ate some fantastic evening meals in Paris but I'll just mention the best one locally here - Le P'tit Troquet, 28 rue de l'Exposition. It only has about 6 or 7 tables and is like sitting in an antiques shop. At 32 Euros for 3 courses we thought it was great value for such quality. English is spoken and we felt it was a nice discreet French experience. There are livelier places - the hotel recommends No 7 de vins for some reason, but we found their food bland, mostly cold, and more expensive - though the staff were welcoming and friendly. The mini bar back at the Duquesne is good value as these things go. And a nice half bottle of wine rounds the evening off well. Enjoy Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DogsLuvHotels
Reviews.Content: This little organization Duquesne Eiffel is wonderful. This hotel is starting to get alot of customers lately, but we couldnt keep the secret forever. This is the best little hotel in Paris if you want to relax with not alot of people all over, its not downtown, this is near Eiffel in a residential area, real beauty of a spot to be in Paris, so private and quiet, and one of the nixest subway stations is near by. See our nice photos and video of the extraordinary scenic views from this hotel and its beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoKat23
Reviews.Content: There is not one negative thing to report about this hotel, which is not exactly a common experience. The location is excellent - within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and near lovely cafes and shopping. The room was newly updated and beautiful, sparkling clean, everything worked perfectly, and the beds were very comfortable. The room was substantially more spacious than one we paid the same price for in London. The breakfast tasted very good. But what really makes this property shine is the staff. I don't think I've ever encountered an entire staff that is as gracious and helpful as at the Duquesne Eiffel. From the time we checked in until we checked out, and even during the reservation process, we were dazzled by the desk and breakfast room staff. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat if I had the opportunity, and wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel: the perfect base for the perfect holiday.”
Reviews.Author: LizHeaver
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fabulous stay at this lovely hotel. I took my Mum to Paris to celebrate her 80th birthday, and found this gem of a hotel after hours of internet searching. It really did live up to all the best reviews. Although the hotel is being refurbished at the moment, which meant that the corridors were in the process of being decorated, we were fortunate to be in a newly refurbished room, and everything was immaculate. Very tasteful decor,everything spotlessly clean, and comfortable beds and pillows. The room was big enough and had great wardrobe space and an immaculate bathroom with a great shower and boiling hot water. It took us a long time to work out how to open the mini bar but it was fun trying! We were incredibly lucky to get room 55 with twin beds as I had requested - I draw the line at sharing a double with my mum! The views from 55 are really breathtaking - the tower is so much more impressive by night, and Les Invalides is equally stunning. We could even see Sacre Coeurs in the distance! Obviously not all the rooms can offer this view but it's only a 15 minute walk to get to the real thing and it's a lovely walk too. The location of the hotel is fantastic - metro stations close by and easy to walk to Musee Rodin, Les Invalides and of course to the Tower and River. We also walked to the D'Orsay and across to the Place de La Concorde. The staff at this hotel were brilliant. All spoke perfect English and were so helpful, planning metro routes and offering advice. We would recommend the dinner cruise on the Bateau Parisiennes - at 95 euros it wasn't cheap, but we were treated like royaly, the food was delicious and there was more wine than we could drink, along with great music and the breathtaking views of all the sights along the river. It was a spectacular end to our four day break, and my Mum loved every minute. We recommend the Thai restaurant adjacent to the hotel, and the Italian just round the corner. I can't imagine how anyone could be disappointed by this hotel, and although the view is a bonus, it's still worth visiting because of the lovely decor, comfort, friendly staff and fantastic location. Next time I'll be taking my husband and hopefully leaving the kids at home...

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: pcsqueen
Reviews.Content: In May, 2006 we stayed at the hotel while my husband attended a conference at L'Ecole Militaire. When we needed to place to stay during a spur-of-the-moment weekend trip to Paris, I defaulted to this hotel without really considering any other. Coincidentally, we got the same room, #21. While the rooms are indeed small, one must understand that one's in Paris, not Pittsburgh. It's one of the most visited (read: expensive) cities in the world. For the money we spent, I think we received great value. Here's why (and my more general comments apply to both visits): ALL of the staff were friendly, helpful, and thoughtful. The front desk staff, notably Eric, couldn't be nicer or more accommodating. When we arrived early, via the Thalys, he not only got us into an available room, but provided us with coffee, juice, and croissants to "raise our energy level". In the evening, he'd greet us and offer a glass of wine or an espresso. Our room, while small, was quite comfortable. We heard no street noise thru the window, and either no guest was inconsiderate or the rooms' soundproofing is excellent . Yes, as one reviewer mentioned, the room's decor was in need of an update; the hotel owner, however, is in the process of completely renovating the entire hotel. Evidently, the upper floors' rooms have been completed and the lower floors and lobby are next in line. The room and bathroom were very clean, as was the rest of the hotel. Beds were comfortable, even to a man with a bad back and arthritic hip, both of which were aggravated by walking the length and breadth of the city. I cannot comment on the breakfast (other than the snack we were offered). With so many wonderful bakeries, cafes, and markets nearby, why eat in the hotel? Additionally, the neighborhood in which the hotel is located is excellent. It's quiet, safe, and relatively non-touristy. The hotel is a short walk to the Metro, and to some of the most lovely streets, IMHO, in Paris. We've decided that it's become our Paris hotel. Now, I've just gotta get another weekend scheduled!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely holiday”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and then travelled to the Loire Valley for 3 nights and returned here for 6 more nights with 5 rooms booked for 11 of us. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. The location is good - walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Napoleon's Tomb. Anywhere in Paris central should be fine as the metro is excellent with stations everywhere if you don't want to walk (unlike Rome!). This area is fairly quiet but has all the necessary markets, patisseries, etc you need within 2 min walk. The sight of the Eiffel Tower out the window every day was magic. You need to have a room number ending in 5 or 6 (preferably 5 as this is the corner) to see it. Do not have a first floor room as the building is lit up at night and the lights shine into the room, no matter how much you fiddle with the curtains! Other floors didn't seem to have this problem. Rooms ending in 4 or 5 have the toilet separate to the bathroom which was very useful. Breakfast is downstairs in the basement so no natural light or view. We ate at local cafes every morning once we got used to just having a croissant or tartine with coffee. Paul's Patisserie chain is excellent - good value, cheap, nice atmosphere. We found it easier to have a good size lunch in a restaurant and then just bread, ham, cheese and wine in our room most nights. Rooms were very clean. We would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with B&B coziness”
Reviews.Author: luaddicted2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in Paris and really enjoyed it. The location is fantastic. It is in the Invalides area, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees. It's also very close to 2 subway stops that connects you easily to the rest of the city. The staff is friendly and the rooms are cozy and quaint. For a 3-star Paris hotel, it was exceptional compared to other places we have stayed in. The room and bathroom was very new and very clean. The room itself was a comfortable size (again, relative to most Paris hotels we've seen). The breakfast is simple but good (croissants, eggs, yogurt, fruits, meats, and great coffee). It was a great find and we will absolutely go back to it the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Oly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel three times during our 3 week trip in Europe. We just had to keep going back each time we passed through Paris on our way to the next adventure. Each time, the hotel staff was extremely friendly and willing to give us directions, keep our bags, and answer all of our questions. Without a doubt, my wife and I will be staying there during our next trip to Paris. The rooms were soundproofed and were the quietest we stayed in during our whole trip. This hotel is in a great area of Paris. It is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides but does is not in a "touristy" area. It is also only a few blocks to the Metro stop so you can get anywhere in the city. Almost every night we stayed there, my wife and I would get bottle of wine and some cheese from local shops and sit near the Eiffel Tower and enjoy the sunset before walking back to the hotel. On our last two nights, the staff was able to get us into a room that had a view of the Eiffel Tower, so we could go to sleep watching it sparkle. Quiet, friendly, well-located, I absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, clean rooms & good value”
Reviews.Author: Wicklow_Bob
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay with the girlfriend, really enjoyed ourselves. The whole trip was completely hassle free. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull, our room was well spaced and spotless clean and in a good location. We also had a fantastic view of the tower. I can't imagine there's too many three star hotels out there that measure up to this standard - highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Lacey_fi
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no problems with this hotel. We had a standard, small-ish room with a view over the courtyard. Probably not the best room but we paid a promotional internet rate. The bathroom was immaculately clean, with a half decent hair dryer. Bedroom was cosy (nice to come back to after a long day sightseeing in the cold!). Staff also speak excellent English. Five mins walk away is Ecole Militaire alongside Shopi, Poste and Rue san Cler. On your way you can see the Eiffel tower, Napoleons tomb and Ecole militaire. Its a perfect location! Our first visit to Paris, we ummed and arred about buying a 2 day Paris pass before we went but ended up buying a museum pass from the hotel & the metro is much cheaper than London, I think we may have saved a fair bit of money this way.. For budding art critics and posh shoppers I'd recommend Madelaine - There is a Soutine exhibition there until March 08 and Fauchon (expensive foodie shop). If/ when I go again, I'd give the Pantheon a miss but the views from Sacre Cour & Notre Dame cannot be missed, if u can handle all those steps! Overall, we loved Paris in winter even though it was freezing, even more so because we could come back to a comfortable hotel & relax.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: hollyflorida40
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. we are planning on coming back in july. I cant wait to get there. The staff here is amazing. I had a sprainded ankle and they went out of their way to make me comfortable. julie was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pollyanna_7
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel for 3 nights in November. We had a wonderful trip. We arrived at 10pm in the middle of a massive downpour. The receptionist was joking with us and it lightened our moods. He made a reservation for us at a lovely little Italian restaurant a 5 minute walk away, and we were very happy with this, as we would never have found it on our own. The hotel was kept very clean at all times and the decor is lovely, but I believe they are currently redecorating. We stayed in a twin room called "Madeleine"; the rooms all seem to be named after areas of Paris. It was a small but perfectly adequate room, the beds were very narrow but I enjoyed a perfect sleep every night. The bathroom was perfect, there was a separate toilet, which was good when there are 2 staying in the room, however a wash hand basin in the toilet room would have been useful. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from the room, which was fabulous, especially when it sparkles for 10 minutes every hour on the hour. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, but enjoyed it along our way out every morning and there were many lovely places to choose from. The drinks in the mini bar were cheap compared to most hotels I have stayed in and compared to the prices in cafes and restaurants around the city. The metro station at Ecole Militaire is very close by, but we found the hotel was very well located for exploring on foot. The Eiffel Tower is very near by and from there, many other sights are within easy walking distance. We even walked back from the Latin quarter late one night and we felt very safe. I would recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in the best part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: BethanyAndBeau
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, staff, location, view, decor, comfort.... Loved everything about this hotel! The staff was wonderful, they upgraded us from a standard to a delux because they wanted us to have a bigger room for our baby to have her own crib... so we ended up getting a spectacular view with a balcony on the 5th floor! We loved the ammenities and the comfortable bed and the great bathroom too. The breakfast for 12 Euros was supurb! The breakfast buffet had everything you could want, great quality too. My husband needed to check his e-mails at the lobby computer and the gentleman at the front desk was very helpful he even gave my husband extra time to check his emails. The best part about the hotel was it's view and location! The Eiffel Tour was an easy 5-10 minute walk away. This was our favorite area in Paris, the shopping nearby was amazing and the cafes were great too. Stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bananapancakes1602
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for a wedding anniversary long weekend. Having realised the transport strike was in full swing we thought this might put a downer on our trip but it wasn't a problem at all. We got the bus from CDG airport to the Arc de Triumph (13 euros each) and with a half decent map we walked the rest of the way which took about 25mins and was very easy. On arrival at the hotel we were given our key to room 46, a superior room, and some local information, mini bar pricelist etc. The room was pleasantly decorated in lemon and blue with french windows that opened inward to reveal a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was spotles with a 3/4 bath and great shower. Good hairdryer too which is quite unusual for hotels. There was also a french window in the bathroom too. The double bed was very comfortable and the heating was very good too, which was a god send because on the sat and sun the weather was very very cold. There were some markings on the wallpaper particularly where the cases would go but overall the room was very clean and tidy and not too small either. Beer in Paris is very expensive. Bottles are 25cl and in the bars cost around £3.50gbp and around double for 50cl. Heineken seems to be the popular brand. The prices in the hotel mini bar were probably as cheap as u would find, 25cl bottle of Heineken being around £2 a bottle. We didnt eat breakfast in the hotel, We did try the breakfast at the Ecole Militere brasserie down the street which consisted of orange juice, large coffee, french bread and either fried egg with cold ham or scrambled eggs. The cost was around 8 euros. There are lots of cafes and restaurants around the area. We ate at the champ de mars which was very good. There is a great hot food stall, next to the carousel by the Eiffel tower. The hot dogs and fries are delicious. Paris is very easy to get around. All the streets are well signposted and you can literally walk anywhere, weather permitting. The ecole militere metro is a couple of minutes walk down the road if you want to take the tube. All in all we had a lovely time. Paris is a lovely city with lots to offer, and the staff at the hotel Duquesne Eiffel are very helpful and friendly, and for a 3* property, pre refurbishment, i rate it highly. I will definately be returning to both Paris and the Duquesne Eiffel as soon as i can

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kebpitt7
Reviews.Content: After having read the reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked a 4-night stay at Hotel Duquesne. There are certainly positives to the hotel: friendly staff, clean bathrooms, fantastic view (from our room - 55, I believe), quiet rooms However, the room was certainly quite "worn". Uncomfortable bed, old bedding (with a small holes in the sheets), torn wallpaper, stained carpeting, etc. It is good to read that they will be upgrading the rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb
Reviews.Content: Easy to find hotel near to metro stop. Staff are friendly and helpful and speak good English. Big, comfy sofas in reception/bar area with selection of newspapers. Had a room looking over local rooftops which was quiet and the bathroom had its own exterior window making a pleasant change. Tried some local cafes for breakfast but actually found the hotel one better - wider choice of food for a reasonable price. Only down side was the room was adjacent to the lift shaft and there were associated creaking noises every time the lift was in use.

Reviews.Title: “hotel okay...great location”
Reviews.Author: vagabond1972
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to Metro (École Militaire), grocery store (Supermarché) and post office. A fantastic café/boulanger down the street (Ronde du Pains), the Eiffel Tower about a 5-10 minute walk. The rooms are cozy and charming, but very tight for a group of 3 adults. Didn't get the room I had requested/booked months in advance - but no big deal, that's understandable. When you are in Paris you will want to be out and about, not in a hotel room. It is very lovely city to explore (felt very safe and comfortable being a female traveling solo for the first week before meeting up w/ friends). It is very convenient and easy to get around the city. The shuttle service/airport transfer provided by the hotel was great. I would advise to eat elsewhere for breakfast...11€ per person at the hotel; it is much cheaper and better at the local café nearby. A must visit for breakfast is Le Deux Magots in the Saint-Germain-des-Prés district. Since this was my first visit to Paris, I will probably choose a different hotel next time...there are so many areas I would like to explore. The staff was very accommodating in allowing us to store our excess luggages while we visited Italy for 6 days before returning to Duquesne for an additional 2 nights, that was appreciated. As with most hotels in Europe, the elevators/lifts are extremely small - keep baggage to a minimum ;) I rated this as such only because of some minor hiccups, but none worth mentioning about :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbarne1
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the hotel staff was great! Helpful and speaks english. Upon arrival to the hotel, the shuttle service that the hotel uses dropped me and my guest off a half a mile from the hotel due to a demostration. Two women with LOTS of luggage and not knowing where they are going was put out of the shuttle van and charged full fare. after a twenty minute walk to the hotel, I had explained to the front desk clerk what had happend. She quickly offered her apology and gave us breakfast each day of our stay. We get to the room and there was only one bed. We had requested two beds, so I thought. My mistake and again the front desk clerk corrected the situation. The hotel is located 1 block from Napolean tomb and the L'Opera tour bus, two blocks from the market and cafe's, shops and metro stop. Safe area at night and quiet. The rooms are very clean with a mini bar in the room that you can use to store food. They will not charge you for the use of the fridge. DO NOT USE YELLOW SHUTTLE SERVICE! Awful customer service. Pay the cost and take a taxi. EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE AT DUQUESNE HOTEL. I will be back to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming and romantic”
Reviews.Author: tactravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel hotel over Valentine's day 2007 in Paris. The staff was friendly and warm (except that she laughed at me when she was making a dinner reservation for us and I asked her to ask for a table by the window so we could see the Eiffel Tower). The room is small (remember you're in Europe), but it was enough space for my husband and I to cuddle in on a cold rainy week in romantic Paris! There are some good reveiws on here about what room to stay in to have an Eiffel Tower view. We tried to get the corner room on the top floor (floor 5), but it was booked, so we stayed in the room next door. The view was good - you had to step out on the balcony to enjoy it - you couldn't see it from the bed, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway, so it worked out great for us! I'm sure there are other hotels with bigger rooms and a better veiw, but for a romantic view on a budget - this is well worth it. I wouldn't recommend taking the airport taxi bus that they advertise there - my husband and I (with both strong stomachs) were SO car sick. We waited and waited - they were about 45 minutes late, and then had to pick up other guests at other hotels, and waited SO long (waited in the hot stuffy bus for about another 45 minutes) and then by the time we got to the airport, we were so sick we couldn't even think about getting on a plane for 9 hours! I think it would have been much better to drag the luggage to the metro and do it that way - that's the way we got from the airport to the hotel, so it's not too bad. You must eat at Cafe Panis! It's right across the bridge from Notre Dame and the decor is warm, and the staff is excellent! We loved it so much we went back a second time. The food is more reasonably priced and so very tasty. I would definitely recommend Paris at this time of year. You won't see the trees blooming or lots of flowers everywhere, but there is still some pretty green grass and the emaculate architecture is the same no matter what the season! Plus, like I said - the cold and drizzle allow you to snuggle up to your honey and it makes it all that more romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and staff”
Reviews.Author: rett139
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 11 staying at the Duquesne for three nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and while the rooms are small, hey... it's an old building and if we had wanted spacious, cheap hotel rooms we would have gone to Vegas. Mostly the area was superb, really close to all services, restaurants, metro. We could see the Eiffel tower out the window of the room, easy strolling distance. A great buffet breakfast in the basement which had been saved from a "cave like" feeling by good lighting and recent upgrades. If you are going to Paris to see Paris, rather than vegetate in a hotel room, the Duquesne is a great choice and reasonably priced. We also stayed one night at the HOtel Splendid, just down the block since we got in a day earlier than expected. The Duquesne staff were nice enough to get us the reservation. The Splendid is not really very splendid... smaller and more tired rooms, needs an update like the Duquesene.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: srbmpna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duqesne Eiffel for 4 nights-August 30-Sept 3. The hotel is very cute, with a nice outdoor seating area where you can enjoy a drink at the end of a hard day of sighseeing. I am very surprised to hear that other guests found the staff rude--if anything, we found that they went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. One night, I asked the night manager for a couple plastic cups so my husband and I could enjoy a bottle of champagne. He shook his head and disappeared--only to return with champagne flutes and an ice bucket. That's service! The rooms are small, but you're staying in Paris--a major city crammed with centuries-old buildings--there's not a lot of space. The Duquesne is within walking distance of the Tour Eiffel, which is why we chose to stay there. We took many nighttime walks to watch the tower glow and flicker. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: angelika67
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were in Paris the end of September for a week. We were really disappointed with the accomodations for what we paid. Our room was teeny tiny & the tv only worked occasionaly. (not that that is really important but its nice to be able to wind down at the end of the day) The hotel staff was anything but helpful. Everytime we asked them a question, we only got shoulder shrugs. We ran into a few other couples who had even bigger issues than what we experienced. Bottom line, I would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel; Great Staff & Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseNewell
Reviews.Content: Anything I say about this hotel does not do it justice! We went to paris for part of our European honeymoon and chose the Duquesne hotel based on the reviews from tripadvisor! We booked from September 4th to 9th! Since they knew it was our honeymoon they gave us the best room in the hotel! What a view! Full view of la tour Eiffel; Les Invalides and Sacre-Coeur! Honestly we were left speechless! I could honestly say it is everything I thought Paris would be and more! We did not stay for breakfast at the hotel, but we saw the restaurant in the lower level and it was so pretty! Like a wine cellar! We found the staff to be amazing! So helpful and always willing to offer their advice! Thank you to all the staff at Duquesne for making it a wonderful experience! We will see you again hopefully on our one year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Speero
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the hotel, and had no problem at all. We had a reasonably early check in being late morning, and the room was ready. We were on the 5th floor and had a view of the Eiffel Tower which was great. The rooms are small, anc probably a little tired looking, but it was fine, but you are not in Paris for the room, but for the tourism, and the hotel is in a great place for that. very central to everything, and with a number of cafe's within a stones throw. Booked an evening dinner cruise through the hotel, and we couldn't have been any happier with it, absolutely fantastic. Had no problem with the staff, they all seemed freindly enough to me. If i had one gripe, i think that the rooms are over priced, but that's just me!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: emstar3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July - it was one of the nominated hotels for a conference I attended nearby. Great choice! I had a back room which was nicely decorated with good furniture and in good condition. The staff were endlessly patient, charming and extremely helpful. I witnessed a couple of encounters with demanding guests which were handled with aplomb and courtesy [I would've been showing them the door after 10 minutes, but the lovely receptionist kept her cool]. I had moved to the Duquesne from a more expensive hotel in the Marais and thought the Duquesne was better value. Other reviews are right - the area is elegant with plenty of cafes, restaurants and food shops close by. It offered a calmer contrast to the Marais, but both areas had a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (aka "Hotel Duquesne")”
Reviews.Author: tralala4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel for four nights in September, 2007. Our room was adorable -- small (as most European hotel rooms are), and very tidy. We had hoped for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, and even though all rooms with this view had been booked solid for weeks, the staff managed to squeeze us in when someone else canceled. Our room had a spectacular view, encompassing the Tower as well as Basilique du Sacre Couer (and the Ecole Militaire, naturally, since the hotel is so close to this building). The (Ecole Militaire) Metro stop was two blocks away, and conveniently goes directly (no transfers) to stops near shopping at major department stores (les grand magasins) such as Printemps and Galleries Lafayette, as well as the Pont Neuf and the Louvre. The 7e neighborhood (where the hotel is based) is full of character as well as great sites to visit within easy walking distance (including parks, the Musée Rodin, Musée de l'Armée, Napoleon's Tomb -- and the Eiffel Tower, of course). The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly! We really appreciated the room w/ view, as well as Metro directions, airport shuttle information, and all-around helpfulness. We did not eat the hotel breakfast, but chose to go to the local grocery store, butcher and bakers for food to stock up in our room's mini-fridge, which was quite cold (most hotel room fridges are inadequately cold to really keep food in). Restaurants in the area are pricey (cafes, too) -- even for Paris -- and I recommend saving some money and exploring the neighborhood by doing local shopping instead of eating out every meal. On a side note, it was truly unfortunate that the hotel was filled with obnoxious tourists. We ended our Western Europe vacation in Paris, and we certainly saw ignorant travelers from every culture (not just the stereotypical "ugly Americans"). However, the folks staying at this hotel tried our patience, even in passing in the halls. For example, one woman barged into a conversation I was having with the front desk person, inquiring loudly for a "map in English." The staff person politely did not appear shocked at this ridiculous request, and provided a map from a wall display while explaining that they had maps, but the street names and monuments would be in French, not English. The woman completely missed how her request had been asinine, and continued to say in a condescending tone, "Well, then I guess I'll have to learn to speak FRENCH then, now won't I?" Well, yes, a passing attempt at conversational French would be nice when you visit France. So would some basic knowledge about travel, like the fact that maps do not translate street names from the original language into other languages to suit you. How would you find "Pont Neuf", if it were called "New Bridge" on the map??? Other than our fellow tourists, the hotel itself was delightful. Great location, clean room, helpful staff. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: galtravelers
Reviews.Content: All of the teriffic reviews are right on - Duquesne Eiffel is the perfect spot to stay. We had a simply gorgeous view, even from the bed! I would recommend this hotel to everyone and am trying to figure out a way to get back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about Duquesne Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: jklee92
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the staff. We just got back from our trip. We found this hotel on tripadvisor.com, and the experience was great. Amandine, Julie and Estelle (and their other team mates) were very helpful (and are still being helpful even though we have already checked out.. more on that later) As this was a wedding anniversary trip, we were very happy to stay at the Duquesne Eiffel.. we stayed in 2 different rooms, #54 and #35 and the view was super.. My birthday was on 8/31, and we were given #35, with the fabulous view of the sparkling eiffel tower, for our last night in Paris. What a super birthday present and way to end our trip to Europe! How many people can really say they had a view of the Eiffel tower? From my first email to our departure, the team at Duquesne Eiffel were very helpful, and thankfully communicated in English very easily (all I had was some junior high school french to rely on!) We stayed a total of 4 nights, and checked out to travel to Belgium for a few days in the middle of the week, and we were able to leave some of our luggage at the hotel, which helped us immensely to be able to travel easier on the trains to Brussels and Brugge, and back to Paris. The location of the hotel is by far the best, in terms of convenience to the metro stop (L'Ecole Militaire), Rue Cler, the Supermarche, as well as the Eiffel tower and museums like the Rodin, Musee D'Orsay and Invalides Militaire (Napoleon's tomb). The neighborhood was very safe as well and there were never any concerns about safety, even late at night. The rooms were very clean and neat. Thank you to the cleaning staff! Amandine also helped us book the "Eiffel tower dinner/cruise on the Seine/show at the Lido" which was the perfect combination of things to do while in Paris (not to mention a perfect birthday celebration!). That package encompassed 3 of the many things we wanted to do while in Paris. And I can't forget to mention that the hotel also helped by booking the YELLOW van to pick us up at CDG to bring us to the hotel. We received very clear directions on what we needed to do, once we landed in Paris, to ensure we met the driver (needed to pick up any phone and dial the toll free number BEFORE we went to baggage claim.. The man on the other end spoke english, who then told us what door to meet him at). I had been nervous about this procedure, as I couldn't understand how we would be able to make a call, without putting in any coins or using a telephone card, but it worked very easily. Last but not least, Estelle has been helping us contact Thalys, the high speed train to/from Brussels, to see if they found a print of Brugge we inadvertently left behind on the train, when we arrived back in Paris. Thalys hasn't been very responsive to her messages yet, but we are very appreciative of her efforts on our behalf. We are hoping for the best. We gave her our email address as we were checking out the following morning to head back to the States and she said she was going to keep trying to see if she can get some answers for us. This just shows us that the staff at Duquesne Eiffel are truly customer service - oriented. We highly recommend this hotel because of its location, and staff and cannot wait to stay again when we are visiting Paris (and hopefully it is sooner than a 20th wedding anniversary!) Thank you, thank you, thank you...

Reviews.Title: “what more could we ask for?”
Reviews.Author: emlouw
Reviews.Content: After trying to book this hotel through a travel website, we decided to do it independantly. After reading these reviews I decided to e mail the hotel direct, and they could not have been more helpful, I asked for a room with balcony and view, although they had no balcony rooms, wow did we get the view (see pics). Although the rooms are small and bijou they are clean, and the bathroom is lovely, very tiny but with bath, shower & loo, what more do you want. To lie in the bath with glass of champagne, looking out of french windows directly at the Eiffel tower is heaven! Mini bar prices very reasonable with good selection. Satellite TV was limited though - CNN or MTV, would be nice to have BBC news and maybe Sky 1 & Cartoon Network if you have kids travelling with you. We did not breakfast in the hotel, as we preferred to try the french pastries on the numerous cafes terraces nearby, but the breakfast room looked lovely. Lift access to all floors. The staff were good, they booked us a lovely dinner cruise which was wonderful, go with the hotels choice as it was the cheapest and we had a wonderful 3 course meal, but go for the 50 Euro option not the 69 euros with drinks included, as the drinks were 1 cocktail, 1 water and 1 coffee. We had 3 cocktails each for the difference in price structure. The hotel is in a lovely district, a short stroll from bars and restaurants & supermarkets. Very close to the military museum. Lovely street market a few blocks from hotel on a Sunday. The Ecole Militaire metro is 5 minutes walk and takes you all over Paris. I would advise anyone going for longer than a few days to get the Paris Pass online well before you go, we did this and it saved us a fortune, gives you access to 60 museums and attractions, a metro ticket for the duration of your stay and allows you to queue jump! A word of warning, if you hate crowds & are visiting Palace of Versailles, go early, it is heaving with tourists all being herded like cattle around the rooms! Also to get the best view of Paris, do the Tour Montparnesse, 38 seconds in the lift, takes you 56 floors to a bar and 360 degree panoramic views. Much less crowded than Eiffel with the bonus of watching the Eiffel's light show after dark on the hour. wait til after 10 pm though to miss crowds and see paris by night. For the very brave, walk the extra floor to the terrace and have an open air view! So, fab hotel, great staff, lovely room. Remember space is of a premium in Parisien hotels, so nowhere will be huge unless the cost is as huge as the rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel for value, area and views. We will be returning for sure, we had a wonderful romantic 5 day break and we have so much more to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel---- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Clint247
Reviews.Content: Great Little Hotel... Went on our honeymoon.... Highly recommeded.... Right by metro, cafes and food stores.... Would definately stay again.....Also what a view of the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: ian_hook
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a short break to celebrate our 25th anniversary and what a great hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and all spoke great English, Little welcome pack with local restaurants and Parisian sites was very good. Room was relatively small but clean and airy. Best of all we were lucky enough to get a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower - what a bonus! If your trip is, like ours, a celebration then I cannot recommend the Seine Dinner Cruise enough. We paid out (a lot!) for the Premier Service but it was a really wonderful evening. Tips Hotel bar and mini-bar prices were a LOT cheaper than local bars and restaurants. If touring Paris by Metro be prepared to walk a lot - not many escalators and lots of steps and tunnels. Also, I wouldn't recommend the RER & Metro as a good way to get to your hotel from CDG unless you are travelling very light. If you book an airport transfer or similar make sure you book the time using the 24 hour clock - then your 5:45 pm pick up won't arrive at 5:45 am and provide an unexpected early wake up call!! Don't go to the Palais de Versailles on a Monday - it's closed! But if you do go make sure you take in the Domain du Marie-Antoinette - beautiful. And don't be afraid to hop on the 'Petit Train'. Those gardens are big! Finally, check how many Metro & RER trips you are going to make and where you are going to go. You need quite a few trips to make it worthwhile (although it's very convenient) and ensure that the regions covered are sufficient for your journey - it's a pain having to get of a train to buy another ticket for the last leg of your journey. Obvious but worth noting - you'll get the best out of Parisiennes if you at least try and speak a little French - most you'll come into contact with will speak English (except train station employees) but all seem to appreciate an attempt at thier native tongue. Plus it's the polite thing to do anyway! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Parisian hotel...look no further.”
Reviews.Author: born2travel3
Reviews.Content: We planned our stay for 5 nights at the Hotel Duquesne with the Tour de France in mind...so we made sure that we booked early. After reading the amazing reviews on Trip Advisor we made sure that we requested room 45...a triple room (perfect for our 2 adults and 1 child) with a stunning and surreal view of la Tour Eiffel. When we arrived at the hotel and checked in...we were not in the least disappointed. Everything about the hotel is cheery and very Parisian. The wonderful front desk staff were beyond friendly and extremely helpful with all of our questions. The hotel offers breakfast at 11EUR per person...which some stated was quite steep...but we ate at the hotel every morning in their lovely cave-like breakfast room and found the breakfast to be very filling and kept us going until dinner with just a snack in between. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. We walked to le Tour Eiffel everyday in approx 10 - 15 min...as well as walked to the Champs Elysees in approx 30 min...and the walk is breathtaking. There are plenty of restaurants and Brasserie's in the area, all with street-side terraces that made for an amazing evening of food, wine and people watching. We would highly recommend the Duquesne Hotel and we look forward to staying with them again...hopefully sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: latkins593
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Duquesne and I would return the next time as well. Perfect location, wonderful staff, everything one would wish for in a small Paris hotel. Estelle and Julie were as delightful as ever, and it was a great week in Paris. I would advise anyone looking for a small hotel with a wonderful Paris location, try the Duquesne. It was terrific!!

Reviews.Title: “July Visit to Duquesne Eiffel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex856
Reviews.Content: WOW! A terrific hotel. We selected this hotel through trip Adviser and everything was as expected. Excellent hotel staff (Estelle & Judi) helped us find restaurants and hooked us up with metro weekly passes. Location is spectacular. Owned and operated by French personnel, this hotel is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Little Place”
Reviews.Author: SolidFred
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfortable, warm 3 star hotel near Ecole Militiare and Rue Cler. Easy to get to - just a block and a half from a metro stop. But far away enough from the busy streets to be relaxed and quiet. Older building with a small lobby with sofa's and a small bar. Old style spiraling staircase and very small elevator. Front desk staff speaks multiple languages and were fairly knowledgeable. Rooms small, but not claustrophobic. Warm colors, my wife and I were in a room with yellows and blues; our sons with reds and yellows. Closets quite small. Bathrooms nice - modern fixtures and hair blower. Windows kept out the street noise and mattresses comfortable. Breakfast buffet in basement worth the price - 11 euro I think. Coffee, eggs, bread, cheese, yogurt, cereal, etc. Neighborhood close to Eiffel Tower. Rue Cler blocks have fabulous shops - bread, cheese, and pastry shops plus several cafes. Larger corner cafes have the street scene. Nearby small restaurants - wonderful. No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cnbSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Duquesne in May and booked about 7 months prior. We booked our Superior room knowing that receiving a view of the Eiffel Tower depended on availability. I believe the hotel's website states this and the online company I booked through mentioned the Superior Room has a view of Invalides OR the Eiffel Tower. I'm not sure why a lot of reviewers are complaining about not receiving views of the Eiffel Tower when there was no guarantee. I was lucky and did receive a view of the Eiffel Tower. If I stood at the very left part of my balcony I had a fabulous full view. The hotel was fine and what I expected in an old French building... tiny rooms and a tiny elevator (the two of us barely fit with 2 suitecase.) Everything was clean and the hotel was quite. The locations is nice, near 2 metro stops. The staff was pleasant and spoke English very well.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: tribblet
Reviews.Content: Due to a required flight change, my husband and I squeezed in a night in Paris on the way back to Atlanta from a cruise in the Mediterranean. We wondered if it was worth the trouble, since we didn't get in until late afternoon, and the weather was closing in. We took the Air France shuttle to the Gare Montparnasse, and rolled our luggage mostly downhill the mile or so to the Hotel Duquesne Eiffel. The shuttle gave us a wonderful view of the city, and passed some spectacular sights we would not have seen otherwise. We chose the hotel based on the reviews on this website. We were warmly greeted at the hotel and given Room 51, a "superior" room, as we had requested, with a view from the balcony of the Eiffel Tower. As stated by many, the European rooms are a bit smaller than standard U.S. rooms, and this one was no exception. The room was nicely appointed, clean and had a modern and roomy bath. The view from the balcony was wonderful. Although we were ready to collapse, we rallied and walked all the way around the Louvre complex , then returned along the Seine back to visit the Eiffel Tower. By then it was 9:30 and we were amazed that the sun still had not set! We were getting chilly, so we started heading back toward the hotel across the Parc du Champs-de-Mars where we could look back and see the lights come on the ET. We passed the Ecole Militaire and dined at one of the restaurants recommended by travelers on this site: Le Terrasse. Although it was too cool to sit outside, we did plenty of people watching, with a Metro stop directly in front of the restaurant and lots of people on the streets and in the restaurant. Our waiter was wonderful, bringing us glasses of kir and snacks while we perused the menu. He gave us very lively appraisals of some of the items on the menu! The French onion soup was excellent. Although it was 11:30 on a Thursday night, we felt very safe walking back to the hotel, because the streets were as busy as they are at lunch time in the U.S.! In the morning we raced out to soak up some more atmosphere, enjoying a croissant and cafe at a small corner restaurant. The helpful staff ordered a taxi to take us to the airport and we were off -- with fond memories and an eagerness to return to the Hotel Duquesne soon for a more leisurely taste of Paris! It was a highlight of our two-week trip! The location of this hotel is ideal for anyone who enjoys exploring the city on foot -- it is central to many amazing places and the price is a real bargain! (Next time we probably won't request the Eiffel Tower view since you can only stand on the balcony admiring it or taking pictures for so long! Besides, you can walk to it in less than 15 minutes. )

Reviews.Title: “Minor Grievances”
Reviews.Author: Paints
Reviews.Content: My dream was to visit Paris. For my honeymoon, my husband and I decided to go to Paris for 5 nights and Greece for two weeks. I decided to start my search for a hotel through Trip advisory. Even though this hotel was only a 3 star hotel, we decided that the reviews were too great to pass it up. I definitely wanted a superior room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. My french is not the greatest so a asked a dear friend who is Parisian to call the hotel and find out how we can be guaranteed a room with a view from the bedroom. She called and we followed their instructions when booking our hotel. The reception assured us if we asked for a certain room in our booking, it would be given to us because we were booking 8 months in advance. Even after the hotel was booked, our friend called the hotel to confirm we received a room with a view. You can imagine our surprise when we did not receive this room. When we went down to the front desk their answer was that we must have misunderstood them when we booked and a room with a view is not guaranteed. I don’t understand how one Parisian cannot understand another, there is no language barrier. Other than the view, the room was o.k. and the area was great. Most of the staff was helpful, yet if you have a complaint, do not expect much, there is a complete attitude change. I would recommend this hotel if it is just a family visiting Paris, but if it is a romantic getaway I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: tarebearky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June. We were celebrating our first anniversary! We booked a comfort room on a website, and we emailed the hotel to tell them about our special occasion and to ask for a room with a view. NOTE: If you want a room with a view, I would highly recommend that you call or email in advance to ask for it! They responded to our email and said that all the rooms with views were booked, but if they had any cancellations, they'd put us in one of those rooms. When we arrived, the woman at the front desk knew our name and told us that she had moved us into a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower! What a nice surprise! Even if you don't have a view, the location of this hotel is perfect. A 10-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, a 5-minute walk to Invalides, and a 5-minute walk to the subway stop. There are many restaurants and cafes nearby, with a wide range of prices and cuisine. The staff at the hotel was great. They were helpful with directions, offered to book tickets for us, and many other things (like giving us glasses with ice for the soft drinks we bought at the store!). They even had converters for us to borrow for the duration of our stay! Everyone we met was very friendly and tried to help make our stay pleasant. The room was a bit small by American standards, but a good size by European standards. The bathroom was the same. Everything was very nice and clean, which was our main concern. The air conditioner in the room was wonderful! One thing to note - the walls are a bit thin and you can sometimes hear people in the other rooms and in the hallway... mainly just when people were being loud, but something to be aware of. It never caused us any problems though. Overall, we were quite pleased with our choice of this hotel. It met or exceeded all of our expectations. We had a lovely stay in Paris and a wonderful anniversary. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: fromflorida7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily for the location and the reviews in tripadvisor! We were not disappointed. Location was just a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and in our room 35, we had a great view of the tower. Room was nice and clean, a little small and the beds were harder than we were used to, but otherwise fine. The hotel personnel were outstanding -- thanks to Julie we finally got our luggage from Air France after 4 days! Only downsides were the pricey breakfast (11 euros), but we could easily get stuff from a nearby bakery; and no free internet. Great nearby eateries and a fabulous "Super-Marche" nearby. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Duquesne not as perfect as people say. Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Error_Repair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duquesne from May 29- June 1st. Hotel is close to everything. Excellent shops and cafes near by. Staff are helpful and speak perfect english. We booked a superior room ( 54 ). Strong smell of cigs in the room and it makes made extremely ill.Room was small but that didnt matter to us. Walls are paper thin. A/C didnt work for us. My wife complained about the coils in the bed sticking her in the back. I am not sure if I would visit this hotel again. Alot of nice hotels in the same neighborhood. Breakfast was good but expensive (11 euros per person ). Head to a cafe in the neighborhood. Internet is available in the lobby for 9 euros per hour. Pros: Location is perfect, area, close to everything,and staff Cons:Price,small rooms,odour in the room, I picked this hotel for 2 reasons location and the fact that Hotel management checks and responds to feedback provided on tripadvisor. Comments: book room 55. On the corner and great view of Eiffel tower, Eiffel Tower is about 20-25 min walk. Metro

Reviews.Title: “It was all a bunch of lies. Superior does NOT mean a guranteed view!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia82
Reviews.Content: If you're picking this hotel, because you want to see the tower out your window, DON'T! We were so excited about staying at this hotel based on the reviews. We'd seen the candid visitor photos where you can see the eiffel tower from the window of your room. IF you booked a superior room. So, we made sure to book 2 superior rooms, so that my husband and I, as well as grandma and the kids could both have a spectacular view of the tower from our room. We booked months in advance. But apparently, booking early doesn't get you any consideration. Imagine our incredible disappointment when we arrived to find that the room for Grandma and the kids #35 did have a good view of the tower, but the room that they put me and my husband in , #54, did NOT have a view of the tower. When I went downstairs, to ask to be moved to the room that they'd advertised, the clerk slammed things around, and informend me that yes, the room WAS a superior room. I just had to GO OUT ON MY BALCONY, and look way around to the right, and then I could see it. First, if you're at all afraid of heights, there's no way you're going out on that balcony. Second, you can't stay out there, it's far to narrow. The hotel staff was COMLETELY unconcerned that the romantic evening they'd advertised was in fact a lie. In fact, there are only 3 rooms in the hotel with a view of the tower out your window as they advertise, but many more than that with NO view of the tower out your window that they classify as SUPERIOR.
