So, if you think that you're going to get one of the good ones for certain just because you book a superior room, DON'T COUNT ON IT! You're really paying for a CHANCE that you get a room with a real view of the tower. Also, if you do stay at this hotel, the breakfast room is like an oven. I'd eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite quartier and hotel”
Reviews.Author: thais
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel at least 5 times in the past 7-8 years and just enjoy staying there. The location is to my mind, perfect - the Rodin Museum, Ecole Militaire and of course the view of the Eiffel tower. The rooms are very well decorated, if a bit small, the bath tubs are deep and shower strong, and best of all there is air conditioning. What I also like is the location in the proximity of the Rue Cler Market, with all the lovely stalls with fruits, veggies, and meats and the restaurants many of which are patronised by French people. With the Metro stop nearby you can get to anywhere very quickly. There is a bus that you can get near the hotel that goes along Rue St. Dominique and gets you to other areas of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaRB
Reviews.Content: Quiet location but close to metro, Eiffel Tower (great view from my room on 5th floor), Les Invalides and the spectacular Rodin museum and gardens. Fair choice of restaurants, we loved Le Vauban (in Place Vauban) 36 euro for 3 courses, kir, wine and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: iznof3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and we stayed at the Duquesne Eiffel for three nights starting on April 24th. The staff is really friendly and helpful and speak perfect english. The room we had (35) was excellent and had a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. I'd have to say that the best thing about this hotel is the location. The area is really safe both in the day time and late at night. We would defintley stay at this hotel next time we visit paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to enjoy Paris in the spring”
Reviews.Author: CaroleSGlenRidge
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated hotel in a prime location right by the Eiffel, with bars, restaurants and shops all just seconds away. Staff are superb and very helpful, and pour a generous glass of vin blanc - perfect at the end of a busy day sightseeing. Rooms are small but very comfortable and bright with all amenities you need. We only had two days but the location meant we could easily see everything on our hotlist. I would definitely return if staying in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel close to the Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBlue
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this charming hotel in April 2007 and were completely won over by all aspects of its hospitality. First of all, the location is ideal as it is close to the Ecole Militaire Metro (in the 7th arrondisement) with many wonderful cafes nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Les Invalides (Napoleon's tomb) is practically a stone's throw away. The rooms themselves are quite spacious for a Paris hotel as I've stayed in places in Paris before that were slightly bigger than a kitchen drawer. The rooms look as if they've been recently renovated with marble/granite bathroom countertops that are nicely cleaned everyday. There is a good breakfast - I particulary appreciated the fresh fruit - and all the amenities one could expect in a hotel (i.e. soap, lotion, dryer, internet, etc). Above all, however, I must single out the staff who were all exceptional. Muhammed, Amandine, Estelle and the cleaning and wait staff were a delight to deal with and they went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. (How Parisians get their reputation for being snotty, I'll never know, but I'm guessing it has as much to do with the visitor as with the way the French respond to certain attitudes). The cherry on the cake, of course, was the view of the Eiffel Tower from our rom with its glorious shimmering lights at night. I think you have to have a corner room to see it; so, ask for rooms 25, 35 or 45. This is a gem of a place and I wholly recommend it to anyone visiting Paris in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: lilkit5385
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last December (2006) and found it to be a lovely clean hotel that was pretty much central to everything. There was a metro stop just up the road which gave us access to the whole city and a supermarket to buy food and drink. The hotel staff were especially helpful and spoke excellant english which was useful as my french is pretty rusty. Would definitely go to this hotel if i was staying in Paris in the future. Very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ceaki
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Duquesne hotel in March after reading so many reviews. We are so happy with our decision. Although we couldn't get the room 55,56 or 45 and our room 57 was smaller than what everyone say about 55 or 45, we could see the Eiffel Tower from the balcony (you really have to lean to the left though). What we loved was the staff. They're always so kind and helpful. My husband got sick on Saturday night but the staff quickly found the doctor who could speak English and sent us to him. That helped us a lot! The location of the hotel was quite good. I even walked to Orsey Museum which took me about 20min but it was a nice walk. The supermarket near the station was very convenient. We bought some snack, water, cheese etc. We'll stay there again and will request the room 55 or 45 next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: kmaiko
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find a hotel. We really wanted a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. And we got it. We were pleasantly surprised with how clean, friendly and knowledgable the hotel and staff were. The rooms are small by American standards, but if you know this in advance, it's fine. The bathroom was above our expectations. Sparkling clean, with a tub big enough to have a bath in, and a great shower head :) One complaint: the mattress was uncomfortable. I have travelled around Europe and in Paris before, and found this hotel to be a good deal. But do skip the morning breakfast, unless you are desperate for a quick bite. It is not worth the money. Internet in the lobby at a reasonable fee.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous view!”
Reviews.Author: gretchenenders
Reviews.Content: I felt like I could reach right out and grab the Eiffel Tower, it was the first thing I saw in the morning and the last thing twinkling as I fell asleep. The room was small, but almost spacious compared to other European hotel rooms I've stayed in. The staff was so sweet and helpful and housekeeping was quick and thorough. I will sing the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel's name as loud and far as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, cute room”
Reviews.Author: jlhcorley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 55, and had a magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was quite roomy by European standards, and clean as a whistle. The plasma screen TV was also a nice touch. I was quite impressed by this hotel. I wish I had booked it for my return trip to Paris instead of just one night. I highly recommend it as a splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sullivankzs
Reviews.Content: Our photos were taken from room 45. Every night we watched the Eiffel Tower's light show, 10 minutes on the hour. The rooms are very comfortable, plenty of room for 2. The area felt very safe. You'll see real parisiens going about their day- not just tourists rushing to museums and monuments. We ate breakfast at the hotel and found it worthwhile. If you don't have much time in Paris, and there is so much to see, eat a quick breakfast at the hotel. For me, I needed my morning coffee before we set out. If you need to experience a cafe, have coffee, hot chocolate, or a glass of wine later in the afternoon instead. Be sure to eat dinner at Carmine's (and italian restaurant in Paris). It's just beyond the Ecole Militaire metro stop. The food, the prices, the staff - it was all a wonderful experience. Walk to Mus. Rodin - buy your mulit-day museum pass there! It's a smaller museum = short line. You can bypass the huge lines at the Louvre, D'Orsay, most important, Versailles and at least 30 other museums around the city. The desk staff is as friendly as everyone has described in their reviews. Extremely helpful. They made our reservations for a fashion show (Gal. Lafayette on Friday afternoon or Printemps on Sunday and maybe Tuesdays, too). For an amazing shopping experience, walk (15-20 min) to Bon Marche. There's lots of little shops in that area. It feels more authentic than the other 2 giant stores (GL & AP) and the crowds along Blvd. Haussman. The Eiffel T is a 15 min walk. The hotel's location is great b/c you must get there early! It opens at 9:30. We left the hotel at 8:30, and had plenty of time to walk and take photos before we got in line. By 9:30 the line is sooo long. Take a short walk to Rue St. Domanique and Rue Cler to see the shops. From this hotel you can walk to Rue Pont de l'Alma (15-20 min). That's where you ride the Bateau Mouches. The basic ride (without dinner) is 9 euros. We rode at 6:20 (the times may change with the day). You'll get photos of the major buildings with a beautiful sunset. Later, the buildings are all lit up - so beautiful!! The whole ride is about 90 minutes. To return to the CDG airport, the ride at 9:15am was 51 euros and took less than an hour. Ask the desk staff to book it the day before.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent........”
Reviews.Author: lrhodes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best finds of our trip! We booked a "comfort room", which had a great view of the Eiffel Tower. The location was terrific.....we were able to walk everywhere from there. The service was excellent.....all the front desk people were extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were small, which we were expecting, but very clean. The bathroom was a good size . There were a few tiles that could use replacing/regrouting, but was very clean otherwise. We are staying again this year in Sept and bringing relatives, so I can only hope it will still live up to our expectations and the excellent standards from last year.

Reviews.Title: “good clean friendly”
Reviews.Author: d2deb
Reviews.Content: Average size rooms for europe (will seem small for US standard rooms) but clean and comfortable. We had two rooms both were nice. The bathrooms was very clean all new tile; one had a tub/shower, the one a shower. Our rooms didn't have the view, but faced inside and were quite. I found the front desk to be very helpful with suggestions. There are a couple brasseries close by. Only a couple hundred meters to the Ecole metro. Easy walk to the Eiffel tower, Invalides or other sites in area. I have no problem recommending this hotel if you are looking for a place in this area for a couple nights in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willymcbride
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my gf last week and we loved it. We stayed in room 56 and had the greatest view of the Eiffel Tower. Room was very cozy and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom was good size and had all the necessary amenities including a hair dryer which my gf was very relieved to discover. We had no problem checking into our room when we arrived early. Staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: SidSue
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel in October 2006. The weather was very nice during this time. Not too hot and not too cold. The hotel was the first one of three that we stayed at during our trip to France. It was our 10th wedding anniversary so I wanted a romantic hotel with a great location. The Duquesne Eiffel Hotel did not disappoint. When making my reservation I explained this was a special anniversary trip & I would like a room with a nice view of the Eiffel tower. The hotel delivered! The view was breathtaking and I was up late ever night enjoying the light show of the Eiffel Tower from our room. We had room 301. I had booked my reservation directly with the hotel (via email), they were very prompt in their responses and made me feel comfortable that my reservation would be in order when I arrived. The Hotel is close to Napoleon's tomb, The Military Academy, Rue Cler, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower (a 20 minute walk that is very pleasant during the day) and there are many close restaurants and small bakeries. All the restaurants that we went to were very good, and they spoke English if needed. There is even a grocery store about 4 blocks away, so you can stock up on snacks. Don't miss trying the Orange flavored Coke they sell there. The hotel staff was wonderful, everyone working there was polite and helpful. They were great at giving information and helping to make reservations. If you do not know French the staff spoke fluent English. I have often read about hotel rooms in Paris being small. So I was prepared for a small room, but to be honest I did not think this room was too small. It was exactly what I needed. I was in Paris to see Paris, not hang out in a hotel room. So it served our needs well. I think that people who stated the room was too small have never stayed in a hotel in New York City (now those rooms are small !!!!). The bathrooms was a nice size. The room was very clean and the maid service was prompt & complete. We did have breakfast there when we arrived. I found it expensive for what we received. It was nice to have to there on the grounds, but you will find bakeries just a few blocks away for a better price. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers. Some notes about the area & traveling: RUE CLER: If going to the Rue Cler I would go by this schedule: The market is at its best Tue-Sat 8:30-13:00 or 17:00-19:00, Sun 8:30-12:00, dead on Mon. Which I found on this site: http://www.ricksteves.com/plan/destinations/france/ruecler0208.htm. I also had to put my French into high gear when eating at a restaurant on the Rue Cler. The staff did not speak English and I did not know how to ask for my leftovers to go. BATEAUX PARISIENS We went on an evening dinner boat cruise with Bateaux Parisiens. http://www.bateauxparisiens.com/ It was a bit expensive but worth it, the meal was delicious and the atmosphere was lovely. We sat by the boat's side window, I think if you were stuck in the middle of the boat you might not have had such a great view. The tour is priced according to where you sit on the boat. The band played a nice variety of music, so I think all age groups would like something they played. We walked back to the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel after dinner. (A 20 minute walk) I must admit not being too familiar with the area I was a little nervous about the walk back. I would not recommend the walk back for senior citizens, there were also no taxis in that area at night. Perhaps the Bateaux Parisiens would call for a taxi if you ask. We did get to see many teenagers "mooning" the boat as we traveled down the Seine. It must be a ritual. So have your cameras ready ;-) The monuments were lit up and were beautiful to see from the boat. We did dress up for this dinner, but we noticed many people were not too dressed up, it varied. I wish I had known we did not need a suit and dress or I would have been able to pack lighter. They also have a lunch tour. VAN SERVICE: When booking a room at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel we were given the name of a van service that we could reserve to pick us up at the airport and take us to the hotel. I would NOT recommend this service. First when reserving it they tell you to call them as soon as you get off the plane, not to pick up your luggage first. I followed there instructions, and called them upon arrival. The man said hurry up and get outside the van is getting ready to leave. Since we did not get out luggage yet it took a few minutes, then we had to get to the location were he told us to go. This location was not easy to get to. It look us 20 minutes just to get on an elevator to get to the street level. We then found the van, and the driver acted like he didn't know we were coming, he was very rude and ignored us when we asked him questions (and we asked in French). After leaving us stand there for 10 minutes while he talked on the phone he said to get in the van & he would take us, like he was doing us a favor. It was not a very friendly welcome to France. Thankfully the rest of our trip was not like the arrival. TAXI RESERVATION: When leaving the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel we were heading for the train station, so we needed a taxi. Apparently taxis are very hard to get especially during rush hour. I was booking the taxi a day in advance and I was still not sure if I would get one. The woman at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel desk was very helpful at getting me the taxi. So don't wait to the last minute for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: mattina
Reviews.Content: After weeks of looking online for hotels in Paris, I have to say I was rather dishartened. We wanted a good quality, three star hotel in a good location, but most hotels seemed either very expensive (in most cases overpriced, I'm sure) or just poor in quality. Because we were quite late with our booking as well, finding a good one (I was very careful to read reviews on all possible places) seemed pretty much impossible-- that is until my boyfriend stumbled upon Duquesne Eiffel. We both had a good feeling about the place, based on reviews in particular, and we were definitely not disappointed! First of all, the LOCATION IS GREAT. I cannot emphasize this enough. It is close to the Eiffel Tower and a stone's throw away from Napoleon's tomb (hotel des Invalides) right next to the military academy. 5 minutes away is the metro station and along the way a wonderful little bakery and a couple of restaurants. While it is so close to two of the main tourist attractions in Paris, its still a very quiet, nice and safe area. With the metro you can get anywhere in within minutes and even walking to the Louvre is possible! As we arrived we were greeted by a polite young receptionist and she quickly confirmed out booking, filled in the paperwork and gave us our key. The room was on the third floor (there's only 5, its very cosy and nice, clean and charming) and we were absolutely thrilled when we got in, saw the room and especially our view! Now, the room was small, but for a weekend trip this shouldnt be a problem unless you are fussy about space. It was nicely decorated (blue and yellow), everything was good quality and clean and the overall feeling was very charming and French! The bathroom was a very positive surprise because it had a big window and a bathtub, all very modern and tastefully done (nice bathtub and new showerhead). And now to the view- from both windows (room and bathroom) we had a view of the Eiffel Tower! This, I imagine even in Paris, is by no means standard and I'm sure many people pay a lot more than we did to have it! It was so gorgeous at night (although the cynical Parisians apparently disagree ;) and an incredible perk for an already positive experience. We stayed for 3 days and have no complaints at all. We didnt have the breakfast though (which seems expensive-- its much nicer to go to a local bakery, I think), but all and all service was excellent (cleaning and receptionists) and our check-out was very quick and professionally handled. We both loved Paris and a big part of this was thanks to our very positive experience at the Duquesne. I WOULD ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL for anyone looking for a charming, private and conveniently located medium-range hotel- in fact, I'm sure it beats many hotels with more stars and fancier addresses- that's how good I thought it was!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: toon_two
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from paris, and stayed at the duquesne eiffel hotel. we stayed for 3 nights. the room we booked was a superior double. the staff on arrival and all through our stay were very friendly, the breakfast was always fresh and very filling. the room we had was No.55, on the top floor at the corner, it was smaller then we expected but very clean and the views were wonderful, the bathroom was also small but again it was spotlessly clean. the hotel reception staff booked an airport transfer for our retun to charles de gaulle airport through "yellow van", this was also very good, arrived ontime, lots of room, polite driver and arrived at the airport exaclty ontime. we will always recommend this hotel to friends and family who are thinking of going to paris. thank you duquesne eiffel hotel for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tehSAC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! The staff was one of the best staff I've ever had in a hotel. My wife has to have a fan to sleep at night and when we arrived our fan wouldn't work. So I went downstairs and asked if there was a place nearby to purchase a new fan. They told me not to worry and pulled one out of there own office for my wife to use. Now thats service! The only things I didn't care for was that the room smelled smoky, and the TV, and mini bar didn't work. That wasn't really a big deal, since we had other things to keep us occupied (psp, crosswords, etc) The hotel also was in a great location, a couple blocks from Napoleons Tomb, Eiffel tower, and a great bakery! I will stay here again, and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelmot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Duquesne for 3 days in early October and we had a wonderful time. We opened the door to our corner room on the 1st floor and the room was spotless with a clear view of the Eiffel Tower. We arrived after midnight and the guy at the front desk was very welcoming. His English was ok but he had said that breakfast was included in our price. Apparently it wasn't since at check out, we noticed breakfast was tacked on to our final amount. And at quite a hefty price too. That was the only issue though. Not sure on the size of the other rooms, but the corner rooms are generously sized (ask for a room that ends with a "5" which are the corner rooms). The shower/sink is separate from the toilet, but both were very clean. The Metro is just 2 blocks away (Ecole Militaire stop) and there are a couple cafes along the street. There is quite a bit of street/traffic noise during the day, but the windows actually do a great job in minimizing it. We had a hard time finding the street upon arrival so make sure you have good directions, perhaps from the hotel. Overall, had an excellent stay at the Duquesne.

Reviews.Title: “very recommanded”
Reviews.Author: Painpol
Reviews.Content: Date: 1 st of december 2006 We just returned from a splendid stay in this hotel (five nights)/Every thing was realy very pleasant.Very clean place and nice staff.Breakfast is relatively expensive and I recommand to have it outside the hotel. Two little problemes :The hotel is a bit far from the metro station and they have no free connection to internet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time in paris!”
Reviews.Author: leaman1006
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time we had¬! I took my husband he for a suprise birthday weekend. Paid extra for a superior room and am so glad i did. view was perfect, area was fab, lotss of places to eat although would recommend getting out for 7:30 ish to eat as we left it until about 8:45 pm one night and couldnt find and free tables, so busy! Hotel, perfect get what you pay for, clean, tidy and perfect location. Also went to Museum and Disneyland, was easy via metro and reasonable proce. Perfect would recommend for any one without a young family. Too small for youung family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aknelka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in a superior room, though it was on 1st floor, so we could see the Eiffel tower if we crooked our heads to see it between the trees. The room was not large (but not so small that we would feel cramped in it), it was actually OK for Paris, and everything in the room was functioning well (heating, lights, mini-fridge, etc). The toilet was separate from shower with sink, which was a bit strange. Staff were friendly, and spoke English. The area was also very nice. If you've been in Paris before, and just want a nice area calm area to stay in, I would definitely recomemnd this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As good as predicted”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo_Felani
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three-day visit to Paris to view some photo galleries. I stayed at the Duquesne because of the positive reviews and was not disappointed. I booked a superior room, which turned out to be on the top (5th) floor. It had a small balcony and a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was small but typical for a Paris hotel. Quiet, clean and well appointed and with a well-equipped bathroom. The price was Euro 145 a night. Continental breakfast plus scrambled eggs and bacon was an additional Euro 11. The staff was friendly and helpful and all spoke English very well. The Duquesne is in a pleasant neighborhood, a five-minute walk from the Metro (Ecole Militaire). I was a little concerned that the location would be too far from the middle of the downtown area, but if you like walking (and if the weather's good), you can get pretty much everywhere on foot without too much trouble. It's about 20 minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower, maybe 40-45 minutes to the Ile de la Cité, Notre Dame, Louvre, etc. Otherwise, a Metro pass will be money well spent as the subway in Paris will get you absolutely everywhere and the trains run every 4-5 minutes, if not even more frequently. It took me about an hour to get to the hotel from Charles De Gaulle airport, which was longer than I'd expected, so bear that in mind when planning your return.

Reviews.Title: “They had no room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend have only recently returned from weekend break in Paris. We booked the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel as it had such good reviews on trip advisors and as it was our first visit to Paris we thought it was a safe bet. Unfortunately this hotel was the only downfall of the weekend. When we arrived to book in we were told that a "regular customer" had decided to stay an extra night and that they had no room for us even though we had booked on line months before our trip. The hotel found us a room in a nearby hotel which we stayed in for our first night of the trip but then the next morning we had to check out of this hotel and head back to the Duquesne Eiffel hotel to check in, not an ideal situation. Another couple staying in the hotel the same weekend had a similar problem, they had a room but it was not the room they had booked. The hotel itself is quite nice, the staff are very friendly, the rooms are nice and the location is good too. When checking out of the hotel I paid by credit card, I then noticed a week later that the hotel had taken a further payment from my credit card, they never contacted me to say they were making a further deduction or give an explanation for the deduction. I'm currently waiting for them to come back to me on this! Over all I was very disappointed with this hotel and I wouldn't stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carroll2
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Paris where my two sisters and I spent three nights at the Duquesne Eiffel Hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area but is close enough to walk to all the attractions, great restaurants and shopping. While the room was a bit small according to American standards, it was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff could not have been more helpful. The desk clerks made reservations for dinner and had some good recommendations. They were most helpful in obtaining train schedules for the balance of our journey. The hotel is showing a few signs of age such as scuff marks on the walls in the hall, but our room was updated. I would definitely recommend this hotel. My overall experience in Paris was terrific - surprisingly, the only rude people were the cab drivers (probably a universal thing) and if you at least made an attempt to speak French, even those with limited English were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Harewood
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel - the rooms were spotless and the staff helpful and friendly. Although a little out of the centre we were able to walk to the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower and the Metro is only two blocks away. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with a few minor hiccups”
Reviews.Author: jdcooper
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are lovely. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We had a few hiccups during our stay which they smoothed out with a smile as quickly as possible. (Some issues with the room key, and also our reservation was mistakenly taken down for one night rather than two.) They were also helpful with restaurant reservations, metro directions, etc. We stayed in two 'superior' rooms at 180 euro per night. The first was pretty basic but acceptable - certainly nothing overtly super about it - clean to a reasonable standard but not to, say, 5 star standard. There were some scuff marks on the walls, slight peeling, etc, but the room did appear to have recieved care, just to be a little bit aging. The second was room 56, with a little balcony and a stunning view of the Eiffel Tower from the desk and from the bed. This room was much preferred! I'd ask for it by number if I stayed here again. The rooms are average European hotel sized, which Americans will find relatively small. This being Paris, you won't spend time in the room anyway. For our purposes, the location left a bit to be desired - however, we are a bit of a party couple in our late 20s and we like to be able to walk to nightlife. On the other hand, it's a 5 minute walk to the Metro and the hotel is in a lovely, quiet neighborhood. It was also quite easy to take a taxi back to the hotel provided one can remember how to say '23 Ave Duquesne' in French at the end of a night out! If I were looking for a peaceful relatively inexpensive hotel in Paris I'd definitely stay here again. I'd send my parents here, for example. But next time we come we will probably try to stay somewhere with a bit more street life. PS - I'd have to say the Rue Cler is our least favorite place in Paris by a wide margin. It's full of tourists from Ohio talking loudly in English and generally being annoying. No wonder people have a hard time in Paris when they act like that!

Reviews.Title: “Loved view & people at Duquesne Eiffel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mari-makun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this charming hotel following all the positive tripadvisor reviews. We made a right decision. We stayed in two different rooms: Room #25 for the first 4 nights, and in Room #56 for another 2 nights after coming back from our overnight trip to MSM/ San Malo. Both chambles were worth the rate -- cleaned everyday, hot nice shower always. Room #25 (on the second floor): Only the top 1/3 of the Tower Eiffel was seen, but the room was quite spacious for Paris standard -- two opened suites cases, no problem. Shower w/ bathtub, separate bathroom. Room #56 (on the top floor): Marvelous view of the Tower Eiffel through the window/ from the balcony, especially when lighted up at night. It even twinkled every hour, at 9, 10 11 and 12 midnight, which perfectly highlighted our stay in Paris. Though the room and bed were rather small, we fitted OK, but may not be such a recommendation for larger people. Shower w/ bathtub, bathroom in the same room. Service: All the staffs were always so pleasant. People at the reception spoke very good English and helped us finding our way getting around Paris, they were always quite busy helping out people. We also liked breakfast in our room, nice café and kind ladies who brought the plate with nice smile. Food (dinner): Our No.1 recommendation is 7 me Sud, 10 minutes from the hotel, on the Mont Piquet Ave, always packed with locals and tourists. Try their 20 euros course menu. I had Foie Gras as entrée, Dug Fillet as main plate, and candied pear w/ vanilla ice cream as dessert. The best a la carte was Escargot (in Takoyaki plate). Had two red wine (full-size bottle), and it was 85 euros. Mariko, Japan

Reviews.Title: “Completely exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Futuredesigner
Reviews.Content: We made a decision in July to go to Paris in September. Hotels recommended by friends were booked, but the Dusquene Eiffel was available. The great Trip Advisor reviews clinched it. The only room type available online was the comfort double, but the attentive staff responded with the offer of an upgrade to a superior room. Based on reviews, I chanced requesting Room 55, and it was available for four of the five nights we wanted. The fifth night was in room 25. The room and the hotel were wonderful. All rooms ending in 5 are corner rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower through french doors. Room 55 at the top of the hotel has the best view and a two-sided balcony from which you also can see Sacre Coeur and Les Invalides. The star attraction, of course, is the Eiffel Tower. At night, it sparkles in your window on the hour with the lights installed for the Millennium celebration. Magical, and surely one of the best views in all of Paris. Room 56 next door is smaller but also has direct views of the Tower from the bed. It would be nice if the hotel would put flower boxes and a couple of small chairs and a little table on the balcony. That would make it perfection. The hotel staff is everything the reviews say and more. They are knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and cheerful and will gladly suggest and make reservations at restaurants and even provide a computer-generated map to them. Even though we had been to Paris before, we really appreciated the advice of the staff. Special kudos to Amanda and Pritti. As others have said, Rue Cler is just a couple of blocks away behind the Ecole Militare Metro stop. This is a great place for coffee and a pain du chocolat in the morning though your table mates may be Americans armed with Rick Steve's Paris guide. There are wonderful cheese and chocolate shops and a nice patisserie. At the Ecole Militare Metro stop there is a small supermarket with a good selection of wine, fruit and staples. Use the Metro and invest in the Paris Visite pass, which is good for one to five days of unlimited public transit rides and discounts to some museums and attractions. Buy them at the Metro stations. We like mussels and went to one of the many Lyon de Bruxelles restaurants. It's a chain, but if moules are your passion, they are good and reasonably priced here. The nicest restaurant experience of the trip was at Fermette Marbeuf (5 Avenue Marbeuf). Its domed ceiling and tile work were enchanting and the food was superb. There's a 30 Euro fixed-price menu that is well worth selecting. We embellished it a bit, added wine and coffee and the tab was only 101 Euro, service included, for a special night of elegant service and wonderful cuisine. All in all, a lovely time at a lovely hotel with a lovely staff and a lovely view. A few reviewers seemed disenchanted with their rooms, but they seemed unused to the size of European hotel rooms and the prevalence of glass half-doors on showers. True, some of the rooms at Dusquene Eiffel are small and more basic, but if you can plan a little request room 55 or any of the corner rooms ending in 5. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna9999
Reviews.Content: Loved Paris but not the hotel . My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We had the standard double room since ttheir superior rooms were all booked out. So, no view of Eiffel Tower from room. Good location with easy access to the metro Room was small. Less than a 10x10 sq ft. Our bed was 2 twins pushed together which gets uncomfortable at times. However, room's window is soundproof. Blocks out all the street noises. A/C in the room didn't work but that didn't bother us since weather was cool the whole time we were there. Bathroom was small with peeling paint . Bathroom floor floods everytime either one of us take a shower due to it's half shower door. Tub size is standing room for one person. Hard to move around without bumping into the wall. Room does have LCD tv with CNN and BBC channels plus free porn channel after midnite. Overall, this is a good value hotel for the budget conscious travellers since it's located in the 7th district and within walking distance of Eiffel Tower. Wonderful front desk staff. Always courteous, friendly and made us feel welcome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Duquesne Eiffel
HotelInfo.Address: 23 Avenue Duquesne, 75007 Paris, France
